name: PILUM
description: This project is a feasibility study on the use of the electromagnetic railgun (EMRG) as a long-range artillery system. Due to the significantly higher projectile velocities that can be achieved with an EMRG compared to conventional artillery, strike distances up to 200 km and above can be envisaged. The combination of both the EMRG and novel hypervelocity projectiles results in the disruptive concept of a future complementary artillery system. The project will further examine the possibility of integrating the EMRG into terrestrial and naval platforms.

name: GEODE
description: GEODE will prototype, test and qualify multiple Galileo PRS enabled Positioning, Navigation and Timing (PNT) navigation solutions for defence specific requirements and applications (7 PRS Security Modules, 9 PRS receivers, 4 GPS/Galileo PRS compatible Controlled Radiation Pattern Antennas) and a European PNT test & Qualification Facility. A PRS infrastructure will also be developed to ensure the availability of the security assets necessary for the operational testing of the receivers. Military operational field-testing will be organised on Naval and Land platforms, RPAS, Timing and Synchronisation system in multiple Member States. Related PESCO project: EURAS

name: TRANSFLYTOR - Troop Transportation Flying Vector
description: TRANSFLYTOR aims to design a high-speed vessel equipped with retractable hydrofoil systems for rapid military interventions at sea. The project “Troop Transportation Flying Vector” (TRANSFLYTOR) will design a disruptive high-speed 20m long vessel, using ground-breaking retractable hydrofoil systems. The vessel will be able to navigate using hydrofoils on deep sea during transit phases, and without hydrofoils in shallow waters or during approach phases.

name: ACHILE
indexText: {"tags":[],"callName":"Soldier & logistic systems","topicName":"Development of full-size demonstrators for soldier systems"}
topicName: Development of full-size demonstrators for soldier systems

name: Conducting joint investigations with foreign partner services in the field of human trafficking
description: The Directorate General for the Fight against Organized Crime is a national specialized body with competence in the field of combating organized crime and human trafficking. As a form of cross-border organized crime, trafficking in human beings is regulated in a large number of national, European and international legal acts, due to its international appearance and the extent to which it affects both the economic and social development of the countries. The formation and conduct of joint investigation teams with foreign services is an extremely important element in the fight against cross-border organized crime, leading to an efficient investigation throughout the EU. The team includes representatives of the prosecution, operatives, investigative police officers, investigators and others. The usual duration of investigation teams is about 1 year. The implementation of this activity will contribute to the expansion of measures in the fight against serious and organized crime, including financial and economic crimes, in the field of human trafficking. In the implementation of the project it is planned to conduct joint investigations with foreign services in the field of human trafficking, by forming joint investigation teams.

name: Support for the CDCOC for the implementation of EMPACT activities
description: The Directorate General for the Fight against Organized Crime is the responsible leader of activities under the Operational Action Plans in priority areas, part of the Multiannual Strategic Plan within the 4-year EU policy cycle for the fight against serious and international organized crime. The project proposal provides the necessary support to enable these activities to be carried out in the most optimal way and to ensure a high level of security within the Union. The target group of the project are the employees of the General Directorate for Combating Organized Crime - Ministry of Interior, citizens of the Republic of Bulgaria and the EU. The main objective of the project is to achieve a high level of security within the Union by increasing the institutional capacity to prevent and combat cross-border, serious and organized crime, in accordance with Regulation (EU) №513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council, and the specific objective is the prevention of crime, the fight against cross-border, serious and organized crime. The expected results are: - Improved interoperability and interaction of the CDCOC with partner law enforcement agencies in the implementation of activities of the Operational Action Plans related to the EU priorities in the fight against organized and serious international crime: "Cannabis, Cocaine and Heroin" and "Cybercrime "(Misuse of electronic payment instruments); - Improved exchange of operational information with partners from the network of third country law enforcement agencies; - Increasing the technical capacity, efficiency and effectiveness of the CDCOC in combating cross-border, organized and serious crime. The main activities of the project will be working visits to the EU and / or third countries in order to exchange operational information with partners from the network of third country law enforcement agencies and supply specialized operational equipment. The project activities will be implemented on the territory of the EU and / or third countries.

name: Supply of equipment for effective OID with partner services for counteracting OCG
description: The General Directorate for Combating Organized Crime has 18 territorial sectors that ensure the fight against cross-border and organized crime at the national level. The fact that almost all territorial sectors are the internal or external border of the Union, as well as the specifics of organized crime, redefine the conduct of many search operations together with partner services from neighboring countries. Motor vehicles are a daily and mandatory tool for conducting successful operational and investigative activities to counter and detect criminal activity carried out by cross-border and organized criminal groups, and through the implementation of the project will be delivered 18 new off-road motor vehicles. The expected results are delivered specialized equipment for operative-search activities together with partner services from neighboring countries and increase of the efficiency of the operative-search activities together with partner services from neighboring countries. The main activity of the project will be the supply of new off-road vehicles for effective search operations conducted by the General Directorate for Combating Organized Crime, together with partner services from neighboring countries to combat serious and organized crime.

name: Improving the qualification of consular officers and employees of the Central Office of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
description: The project is aimed at improving the qualification, administrative and expert capacity in the field of visa policy and EU and Schengen legislation of consular officials seconded to Bulgarian foreign missions abroad, as well as officials from the central administration of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs. As part of the long-term efforts of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to strengthen training activities and practices in the field of European and Schengen legislation and work with EU visa information systems, specialized trainings for trainers will be conducted in order to meet the growing needs and needs of providing their own training. capacity of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in the various theoretical and practical aspects of visa policy. The project will also include study visits of Foreign Ministry officials or Bulgarian consular officers to consular offices in third countries of different Schengen Member States to acquire practical knowledge and skills and ensure the exchange of experience in the implementation of their professional skills. obligations. Expected results: • Increasing the practical experience and knowledge of the Bulgarian consular staff for the efficient implementation of the EU legal instruments in the field of security of the EU external borders, uniform application of the Schengen acquis, harmonization of visa practices, better consular presence and improving the quality of service for visa applicants while respecting fundamental freedoms and human rights. • Capacity building of consular staff through study visits to third country consulates, training courses, including training of trainers and exchange of best practices.

name: Modernization of the National Coordination Center in Sofia
description: A National Coordination Center (NCC) has been established and operates in the General Directorate of Border Police. The center implements activities under the European Border Surveillance System EUROSUR, creates a national situational picture at the external borders, collects and processes operational information from all structures of the DGGP and coordinates the activities of the structures involved in border control. The implementation of the project aims to build a building with separate premises to optimize the work in the NCC, by expanding the working space, introduction of new jobs for operators of the integrated system of sea and Bulgarian-Turkish border, introduction of new jobs for on-duty analysts, expansion of locations in the NCC International Coordination Center and construction of a hall for video-conference calls. A crisis crisis management center and a server room will be established. Upgrading the analytical layer of the national situational picture by providing access to the Analytical level of the EUROSUR system will improve the awareness of the situation at the borders of the country.

name: Post-warranty car maintenance
description: The implementation of the project ensures reliable operation of the delivered vehicles, which requires the adoption of measures for their maintenance and timely elimination of damage. The car warranty has expired and post-warranty maintenance and repairs are required. The use of technically sound automotive equipment will improve the mobility and efficiency of border police patrols and posts in detecting and apprehending border trespassers, reducing the time to intervene to detect and detain large groups of illegal immigrants, and increase border crossings. security.

name: Assessment of the threats from organized crime in Bulgaria
description: The project aims to prepare an annual independent assessment of the risks and threats of organized crime in Bulgaria. The assessment will assist the Ministry of Interior in preparing a comprehensive annual strategic assessment of threats and will improve the results of the fight against organized crime by contributing to more effective and independent Evidence formulation of operational and strategic priorities and specific countermeasures. The project will assist Bulgaria's contribution to the preparation of the Serious and Organized Crime Threat Assessment (SOCTA) and the selection of priorities in the fight against crime and Europol's multi-annual strategic plans. independent data from sociological and criminological surveys collected through validated methodologies developed by the EU, good practices in Member States, as well as official data provided by government institutions. Assessment methodologies developed and tested in BOCTA project, in which the CSD, the Ministry of Interior, the National Revenue Agency and the Customs, with the help of British, Belgian and Dutch police services, prepared the first independent Threat Assessment in Bulgaria.

name: Ongoing maintenance and modernization of buildings and premises for border control
description: The project will contribute to supporting the integrated management and security of the EU's external borders and increase the capacity of the General Directorate of Border Police to carry out border control tasks through ongoing maintenance and modernization of buildings and premises needed for border control. and for the organization and implementation of border surveillance between external border checkpoints. It will also contribute to the observance of the fundamental rights and human dignity of third-country nationals accommodated on the premises of the DGGP. In particular, activities should contribute to compliance with the provisions of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union, the European Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms and the principle of fair treatment of third-country nationals.

name: Update and expansion of the hardware and software of the National DNA and AFIS database. Update and extension of the hardware equipment and software of the Automated Ballistic Research Identification System (ABIS) and inclusion in the Ballistic Information Network (IBIN) ", BG / ISF-SO5-NO2-A26
description: The project is aimed at updating one of the national databases, expanding its capabilities and including it in international data exchange. Improving the exchange of data for two other national databases will also be implemented. As a result of the project will be achieved: - Increasing the speed and reliability of the ABIS system, increasing its functionality by including automated inspection of bullet marks and international exchange of ballistic information within the Interpol network - IBIN; -Increasing the capacity of the National DNA Database by including the profiles of registered persons and automating the processes of DNA profiling of persons with police registration; - Increasing the efficiency of the AFIS system in the process of processing fingerprints and traces and their identification.

name: Training of DGF staff to ensure and uniform application of EU law
description: The project envisages conducting specialized training in order to deepen and expand the acquired specialized and methodological knowledge and skills of employees to conduct specialized training at the workplace; raising the professional qualification of the employees in order to acquire a unified approach for practical application of the requirements for control of the EU external borders, limiting the migratory pressure on the Republic of Bulgaria, counteracting the illegal migration and the illegal crossing of the border. There will also be foreign language training in order to acquire initial knowledge of the respective language and increase the foreign language training of employees in order to actively participate in joint operations organized and coordinated by the Frontex Agency, as well as increase training to ensure security. at European borders. The knowledge and skills acquired by employees will lead to a unified approach to the practical application of the requirements for control of the EU's external borders.

name: Maintenance and development of the Unified Administrative Register - control of generally dangerous means in its part for communication with external information systems in order to prevent and detect crimes
description: The project will contribute to the development of EAR - CBS in the part of communication with information systems of the Ministry of Interior for prevention and detection of crimes, data processing and their use in the register, introduction of new functionalities, design of new types of reports, changes in existing solutions , in order to improve their performance and eliminate gaps. The implementation of the project will lead to the improvement of the communication with EU member states and the European communication systems in the part related to the identification and monitoring of explosives and connection to the Information Exchange Network, according to Art. 12 of Directive 93/15 / EEC.

name: Providing access to the ICAO PKD system
description: The project provides the fee for the annual participation and access of the Republic of Bulgaria to the directory of public keys to ICAO. The system allows for the exchange of certificates for passive authentication of documents with electronic media. The installation of "Document signer" keys activates certificates for signing documents and signing residence permits, with which Bulgaria gives access to other ICAO member states for verification of the documents issued by it. Bulgaria gets access to verify the authenticity of the data in electronic documents issued by other Member States. In the long run, the project will contribute to facilitating the passage through electronic counters at airports and borders of holders of travel documents with electronic media, while at the same time verifying the authenticity of the document, which contributes to a higher level. of protection and security against forged documents.

name: Development of the Bulgarian Passenger Data Unit (BGPIU)
description: The project includes activities aimed at developing and improving the communication and information infrastructure of the National Unit for receiving and processing data on air passengers in the Republic of Bulgaria (National Unit), including improving its ability to analyze and provide information. The project activities are fully compliant with the needs of the target group and the requirements for achieving better operational capabilities and technical support of the unit. It is planned to deliver and install communication and information equipment and development of the systems for analysis and control of the unit by acquiring the necessary software products; providing post-warranty maintenance and licenses for the currently used equipment, purchase of equipment for the main communication and information center (CCIC) and reserve communication and information center (RCIC), jobs and for one training center. The project will carry out on-site visits to learn about the structure and practice of passenger data processing units in the EU and in third countries with longer or more practical experience, as well as in relation to ensuring participation. of experts in meetings of the Informal Working Group for Discussion of Operational Issues of the EU Passenger Data Units, chaired on a rotating basis by the Member States, events discussing issues related to the security of the CIS of the National Unit, meetings, working meetings organized by OSCE / WCO / IATA / ICAO, PNRGOV working group. Information materials will be prepared and disseminated in accordance with the requirements of the program and EU rules. Expected results: The implementation of the project activities will achieve full compliance with the current requirements for the functioning of the National Unit, according to European and national legislation in the field of use of passenger data for law enforcement purposes, for prevention, detection, investigation and prosecution of terrorist offenses. and serious crimes. The information system for receiving, processing and providing reservation data to passengers will be further developed by improving the functionalities and analytical capacity, as well as with regard to the components related to the control over the data processing. The further development of the information and communication infrastructure of the National Unit will contribute to the improvement of the technical and administrative capacity of the country in the fight against terrorism and serious and organized crime, supporting the work of the competent authorities by providing timely and reliable information to passengers. Through the planned seminars, site visits and participation in working groups, the capacity of the employees of the National Unit for receiving and processing data for the passengers in the Republic of Bulgaria, transported by air, will be increased.

name: Establishment of a center for research of CIS security at strategic sites part of CI
description: The project aims to create a center for security research (Center) in SANS. The Center will provide capacity for specialized research activities in the Agency, the results of which will be applied in the daily work of the Security Accreditation Authority (SAC) of AIS / M for classified information, the Cryptographic Security Authority (CAB) and the structure providing counteraction against destructive effects on CIS. The Center will study, analyze and evaluate CIS and means for their protection, methods and means, algorithms for cryptographic protection of information, vulnerabilities of CIS for strategic objects and for classified information and means of security for them. Specialized hardware and software with the necessary computing resources for modeling communication and information systems, resources for storing information from tests and information about vulnerabilities and weaknesses of tested systems and sites and communication equipment will be delivered, installed and put into operation. Employees will be trained to work with them. Delivery of office equipment and furniture is also planned. Within the project, specialized trainings will be conducted in the field of modern approaches and methods and means for protection of CIS. The trainings will provide the necessary additional knowledge and skills of the employees in connection with the activity of the Center. Participation of experts in thematic forums in the field of methods for protection and security of CIS - cryptographic security and security of AIS and networks for classified information in the Republic of Bulgaria, EU member states and third countries is envisaged. Guidelines / models will be developed to increase the security of CIS at strategic sites, part of the critical infrastructure, containing minimum cybersecurity standards, which will be supplemented in the further activities of the Center.

name: Construction of a specialized border control point on the Danube River in Vidin
description: The project envisages the construction of a specialized checkpoint and the creation of conditions for joint border control of vessels with the Romanian border authorities on the Danube in Vidin, in order to increase border security, support integrated management and increase the security of The EU's external borders, including temporary external borders, provide for the modernization of the building stock, strengthening and completion of the quay wall, rehabilitation of technical infrastructure and supply of technical equipment and furniture for effective border control along the Danube.

name: Delivery of gas analyzers
description: The project is part of the activities that will contribute to ensuring, on the one hand, an equal and high level of control and protection of the external borders, including by tackling illegal immigration, and, on the other hand, the smooth crossing of the external borders. of Schengen law. Delivery of technical means and equipment is envisaged.

name: Development of UC Montana, in order to train the competent authorities for the protection of ECI and CBRN
description: Development, modernization and increase of the capacity of the training center of the Ministry of Interior - Montana, as well as development of the existing training modules for courses and exercises in the field of chemical, biological, radiation and nuclear protection and protection of critical infrastructure. New training modules will be introduced, as well as trainings for critical infrastructure protection and chemical, biological, radiation and nuclear protection.

name: Protective equipment and consumables for protection, prevention of the spread of COVID-19
description: The specific epidemiological situation requires the provision of the border police officers responsible for border control and surveillance with personal protective equipment and clothing in the performance of their duties. The provision of these means and clothing is of paramount necessity for the smooth performance of the tasks assigned to them, related to the provision of effective border guards. Adequate prevention measures are necessary for the smooth implementation of border control and monitoring in the implementation of anti-epidemic measures and social distancing, as this will increase the opportunities to limit the spread of COVID-19 and ensure adequate conditions for health protection. of staff involved in the management of the EU's external borders. The Medical Institute of the Ministry of Interior, as a partner will participate in the project for the supply of personal protective equipment and consumables to protect the health of police officers and prevent the spread of COVID-19 for the needs of employees involved in security activities as experts in the part with the preparation of technical specifications, regarding the purchase of protective clothing, disinfectant materials, etc. Equipment and personal protective equipment will be provided to the employees and structural units of RDGP Burgas, RDGP Elhovo, RDGP Smolyan, RDGP Kyustendil, RDGP Dragoman, RDGP Ruse, and RDGP Airports. It is envisaged to install cameras for the 7 RDGPs, and to provide manual thermal cameras for the structural units / GPU and BGPK / of RDGP. At present, border control is carried out at all borders of the Republic of Bulgaria and the employees of DGGP are in constant contact with different groups of citizens from different countries. Expected result: Increased opportunities to limit the spread of Kovid-19 and ensure adequate conditions to protect the health of employees involved in the management of the EU's external borders.

name: Improving the mobility of the CDCOC for the effective investigation of organized crime
description: Motor vehicles are used in almost every action of employees in their work to counter, detect and document criminal activity carried out by cross-border and organized criminal groups. The main objective of the project is to achieve a high level of security within the Union by increasing the institutional capacity to prevent and combat cross-border, serious and organized crime, in accordance with Regulation (EU) № 513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council, and the specific objective is the prevention of crime, the fight against cross-border, serious and organized crime. The expected results are increased efficiency and effectiveness of the DGCOC-Ministry of Interior in combating cross-border, organized and serious crime, as well as increased mobility of employees of the General Directorate "Fight against Organized Crime" to effectively investigate and combat cross-border, serious and organized crime. . The main activity of the project will be delivery of new motor vehicles for the needs of GDBOP-MI

name: Construction, development and maintenance of automated police information systems
description: The project aims to contribute to the development of a common policy to ensure a high level of security in the Union, while supporting actions to improve coordination between bodies working in the field of police cooperation, improving access to and exchange of information, the availability of effective and secure information and communication systems of the Ministry of Interior, according to Regulation (EU) № 513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council. With the implementation of the project will be further developed in terms of construction and operation of automated information systems used in the daily work of employees of the Ministry of Interior.

name: Carrying out construction, reconstruction, modernization and repair of consular services
description: The project is aimed at building new construction and strengthening the building stock, premises, adjacent infrastructure, equipment, technical means and organization of consular services of the Republic of Bulgaria in third countries in order to bring them in line with the requirements and best practices of Schengen and preparation of the consular services in full technical readiness for fulfillment of the requirements of the process of issuing Schengen visas for future full membership in the Schengen area. Expected results: • Consular services brought in line with the requirements of the best Schengen practices, as well as the construction of additional biometric counters in the services with the largest number of issued visas in order to serve a larger number of applicants. • Built and / or renovated and / or modernized consular services.

name: Post-warranty maintenance of helicopters
description: The project aims to preserve the operational capabilities of helicopters to perform daily, specific and urgent tasks of control and surveillance of the state border of the Republic of Bulgaria, which is an external border for the European Union. Continuous operational use of helicopters will be ensured, with minimum deadlines for "stay on the ground" due to technical malfunctions. Also, the implementation of the project will ensure efficiency in the implementation of the tasks of control and monitoring of the state border.

name: Development and modernization of NOC and OOC
description: Development and modernization of RECs and regional operational centers by building a basic infrastructure for emergency response, including expansion of the radio coverage of the TETRA system to provide a communication environment in the interaction of protection structures in the area of European Critical Infrastructure (ECI) and the population. The specific objectives of the project are: - Ensuring connectivity and new functionality of NOC, OC to RDPBZN, Regional Services "Fire Safety and Protection of the Population" and the sectors "Specialized Operational Activities" (SOD) at GDPBZN; - Providing conditions for timely assessment of the situation and making an informed management decision in case of security-related accidents; - Improving the opportunities for interaction of the structures for protection of the population and of the ECI; - Upgrading and acquiring new functional capabilities of the TETRA system.

name: Providing reliable post-warranty support of an integrated system for control and monitoring of the Bulgarian-Turkish border in the section from Kapitan Andreevo border checkpoint to Lesovo border checkpoint
description: Supporting the integrated management and increasing the security of the external borders of the EU and ensuring the continuous operation of the established integrated system for monitoring and control along the Bulgarian-Turkish border of the Republic of Bulgaria.

name: Building secure and reliable communication links for the needs of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Bulgaria
description: An independent and secure communication link between the National Visa Center and consular offices and diplomatic missions will be established, which will enable the exchange of personal and biometric data, as well as the necessary information related to the integration of VLSI with EU-VIS, which is essential. for the integration of the information systems under the Schengen instrument, VLSI, as well as other important information systems.

name: Modernization and increase of efficiency in protection against bomb terrorism and increase of the capacity of physico-chemical research. Modernization of the training material base and increase of the quality and efficiency of the shooting and tactical training of the employees of SOBT and the employees of ODMVR in the country ", BG / ISF-SO5-NO1-A23
description: The project aims to increase the capacity of SOBT-Ministry of Interior to prevent accidents with the use of improvised explosive devices for terrorist purposes and increase the ability to respond to crises and terrorist attacks. The project envisages the supply of equipment for protection against bomb terrorism and increasing the capacity for physico-chemical research of explosives and their elements, as well as construction and installation works for the construction of a computerized training shooting center for training of specialized units of the Ministry of Interior. the capacity of officers to respond to terrorist attacks, fight serious and organized crime. The specific objectives of the project are: - delivered specialized equipment in the field of protection against bomb terrorism; - A computerized training shooting center has been built for the training of the specialized units of the Ministry of Interior; - delivered specialized equipment for the physico-chemical examination of explosives and elements of explosive devices; - conducted specialized trainings for increasing the capacity of the employees of the Ministry of Interior

name: Completion of N.SIS by providing additional functionality
description: The Republic of Bulgaria has been fully participating in the Schengen Information System since 2010 with the National Component of the System and the National Communication Interface established and maintained by the Ministry of Interior. Since April 2013, the national system has been part of the second generation Schengen Information System (SIS2). With the consistent implementation of many years of activity, the Republic of Bulgaria guarantees secure and reliable access to SIS2 and keeping the data in the system up to date. Ensuring reliable operation of the technical resources and software of the system, as well as guaranteeing trouble-free operation and up-to-dateness of N.SIS2, requires the undertaking of measures for gradual replacement and upgrading of the system and software equipment and acquisition of new ones. The implementation of the activities planned under the project will ensure the achievement of the planned results: - SIS II provided for full recovery after failure / plan for continuous operation. - Optimized structure of N.SIS (technical means and software) in accordance with the modern development of SIS at European level.

name: Improving cooperation between joint contact points
description: The project for the Bulgarian Joint Contact Centers (JCCs) for police and customs cooperation is related to the fact that these centers should be further established as a channel for fast and timely information exchange, while implementing the European guidelines for best practices for police cooperation. and customs in respect of tasks such as: - the collection and exchange of information; - assisting the competent authorities in the border areas; - Contribute to the analysis of cross-border crime by reporting statistical information. The project envisages a visit of the JCC in Europe and holding meetings at national and regional level on the territory of Bulgaria. Expected results: - Improved professional qualification, knowledge and practical experience of employees engaged in activities related to analysis and assessment of threats, risks and impacts; - Improved cooperation with other relevant services in neighboring countries related to the work of the established JCCs with Turkey, Greece, Romania, Serbia and Northern Macedonia

name: Delivery of new patrol and specialized vehicles with normal and increased terrain
description: The project is part of the activities that will contribute to ensuring, on the one hand, an equal and high level of control and protection of external borders, including by tackling illegal immigration, and, on the other hand, smooth crossing of external borders in line with the achievements. of Schengen law. Delivery of specialized vehicles for effective border control is envisaged.

name: Post-warranty maintenance of an automated system for technical surveillance of the Bulgarian-Serbian border in the area of GPU Kalotina
description: Supporting integrated management and increasing the security of the EU external borders and ensuring the continuous operation of the established automated system for technical surveillance of the Bulgarian-Serbian border in the area of GPU Kalotina.

name: Construction of systems for video surveillance and control of vehicles through border checkpoints at the external borders.
description: Within the project, an integrated video surveillance system will be built at the border checkpoints of the Republic of Bulgaria by providing protection of the respective border area and control of the vehicles crossing the border checkpoints at the external borders. New video surveillance systems will be built at the border checkpoints at external borders with a central component. Delivery, installation and integration of hardware equipment and specialized software at the border checkpoints at external borders is envisaged.

name: Supply of technical equipment to police officers working on prevention and counteraction to trafficking in human beings and drugs
description: The project will contribute to achieving a high level of security within the Union by increasing the institutional capacity to prevent and combat serious and organized crime, in accordance with Regulation (EU) №513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council. The set concrete results are: - delivered vehicles; - delivered IT equipment and software; - delivered specialized machinery and equipment for counteracting cross-border, serious and organized crime.

name: Providing reliable post-warranty support of the integrated system "Blue Border
description: Supporting the integrated management and increasing the security of the external borders of the European Union and ensuring the continuous operation of the established integrated system "Blue Border".

name: Supply of specialized equipment for effective border control at external borders, including computer and office equipment
description: The implementation of the project will support the integrated border management and the implementation of border control by acquiring new IT equipment and peripherals for the structures of DGGP and specialized equipment of border checkpoints. External border control and surveillance systems and inter-agency cooperation will be strengthened. Measures within the territory related to the management of the external borders and the necessary accompanying measures on document security, identity management and interoperability of the acquired technical equipment will be increased.

name: Post-warranty maintenance of ships
description: The project is part of the activities that will contribute to ensuring, on the one hand, an equal and high level of control and protection of external borders, including by tackling illegal immigration, and, on the other hand, smooth crossing of external borders in line with the achievements. of Schengen law. Reliable operation of the delivered border police ships (CPC), ship equipment and equipment mounted on them and increase the security of crews during patrols and participation in SPO, which requires measures to maintain them and timely removal of damage. It will also ensure efficiency in the implementation of the tasks set for control and surveillance of the state border, as well as will ensure the continuous operational use of ships, with minimum deadlines for "stay" due to technical malfunctions.

name: Organization of a Center for Monitoring and Response to Cyber Incidents at SANS.
description: The aim of the project is to organize a Center for Monitoring and Response to Cyber Incidents at SANS. The project is aimed at acquiring specialized equipment for the Center for Monitoring and Incident Response at SANS with a significant detrimental impact on the CIS of strategic sites and activities that are important for national security. The establishment of the center is based on the requirements of Article 15, paragraph 2 of the Cyber Security Act. A module for response to cyber incidents in CIS processing classified information will be created within the center. With regard to strategic sites, the center will perform tasks on: monitoring and collecting information on events and incidents related to the security of communication and information systems of strategic sites and activities that are important for national security; filing cyber-threat warnings and information; providing methodological assistance in the process of managing cyber incidents; providing a comprehensive analysis of the incoming information and assessment of the information protection of the constituents of the State Agency "National Security". The Center will maintain readiness for a coordinated joint response within the National Coordination and Organizational Network for Cyber Security in the event of incidents related to the security of communication and information systems of strategic sites and activities that are important for national security. To respond to cyber incidents in CIS processing classified information, the center will perform tasks on: analysis and prevention of cyber incidents in the absence of communication connectivity, providing methodological assistance in the process of managing cyber incidents and providing analysis of incoming information. The center, which will be built within the project will support the implementation of functions under Art. 4, para. 1, item 10 of the Law on the State Agency "National Security". Expected result: Established Center for Monitoring and Response of Incidents with Significant Damage to the Communication and Information Systems (CIS) of Strategic Objects and Activities, part of the Critical Infrastructure (CI) important for national security, with an adjacent CIS incident information system for CI. Acquired and applied practical experience and good practices of partner services in the EU. Improving the qualification of the employees working in SANS and the strategic sites. Provided information protection of strategic sites, part of the critical infrastructure.

name: Building a system for electronic exchange of information related to the use of SRS
description: Establishment of a system for electronic exchange of information in real time (the system), related to the use and application of special intelligence means (SRS), with administrator State Agency "Technical Operations" (DATO) and access points - the applicants within the meaning of Art. 13 of the Special Intelligence Means Act (SSAA). Initially, the system will include 6 access points located in the State Agency for National Security, Sofia Directorate of Interior, General Directorate for Combating Organized Crime, Commission for Combating Corruption and Confiscation of Illegally Acquired Property, General Directorate for National Security. police "and the Regional Directorate of the Ministry of Interior - Plovdiv. The system will be able to expand and include new applicants. The main goal is to achieve a fast and efficient exchange of information with applicants; increase the efficiency in the implementation of the RCC and optimize the activities of DATO to combat serious and organized crime and achieve a high level of security within the Union. The project proposal fully complies with the general framework set in the National Multiannual Program of Bulgaria for support from the Internal Security Fund for the period 2014-2020, as well as Regulation (EC) №513 / 2014 of the European Parliament and the Council. The expected results are through the application of modern information systems to increase the efficiency in counteracting the serious and organized crime and terrorism and protection of the national security of the Republic of Bulgaria. The exchange of information and cooperation between the bodies at national level working to prevent and detect serious crimes under the Penal Code and to protect national security will be improved. The goal and the expected results will be achieved through: building a system for electronic exchange of information in real time, related to the use and application of SRS, training to work with it, delivery of information board and stickers with the FVS logo.

name: Reducing the level of corruption among the patrol and traffic police by introducing video surveillance in police cars
description: The project will contribute to increasing the effectiveness of anti-corruption measures among employees involved in road traffic control and safety, strengthening the capacity to fight corruption by reducing the level of corruption among patrol and traffic police by introducing video surveillance in police cars, in accordance with Regulation (EU) №513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council. Technical equipment for video surveillance of cars of the Ministry of Interior will be delivered and installed

name: Airport risk assessment training. Development of a methodology for "Profiling".
description: The project aims to develop a methodology for "Profiling" to identify potential perpetrators of terrorist activities. The development of the methodology requires cooperation with law enforcement authorities of member states that have and apply such a methodology. In this regard, visits to international European airports and on-site acquaintance with the implemented activities are envisaged. Based on a study of the operational situation and the specifics of passenger traffic at Bulgarian airports, indicators should be developed to establish atypical behavior for the environment - derived from behavioral models related to the way of anticipation, way of communication, emotional state. After the development of the methodology, testing is envisaged within the planned trainings of the border police officers carrying out activities in the areas of the international airports. The operational and administrative capacity of the DGCP to counter and prevent terrorist threats and risks in the areas of international airports will be increased.

name: Delivery of specialized equipment and vehicles for the purposes of operational and investigative activities
description: The operative-search services of DG Border Police carry out activities for counteraction and investigation of crimes committed in the border area, at the border checkpoints and on the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria. Most of the crimes investigated are cross-border in nature and the negative consequences of criminal activity affect two or more countries. In this regard, timely interaction with the partner services of neighboring countries is key to taking measures to curb criminal activity. Joint operations involving the services of two or more neighboring countries are an effective way of countering criminal activity, achieving the complete elimination of a criminal group. Within these operations, information is exchanged, which is verified, in most cases through operational means. Some of these methods are the surveillance of persons and vehicles, their movement, verification and monitoring of addresses. The quality of the information received depends largely on the available technical equipment, and the ability of the services to respond adequately and prevent negative consequences is directly dependent on the availability of a secure channel for information exchange. This is especially true when conducting activities in areas where there is no coverage of mobile operators In itself, this technical equipment would be useless or with minimal effect, unless it is mounted on a vehicle to facilitate the services in the performance of their duties. The widely used cars in the system of the Ministry of Interior, even those used by the operative-search units are easily recognizable and in this connection their equipment with additional equipment to be used for operational purposes would have a small added value. In order to increase the efficiency of the activities carried out by the law enforcement authorities, the delivered technical equipment should be installed on new cars, similar to the widely used ones. Expected results: • Increasing the efficiency of the work of the operative-investigative bodies of DGGP; • Improving the technical capacity of DGGP to conduct effective operational and investigative activities; • Delivered specialized equipment for operational and investigative activities to combat crime.

name: Building a specialized operational system for combating crime in the Ministry of Interior
description: This project proposal will be implemented by the Internal Security Directorate, as a specific beneficiary, given its specific competence in preventing, intercepting and detecting crimes committed by Interior Ministry officials, as well as in the implementation of measures to prevent and counter corruption in the system. It aims to increase the efficiency of the employees of the directorate in the implementation of search operations on the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria. Through the specialized operational equipment for mobile surveillance, communication, control, registration and recording of information it will be possible to exchange one with existing systems in the Ministry of Interior, for collection and analysis of video information, which will provide an opportunity for subsequent video analysis to facilitate and automates the work of the employees of the Ministry of Interior. To achieve this goal, activities are planned for the construction of an automated audio and video communication system with mobile operating stations to prevent illegal actions by the employees of the Ministry of Interior. The expected results of the project activities are: • Developed automated audio and video communication system with 5 mobile stations for direct operational connections, coordination and control; • Increased technical capacity of the Internal Affairs Ministry for the effectiveness of operational and investigative activities for detection and prevention of crimes committed by police officers. • Reducing the level of corruption among the employees of the Ministry of Interior. • Applied more effective anti-corruption measures. The impact of the results will be: preventive and cross-cutting action; supporting the detection and investigation of corruption, etc. illegal actions of MoI employees. The measures introduced through the automated audio and video communication systems will favor the reduction of the level of corruption in the Ministry of Interior and the corrupt acts carried out among the employees.

name: Providing post-warranty support for established TETRA systems at the external borders and the National component of the Schengen Information System.
description: The project aims to contribute to the development of a common policy to ensure a high level of security in the Union, while supporting actions to improve coordination between police cooperation bodies, improve access to and exchange of information, the availability of effective and secure information and communication systems of the Ministry of Interior, according to Regulation (EU) №515 / 2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council. The project will ensure: - reliable and continuous operation through post-warranty maintenance of the integrated radiocommunication system of the Ministry of Interior according to the TETRA standard; - post-warranty maintenance of technical and software tools to ensure continuity and maintenance of the components of N.SIS

name: Delivery of computer equipment and other equipment / provision for them
description: The implementation of the project will achieve: 1. Supporting the integrated management and increasing the security of the borders of the Republic of Bulgaria and the EU 2. Modernization of the technical means and equipment for effective control of the external borders, including temporary external and EU borders, for which the Republic of Bulgaria is responsible. 3. Increasing the efficiency in providing specific electronic services for the structures of the General Directorate "Border Police". 4. Improving the technical capacity of the General Directorate of Border Police. Expected results: Increased security of Bulgaria and the European Union through modernization of technical means and purchase of equipment for effective control of external borders, incl. and the temporary external borders for which the Republic of Bulgaria is responsible.

name: Strengthen the capacity of the Police to combat illegal waste trafficking
description: Current trends in the dynamic development of the economy and technology are also reflected in the field of crime. In this regard, environmental protection is becoming increasingly important. This project is in line with the Bulgarian national priorities in this direction, as well as addresses the activities set at European level under the Operational Action Plan for 2019 within the policy cycle "EMPACT" - priority "Crimes against the Environment", in particular illegal waste trafficking. The Republic of Bulgaria, through GDNP - Ministry of Interior, has confirmed its commitment to participate in operational activities related to the fight against illegal waste trafficking. Activities directly addressing the needs are envisaged, namely the purchase of computer equipment to provide information connectivity concerning access to Internet-based information registers for ferrous and non-ferrous metal waste, dismantling of end-of-life vehicles, activities with hazardous waste, etc. In view of the need to exchange experience and know-how at European level, the project also envisages a study visit in an appropriate structure of an EU Member State with solid expertise in the field of waste trafficking and related document fraud (eg the Italian Carabinieri Service). ). At the national level it is planned to conduct trainings with the participation of Bulgarian and foreign lecturers (again if possible from the Italian Carabinieri Service) for identification of different types of fraud, acquaintance with technical means (tracking devices, remotely controlled aircraft and other surveillance tools). ) for investigation and ways to use them in the course of investigation, creating an algorithm for investigating this type of crime. The following results will be achieved: • Provided information exchange and improved information services in the field of "Crimes against the environment."; • Exchange of good practices and experience with EU countries in the field of "Crimes against the environment."; • Increased administrative capacity of officials involved in the fight against organized and serious international crime in the field of "Environmental Crimes." The following equipment will be purchased: 31 pcs. stationary computer configurations; 31 multifunctional devices - scanner / printer / copier / fax; 15 laptops. A visit to an EU Member State will take place to learn about international experience in combating illegal waste trafficking. Two trainings will be held in Bulgaria and 70 employees of GDNP and OD of the Ministry of Interior will be trained. A handbook / brochure will be developed to assist staff working in the field of eco-crime.

name: Delivery of mobile surveillance system - equipment for FRONTEX
description: The project proposal aims to develop a common policy to ensure a high level of security in the Union, while facilitating legal travel through a uniform and high level of external border control and effective processing of Schengen visas in line with the Union's commitment to fundamental freedoms. and human rights, in accordance with Regulation (EU) №515 / 2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council. In fulfillment of a commitment made by the Multiannual Program of the Republic of Bulgaria in connection with Art. 7 item 1 and item 2 of Annex 2 to REPS 515/2014 for the purchase of a mobile surveillance system at the EU external borders and operational equipment, which are considered necessary for deployment during joint operations by the Frontex Agency and are make available to the Frontex Agency in accordance with Art. 7 (5), second and third subparagraphs of Regulation (EC) №2007 / 2004. As a result of the project implementation, a mobile monitoring system will be delivered, as well as an increase in the number of operations conducted jointly with the FRONTEX Agency to ensure security and counteract migratory pressure at the EU's external borders.

name: Delivery of a border police patrol ship - Equipment for FRONTEX".
description: It is envisaged to supply a border police patrol vessel, which is deemed necessary for deployment during joint operations of the European Border and Coast Guard Agency and which will be made available to the Agency for a minimum of 4 months per year, for a minimum of 10 years, according to the criteria established in Art. 39 of Regulation 1624/2016. The Regulation confirms the legal obligations of Member States to make available to the Agency equipment, the purchase of which is co-financed by the implementation of specific activities under the Instrument for Financial Assistance at the External Borders and Visas under the Internal Security Fund. . The delivery of the ship will increase the capacity of the DGGP for effective border surveillance at the maritime state border. The presence of border police ships at sea will increase, which will lead to the strengthening of the control over the observance of the border regime, the prevention and counteraction of cross-border crime. With the introduction of new ships meeting the latest technical requirements is a guarantee for the successful implementation of the tasks at sea, including control of shipping and fishing, protection of the aquatic environment and saving of human life. Expected results: 1.Increasing the operational capacity of the DGCP to participate in joint operations coordinated by EFSA; 2. Increasing the efficiency of the DGGP in carrying out border surveillance within the territorial sea of the Republic of Bulgaria. 3. Increasing the technical capacity of the DGGP to inspect vessels.

name: Exchange and training of officials on topics related to information security, information systems and technology transfer networks of EU police structures.
description: The project supports actions to improve coordination between the bodies working in the field of police cooperation, improve access and exchange of information, availability of effective and secure information and communication systems of the Ministry of Interior and increase administrative capacity, and training of employees - experts of the competent authorities. The results set for the project are: - Trained and certified trainers of the Ministry of Interior according to international management standards - Trained and certified employees of the Ministry of Interior on information security issues - Trained and certified employees of the Ministry of Interior on modeling, analysis and management of IT projects and services

name: Delivery of remotely controlled flight systems for the needs of border control
description: With the implementation of the project, the following will be achieved: 1. Delivery of at least 5 (five) remote controlled flight systems (DULS) for the needs of border control at the state border. Each SLA will consist of two or more drones with vertical take-off and landing, equipped with a stabilized surveillance system, flight control system, communication system for transmitting the video image to a ground control station and guided surveillance. . A system for storing the collected video information for the needs of the border control at the state border is also envisaged for storage of the information from the conducted surveillance. A specialized vehicle is provided for transportation of each DULS. 2. Conducting courses for practical work with the delivered remotely controlled flight systems. 3. Insurance of the delivered remotely controlled flight systems for the time of the warranty maintenance. The implementation of the project will improve the technical capacity of the DGGP, will support the integrated border management to increase the security of the borders of the Republic of Bulgaria and the EU, in order to effectively combat illegal migration. Through the use of remotely controlled flight systems, the quality of work of specialized tactical units and their ability to locate potential violators, track their movement, determine the number of groups and their neutralization will be improved. Expected results: - Assisted the integrated management and increase of the security of the borders of the Republic of Bulgaria and of the European Union through the use of remotely controlled flight systems; - Improved technical capacity of DGGP

name: Delivery of specialized equipment for biometric identification and other equipment
description: With the implementation of the project, will be achieved: 1. Supporting the integrated management and increasing the security of the borders of the Republic of Bulgaria and the EU. 2. Increasing the efficiency of the work of border guards through the use of specialized equipment for biometric identification. 3. Improving the technical capacity of DGGP. The system will be implemented with separate sites and database replication with a size of up to 30,000 photos for real-time recognition of each site. The replication will be performed in an appropriate time period of the day through the data transmission network of the Ministry of Interior. The functions for management and off-line verification of the Central site will be available in a database with a volume of up to 1 million photographs, organized according to the technological capabilities of the system, as well as using the functionalities of the built system. Expected result: Improved technical capacity of DGGP to carry out border checks at border crossings. - Increased efficiency of the work of the employees of DGGP through the use of specialized equipment for biometric identification. - Improved border control at external borders, incl. and the temporary external borders for which the Republic of Bulgaria is responsible

name: Establishment of a Center for active monitoring in the system of the Ministry of Interior
description: The project aims to introduce anti-corruption measures to increase the ability of the Ministry of Interior to prevent crime by building an automated system for active monitoring. Active monitoring includes continuous audio and video surveillance, information exchange, data access, control, information storage, operational analysis and evaluation, proposals for appropriate measures. To achieve this goal, activities are envisaged for the construction of a Center for active monitoring in the system of the Ministry of Interior, serviced by the Internal Affairs Ministry and equipped with modern IT equipment. The expected results of the project activities are: • A new Center for active monitoring in the system of the Ministry of Interior has been established, increasing the efficiency and objectivity in investigating corruption crimes of police officers and crime prevention. • Methodically developed, operatively introduced and technically secured anti-corruption measures: 1. Direct independent audio and video surveillance of police officers; 2. Permanent remote control with internal operational communication; 3. Automated system for active monitoring in the Ministry of Interior. • Increased technical and operational capacity of the Internal Affairs Ministry for effective and objective operational-search and information-analytical activities for prevention of corruption and other criminal acts of police officers. • Enhanced security measures for citizens, police officers, as well as during the Bulgarian Presidency of the EU

name: Introduction of specialized software for analysis of financial intelligence.
description: The project is aimed at state institutions competent to receive, store and analyze information received under the terms and conditions of LMML and LMFTA. The following activities will be funded: - Study of best international practices in the EU in building software systems for analysis of financial intelligence (FRI); - Delivery and implementation of a ready specialized software system (SSS) for analysis of FRI, received under the LMML and LMTF, including by connecting to existing electronic systems for receiving and processing information received under the LMML and LMFT and payment of annual fees for installation and maintenance (of SSS for analysis of FRI) - Development of functionality for exchange of FRI with law enforcement agencies, addressees of information under Article 75, paragraph 1 of LMML - Providing the necessary hardware equipment - Awareness and publicity. As a result of its implementation, the efficiency in the detection of financial crimes, money laundering and terrorist financing will be increased and the technical capacity in the fight against terrorism, serious and organized crime will be increased. A system for analysis of the FRI will be established and will start functioning and the exchange of information with foreign financial intelligence units will be improved.

name: Development, updating and upgrading of the National Visa Information System
description: The project is aimed at modernization and development of the software and technical support of the National Visa Information System (NIS) in accordance with the requirements for interoperability and ensuring the continuous connection of VIS with the EU Visa Information System (EU VIS) and the consultation network of VIS Mail visas. The existing specialized equipment and software development of VLSI will be upgraded, as well as the existing hardware will be upgraded, the infrastructure and the network connectivity of the system will be expanded. For the purpose of carrying out checks by the competent authorities entitled to process visa data, a mechanism will be set up to ensure access to EU VIS data for border guards, customs, migration authorities, asylum authorities. and the law enforcement bodies of the Republic of Bulgaria at the external borders. Expected results: • Modernized National Visa Information System to a modern technological level, fully meeting the standards of the Schengen Member States; • Ensured continuous and trouble-free operation of VLSI; • Provided continuous connection with EU VIS and the information exchange system for consular cooperation and VIS Mail visa consultation; • Provided opportunity for constant exchange of information between the systems; • Ensured full implementation and operation of VIS, including phase 2 of VIS Mail; • Provision of VIS distribution in all consular services of the Republic of Bulgaria throughout the world; • Continuity and effective functioning of the National Visa System in the consular services; • Created opportunity for connection of VLSI with other existing and / or under construction systems in the field of visas and border control; • Established mechanism for providing access to EU VIS data for DGGP of the Ministry of Interior, SANS, SAR and other bodies.

name: Supply of IT equipment for national experts involved in the preparation of SOCTA
description: The project aims to supply IT equipment to the national experts involved in the preparation of SOCTA, by increasing the technical security of the national experts responsible for the implemented priorities and the implementation of the OPD within SOCTA. The target group, which will be directly affected by the implementation of the project, are the employees of the EUROPOL - DMOS department and employees of the DGCOC in the field of work, who are directly involved in the preparation of the assessment of the threats from serious and organized crime. The main objective of the project is to achieve a high level of security within the Union by increasing the institutional capacity to prevent and combat cross-border, serious and organized crime, in accordance with Regulation (EU) № 513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council, and the specific objective is the prevention of crime, the fight against cross-border, serious and organized crime. The expected results are increased technical support of the national experts, competent for the outlined priorities and the implementation of the OPD within SOCTA, as well as an improved pre-trial police investigation. The main activity will be the purchase of 56 IT equipment for employees directly involved in the preparation of an assessment of the threats of serious and organized crime, as well as employees implementing national priorities within the EC framework for combating serious and organized crime.

name: Delivery of software and hardware for data and document backup
description: For full functioning and fulfillment of the obligations of DGGP related to border control, border inspections, counteraction to crime across the state border, inspections and inquiries in the automated information funds, administrative activities that support and ensure the implementation of border control, including logistical, financial and other provision, as well as other accompanying activities use information resources located at local and central level. These information resources are located on obsolete in terms of hardware and software blade servers, delivered under the PHARE program, project BG2006 / 018-343.07.02 in 2009. They are physically sized and have the capacity to serve the current needs of DGGP and whose capacity at present it is extremely insufficient for the implementation of all regulated backups and reliable storage of all data. On the other hand, information technologies are evolving extremely fast and there are servers available in DGGP that have modern higher versions of their operating systems and that are not supported by the outdated software of the currently available blade servers. All this leads to a potential threat of data loss. Through the implementation of the activity will be delivered modern modernized hardware and software for creating planned - complete and periodic backups. The reliability for storage of information arrays with data and files of DGGP and their security will be increased. The risk of data loss will be minimized. In the event of a critical situation, the time for restoring the operability of information systems and files will be minimized. In addition to data replication, it is planned to backup the current state and backup unused files. In the long run, this will lead to an overall improvement in the technical capacity of the DGGP. Expected result: Improved security and reliability of the information systems and information bases of DG Border Police.

name: Completion of a siren system for protection of the population and ECI sites
description: Completion of the systems is aimed at prevention, protection and security of European citizens in the defined territory. In order to achieve the goals and the expected results of the project, the following activities will be carried out: - Construction of a system for early warning and notification of the population and the sites of the critical infrastructure on the territory of the cities St. Zagora and Galabovo - supply of equipment, installation and installation, testing, integration with NSRPO (National Early Warning and Notification System), preparation and submission of the required design documents, construction supervision. - Carrying out trainings of the siren systems in the cities of Stara Zagora and Galabovo and of NSRPO, in order to test the built systems and their integration into NSRPO, as well as training for checking the readiness of the executive bodies at regional and municipal level and the operators of ECI (European Critical Infrastructure) sites; - Conducting trainings for employees of the Ministry of Interior and the municipal administration, who will work and use the siren systems. - Awareness and publicity activities - two events will be held - initial and final, the latter being combined with an information day.

name: Training in network traffic analysis for cybersecurity and firewall administration
description: The project envisages training for SCIS specialists who analyze network traffic and administer the firewalls of the Ministry of Interior in order to protect information and communication systems from threats and cyber attacks. The purpose of the project proposal is training and preparation of experts who are responsible for the protection of the Ministry of Interior from cyber threats and incidents with a significant impact on network and information security, including the presence of attacks, such as denial of service. This will support and strengthen the coordination and cooperation of the Ministry of Interior and law enforcement agencies and other national authorities of the Member States. On the other hand, increasing the level of cyber defense will lead to real results in the Ministry of Interior in terms of preventing growing threats and risks related to opportunities to compromise exchanged information flows, as well as unregulated manipulation of data in them, and will be achieved. the objectives of Regulation (EU) № 513/2014 to prevent crime, combat cross-border, serious and organized crime, including terrorism, and strengthen coordination and cooperation between law enforcement and other national authorities of the Member States, including Europol or other competent Union bodies, and with relevant third countries and international organizations. To implement this protection, it is necessary to increase the capacity of experts with practical skills in the field of network traffic analysis, cyberattack prevention and firewall administration. The training of experts will be carried out by conducting courses throughout the EU. Expected results: 1. Increased administrative capacity for network traffic analysis, cyberattack prevention and detection systems, firewall administration and security policy implementation; 2. Increased efficiency of public authorities in combating cybercrime.

name: Maintenance and repair of mobile surveillance systems and technical means of surveillance
description: With the implementation of the project, the following will be achieved: • Repair and maintenance of mobile surveillance systems; • Repair and maintenance of other technical means of monitoring; • Repair and maintenance of chargers; • Supply of batteries and other spare parts, materials and consumables for repair and maintenance of technical means of monitoring. Expected results: - Increased security at the borders of the Republic of Bulgaria and the EU; - increased efficiency of work of the border police squads; - Improving the technical capacity of the DGCP to carry out effective border surveillance.

name: Purchase of technical equipment for the preparation of analyzes for radicalization processes
description: Neutralizing the challenges of terrorism, radicalization and the growth of aggressive extremism depend on the unstable social environment and require a comprehensive system of coordinated initiatives and expertise. , involved in crossing these processes participants - national institutions and officials with direct contacts with vulnerable to radicalization communities and groups. To achieve the priority objectives for combating terrorism at EU level in 2014. With the Council of Ministers, a NCTC was established at SANS as an interdepartmental structure, performing the function of a unified national platform for collecting and processing information for identification of persons and organizations related to terrorism, operating continuously and ensuring coordinated management of national information resources. increase the national counter-terrorism system by optimizing the activity of the NCTC and the specialized directorate in SANS by increasing the administrative capacity of the employees. Expected results from the implementation of the project are: - Improved technical support of the National Counter-Terrorism Center at SANS for preparation of analyzes for the development of radicalization in Bulgaria; - Improved exchange of information between state and public partners on radicalization processes.

name: Information campaigns to raise awareness of the consequences of radicalization
description: The aim of the project is to achieve a higher level of awareness of the public, law enforcement agencies, national institutions and their employees, as well as non-governmental organizations regarding the processes of radicalization to achieve prevention. SANS is a leading institution in the activity of: developing a methodology for identifying, monitoring and assessing the manifestations and risks of radicalization, as well as for analyzing the main factors for radicalization and building a mechanism for coordination and exchange of information between central and local government and non-governmental organizations. organizations on the problems of radicalization and violent extremism. The counteraction of socially significant phenomena leading to terrorism, radicalization and the spread of violent extremism depends to a large extent on the competence of law enforcement agencies and involved institutions to early identify and correctly classify signs and manifestations indicating a process with possible negative consequences. Raising awareness of the public, competent authorities and the non-governmental sector, which are in direct contact with vulnerable groups, will increase the system's ability to respond in a timely manner and respond to challenges related to the radicalization process that can lead to terrorist acts. The project envisages raising awareness of the forms and methods of spreading radicalization, as well as informing about its consequences. Expected results: 1. Increased public awareness of the consequences of radicalization and prevention 2. Established Unified Coordination Platform and Internet portal, providing access to materials for the development of the problem of radicalization and good practices and measures to counter and promote the Radicalization Awareness Network / RAN /. 3. Developed and disseminated among law enforcement agencies methodology for recognizing signs of active and passive radicalization and created a training program. 4. Disseminated results from the Radicalization Awareness Network (RAN)

name: Restoration and maintenance of CCI on the Bulgarian-Turkish border from Lesovo border checkpoint to Rezovska river
description: With the implementation of the project the following will be fulfilled: • Activities for restoration and maintenance of the CCI on the Bulgarian-Turkish border in the section from the Lesovo border checkpoint to the Rezovska River for the period 2019-2022 (defects, scheduled and unscheduled repairs, scheduled maintenance of equipment and prevention); • Software maintenance and update; • Maintaining the serviceability of the power transmission and communication network of the CCI; • Delivery of spare parts, components and consumables necessary for the daily maintenance of the CCI elements; • Cleaning of the strip of the elements of the CCI on the Bulgarian-Turkish border in the section from the Lesovo border checkpoint to the Rezovska River, the areas of, inside and outside the SPTN from overgrown grasses, shrubs and trees, as well as treatment of this strip and areas inside and outside the SPTN with preparations. Expected results: Supporting the integrated management and increased security at the external borders of the Republic of Bulgaria and the EU and Ensuring continuous and sustainable operation of the CCI

name: Increasing the security and reliability of the MTD of the Ministry of Interior at the external borders of the EU
description: In line with the trend related to the growing number and vectors of cyber-attacks, the Ministry of Interior aims to introduce additional information security measures.
