Some of them are the subject of the current project, namely: - Providing a system for centralized collection, monitoring, analysis and management of journal events, for a significant part of the available communication infrastructure and information security infrastructure. - Providing a system for protection and monitoring of the information files (databases) of the Ministry of Interior - Providing modern analytical functionalities for improving the response capabilities and establishing unregulated access to sensitive systems within the information infrastructure of the Ministry of Interior; - Improving the interaction between the structures of the Ministry of Interior for counteracting incidents related to information security. The implementation of the project will ensure the increase of the security and reliability of the data transmission network of the Ministry of Interior at the EU external borders by implementing a system for collecting, analyzing and storing information on the activity of end users and devices.

name: Development of the information systems of DG Border Police through supply of equipment.
description: For full functioning and fulfillment of the obligations of DGGP related to border control, counteraction to crime across the state border, inspections and inquiries in the automated information funds, administrative activities that support and ensure the implementation of border control, including logistical, financial and other provision, as well as other accompanying activities use information resources located at the local and central level. DGGP has 5,000 workstations used by DGGP and the seven RDGPs. Switches, anti-virus software, active directory, file servers, mail servers, Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), peripherals, etc. are used to ensure the normal operation of computer equipment in each GDGP structure. According to the final report of Microsoft for the evaluation of the IT infrastructure of DGGP, it is recommended to upgrade the domain in order to subsequently upgrade the active directory service to the latest version of Windows Server, as well as upgrade management tools by implementing a proactive IT services monitoring, proactive IT services monitoring system and Help Desk system. Through the implementation of the activity will be delivered modern and reliable equipment for the development of information systems, which will replace the currently used - highly depreciated and obsolete. The efficiency of the employees of DGGP and its regional structures in carrying out their daily activities related to border control, border checks, combating crime across the state border, carrying out checks and inquiries in the automated information funds, administrative activities that support and provide border control, including logistical, financial and other security, as well as other related activities.

name: Upgrading and preparation of AIS "Border Control" for operation with input / output functionality
description: This project proposal reflects the requirements of Regulation (EU) 2017/2226 of the European Parliament and of the Council establishing an Entry / Exit System to record entry and exit data and data on refusal of entry of third-country nationals, crossing the external borders of the Member States. It envisages upgrading the functionalities of the existing AIS "Border Control" with a new one, which will allow exchange of information with the newly created Entry / Exit System. The project is expected to purchase highly specialized devices that will allow electronic verification of identity documents at the EU's external borders. The implementation of this project will support the activities for implementation of the measures for introduction of the Entry / Exit System and will create opportunities for implementation of new technologies and conditions for fulfillment of the requirements for Entry / Exit System and its integration with the AIS currently used in the Ministry of Interior. that will power it. Expected results: - Implemented integration with the internal information system "Border Control"; - Delivered devices for automated border control, including for the needs of the Entry / Exit System (IMS); - Trained system administrators for equipment management and maintenance; - Trained users to work with the equipment

name: Renovation, maintenance, repair and modernization of electronic counters built in RDGP Airports
description: Through the implementation of the activity, the electronic counters, built in RDGP Airports, will be renovated, maintained, repaired and modernized. The maintenance of the electronic counters will increase the efficiency of the border checks carried out at the Sofia Airport border checkpoint, Burgas Airport border checkpoint, Varna Airport border checkpoint. The activities for the implementation of the activity will speed up the servicing of passengers who have electronic travel documents containing biometric data, thus optimizing the work of the border police. The project covers the following activities: • Repair and maintenance of the electronic counters of RDGP-Airports; • Carrying out inspections / prophylaxis at the electronic counters of RDGP-Airports; • Modernization of built electronic counters of RDGP-Airports; Expected results: Ensured normal functioning of electronic counters and increasing the efficiency of border checks.

name: Maintenance and updating of the software and technical support of the National Visa System and of the visa activity in the consular services of the Republic of Bulgaria
description: The scope of the project includes technical maintenance and repair of hardware equipment, as well as gradual renewal of existing hardware and further development of software (expansion of infrastructure, network connectivity and the use of Schengen-compliant software products) of VLSI. It is also envisaged to ensure reliable operation of the system in continuous mode by: - Maintenance of backup equipment. - Software monitoring for monitoring the critical points of the National Visa System.

name: Building elements of a national cybersecurity system
description: The project aims to support the creation of an effective system for cybersecurity and resilience and is aimed at building an institutionalized unified system of responsibilities, processes and procedures for monitoring the general state of cyberspace, for interaction and effective use of technical capacity for prevention, coordinated response and recovery from cyber incidents and trend analysis and capacity building to actively and effectively counter cyber threats. To provide information on the current cyber picture, the establishment of a National Cyber Situation Center (NCSC) is envisaged, and the need for cooperation for effective and coordinated prevention, response and recovery from cyber incidents requires the establishment of a National Coordination and Organizational Network for Cyber Security . In order to create an effectively functioning NCOMC, it is necessary to increase the capacity of the structures responsible for cybersecurity. In this regard, it is envisaged to expand the capabilities of the National Computer Security Incident Response Team, to establish a National Cyber Situation Center, to establish coordination mechanisms between the competent cybersecurity agencies at the national level. The successful implementation of the project will help to establish coordination mechanisms at the national level and to build a common national framework and principles for development in the field of cybersecurity, agreed with the main stakeholders.

name: Building a system for processing encrypted information related to the use of CPC
description: Building a system of measures to address the challenge of encryption, used by criminals, by processing the acquired encrypted information, in the process of using and applying special intelligence tools (SRS). The system will be built with the possibility of upgrading and expansion. The project proposal fully complies with the general framework set in the National Multiannual Program of Bulgaria for assistance from the Internal Security Fund for the period 2014 - 2020, as well as with Regulation (EC) № 513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 16 April 2014 establishing the Instrument for Financial Assistance to Police Cooperation, Crime Prevention and Control and Crisis Management as part of the Internal Security Fund and repealing Council Decision 2007/125 / JHA. The main goal of the project is to increase the results of the implementation of the RCC for more effective and efficient implementation of activities to combat serious and organized crime, which will contribute to achieving a high level of security within the Union. The expected results are through the application of modern information systems and technologies to increase the effectiveness in combating serious and organized crime. The competencies of employees of the State Agency "Technical Operations" (DATO) in performing specific activities related to the implementation of the SRS for combating organized crime and terrorism and protection of national security of the Republic of Bulgaria will be improved. The main goal of the project and the expected results will be achieved by the implementation of the following main activities: creation of an expert point and its equipment with technical means and software supporting the decryption of information; training of staff from the expert point of view and exchange of good practices and experience in Member States.

name: Ensuring the sustainability of specialized support for victims of human trafficking.
description: Support, care and protection for victims of human trafficking is a key priority of Bulgaria's system for combating crime, relevant legislation and the country's commitments under international conventions and agreements. Bulgaria has adopted a victim-centered approach in its strategic and operational documents (the National Strategy for Combating Trafficking in Human Beings 2017-21 and the annual National Programs) and in instruments such as the National Referral and Support Mechanism. of Victims of Trafficking in Human Beings (NMN), coordinated by the National Commission for Combating Trafficking in Human Beings (NCCTHB) at the Council of Ministers. At the end of 2018, Bulgaria has the largest capacity for specialized support for victims of trafficking - 8 services in Sofia, Varna and Burgas with a total capacity of 36 seats. The financing of the services in Varna and Burgas is provided from the budget of the NCCTHB. The financing of the services in Sofia - Shelter for temporary accommodation of victims of human trafficking (PVNZHTH) and Crisis Center for children, victims of human trafficking - was under a project of the Bulgarian-Swiss Cooperation Program, which ended in early 2019 While the operation of the Crisis Center is expected to be ensured in cooperation with the Municipality of Sofia, the SCCT ceased its work on December 31, 2018. At present, the NCCTHB is in a situation where infrastructure and equipment are available to provide care to victims of traffic, but does not have the necessary funding to operate it. This project will ensure sustainability in the provision of specialized services for victims of trafficking in human beings in Bulgaria by: 1) resumption of the activities of the JHA in Sofia; 2) training of staff to provide specialized care for victims of trafficking; 3) construction of an integrated database for the provided services for victims of trafficking in the shelters in Sofia, Varna and Burgas in order to access information in real time. The specific results of the project will be: 1) More cared for victims of human trafficking in the specialized services at the NCCTHB and better quality of the provided support and protection. With the resumption of LNG, the state's capacity to provide HVAC services will return to the maximum level from the end of 2018. 2) Functioning Integrated database for supported victims of trafficking in the services of the NCCTHB in Burgas, Varna and Sofia. 3) Built capacity, skills and good practices in the work of the employees of the specialized services for housing and communal services at the NCCTHB, as well as of the employees in the administration of the NCCTHB and LCTBH working with victims of human trafficking.

name: Update of the software of the TETRA system of the Ministry of Interior for interaction at the external borders of the EU
description: The implementation of the project will improve the activities of unified management and interaction of forces and means in accordance with the situation, organizing and conducting local and large-scale police operations, taking timely and adequate measures to combat cross-border crime and illegal migration. The following results are set: - Increased efficiency in the management of local and large-scale police operations at the EU's external borders; - Increasing the efficiency of forces and means in organizing and conducting police operations at the EU's external borders; - Increasing the effectiveness of combating cross-border crime and illegal migration; -Increasing the security and sustainability of the system and prepared TETRA system for modern functionality related to the application of modern technological solutions

name: Training in risk analysis and assessment to increase the security of strategic sites
description: The project aims to conduct training in risk analysis and assessment in order to increase the security and protection of strategic sites that are part of the critical infrastructure of the country. The project envisages conducting unified training of employees from the strategic sites and activities, part of the critical infrastructure, and the project will also include employees of SANS. The training will include 13 separate trainings, in which representatives of the respective sectors of strategic sites and activities will take part. The target group of the project are: - SANS employees engaged in counterintelligence and information protection of strategic sites of national security importance; - SANS employees trained under a previous project funded by the Internal Security Fund; - Owners or representing the owners and operators of national and European critical infrastructure in the country; - Other representatives / employees / of the companies, which are assigned to carry out strategic activities important for the national security of the country; - Representatives of companies directly involved in ensuring the continuity of services provided by strategic sites and companies carrying out strategic activities. Results: Improving the professional qualification of the employees for achieving a high level of protection of the national sites, indicated as strategic and part of the national infrastructure.

name: Training of experts investigating crimes and abuses in cyberspace
description: Investments in human capital are very important for the law enforcement agencies in the Republic of Bulgaria, because by improving their professional qualifications and achieving a level of compliance with the partner services in the EU, Bulgarian experts investigating crimes and abuses in cyberspace will improve their prevention results. the identification and investigation of cybercrime. The target group are the employees of the General Directorate "Fight against Organized Crime" - the Ministry of Interior and other experts investigating crimes and abuses in cyberspace. The main objective of the project is to achieve a high level of security within the Union by increasing the institutional capacity to prevent and combat cross-border, serious and organized crime, in accordance with Regulation (EU) № 513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council, and the specific objective is the prevention of crime, the fight against cross-border, serious and organized crime. The expected result is an increase in the qualification of experts working in the field of investigation of crimes and abuses in cyberspace. The main activity of the project will be the training of experts, investigators of crimes and abuses in cyberspace.

name: Increasing the capacity to protect critical infrastructure and related sites
description: In order to increase the administrative and operational capacity for protection of critical infrastructure and related sites at national and regional level, an integrated management system (IMS) based on its own software will be built and implemented. The system will allow the collection and processing of information about these sites, and the same will be used in the activities of DGSPBZN for state fire control, preventive activities and control for compliance with the requirements of the Disaster Protection Act (SPA). For construction and implementation of IMS in GDPBZN, RDPBZN and RSPBZN it is envisaged to perform the following activities: - Delivery of the necessary hardware and system software with the necessary licenses for construction of an integrated management system (IMS); - Providing connectivity via the Internet; - Training of employees to work with the system; - Activities for implementation of the system; - Measures for publicity and visualization. The following results are expected to be achieved: - Improved protection of the national and European critical infrastructure; -Developed and implemented IMS for collecting and processing information for certain critical infrastructures; - Trained employees from GDPBZN to work with the system.

name: Increasing the capacity of police investigation and forensic investigations ", BG / ISF-SO5-NO1-A22
description: The project aims to increase the capacity of law enforcement agencies in the fight against transnational, serious, organized and conventional crime, incl. and terrorism. Renewal of the technological capabilities of NIK-MoI will also assist in the implementation of best European practices, exchange of information with partner services and achieve the goals set in the Vision for the European Forensic Space 2020. The project corresponds to the following specific and operational objectives of the Instrument for support for police cooperation under REPS 513.2014: - Preservation and expansion of opportunities for analysis of organic and inorganic substances and biological objects. - Expanding the possibilities for performing trasological and dactyloscopic examinations and fixing dactyloscopic traces. - Creating an opportunity for filming and modeling of accidents. - Renovation of the IT infrastructure of NIK, incl. of network (communication) equipment. - Expanding research opportunities in the field of information and communication technologies.

name: Training for counterintelligence and information protection of strategic sites
description: According to the National Security Strategy (NA) of the Republic of Bulgaria, the protection of the population and the critical infrastructure in case of crises, disasters, accidents, catastrophes and other risks and threats are defined as vital interests. Proactive, preventive measures to ensure and increase the security and sustainability of critical infrastructure (in general) and strategic sites of importance to the National Assembly (in particular) involve building and maintaining a good level of knowledge and expertise in SANS employees (target group in current project). In view of the adequate response to threats and assessment of the growing role and importance for the National Assembly of critical infrastructure / strategic sites /, this project envisages the implementation of activities "structured" in 2 modules: "Training of trainers", activities and "Training in Critical Infrastructure Protection, in the framework of the European Partnership and National Expertise", also including several sub-activities. During the implementation of the project the following results will be achieved: - Ensuring adequate professional training and qualification of the employees and achieving a high level of protection of nat. assets; - Upgrading the acquired knowledge and skills of employees engaged in counterintelligence and information protection of strategic sites part of the critical infrastructure; - Introduction and approval of a mechanism for public-private partnership in providing assistance to managers of strategic sites and activities relevant to the National Assembly, in the analysis and assessment of risks and building protection of sites; - Overall increase of specific adm. capacity in the field of counteracting emerging risks and threats to the counterintelligence and information security of critical infrastructure and strategic sites.

name: Exchange of experience and training in the application of the undercover officer method under the SSR
description: Investments in human capital are very important for the law enforcement agencies in the Republic of Bulgaria, because by improving their professional qualifications and achieving a level of compliance with the partner services in the EU, Bulgarian experts with competence in the field of special intelligence to counter organized crime and terrorism will improve their performance in the prevention, identification and investigation of organized crime and terrorism. The target group are the employees of the General Directorate "Fight against Organized Crime" - Ministry of Interior, with competence in the field of application of special intelligence tools for combating organized crime and terrorism, working in the field of information security, information systems and networks. The main objective of the project is to achieve a high level of security within the Union by increasing the institutional capacity to prevent and combat cross-border, serious and organized crime, in accordance with Regulation (EU) №513/2014 of the European Parliament and of the Council, and the specific objective is the prevention of crime, the fight against cross-border, serious and organized crime. The expected result is improved administrative capacity and cooperation of applicants under the SSR, through joint training and conferences, exchange of good practices and experience with related and partner services from other EU Member States and third countries.

name: Development and implementation of the EU Entry / Exit System
description: This project proposal reflects the requirements of REGULATION (EU) 2017/2226 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 30 November 2017 on the conditions for commissioning and entry into service of an Entry / Exit System (IMS) through which to record entry data. and exit and data on refusals of entry for third-country nationals crossing the external borders of the Member States. The construction of the system is based on the EC's priority principles of "smart borders". Their implementation requires effective and integrated management of the EU's common external borders, which will also be achieved through the entry / exit system. This system will further improve the management of the external borders and will facilitate the timely and rapid verification of compliance with the provisions on the permitted period of stay within the territory of the Member States. The system will electronically register the time and place of entry and exit of third-country nationals admitted for a short stay in the territory of the Member States and will calculate the duration of their authorized stay. Expected results: - Improved technical capacity for border control; - Delivered, installed and integrated hardware and software; - Integrated National Unified Interface with other information systems; - Implemented Entry / Exit System.

name: EuroHAPS
topicName: High-altitude platform systems

name: INTERACT
description: INTERACT aims to create a basis for a future European interoperability standard for military unmanned systems. It will be achieved by integrating the technical knowledge and operational experience available in Europe on control, monitoring, and application of unmanned systems for the concept definition of a future European cross-industry interoperability standard for military unmanned systems. This standard will allow unmanned assets to be deployed flexible in different configurations, such as singular deployment, in manned-unmanned teaming, in hand over modes or as autonomous swarms, all this independent of organizational or national provenance. For this an INTERACT EXPERT GROUP containing all dominant European manufacturers of unmanned systems (air, ground, surface and underwater) accompanied by a number of leading organisations from all over Europe in specific expert fields will be created. The interchangeability of assets will increase responsiveness and flexibility and hence the warfighting capability of European armed forces, individually and in international joint operations.

name: MALE RPAS
description: Directly awarded – MALE RPAS (Medium Altitude/Long Endurance drone): a strategic enabler for surveillance, intelligence and surveillance. The MALE RPAS is an indispensable capability to facilitate international conflict prevention and crisis management during all phases of operation, especially in the field of Intelligence, Surveillance, Target Acquisition and Reconnaissance (ISTAR). The development of a European MALE RPAS will ensure technological sovereignty by covering the ISTAR European Capability Development Priority. To maximize benefits, the European MALE RPAS should be integrated into civil air-traffic-management without any significant limitations. A strong European supply chain, embedded into the program through open tenders across all levels, will foster the European Defence Technological and Industrial Base (EDTIB). Related PESCO project: European Medium Altitude Long Endurance Remotely Piloted Aircraft Systems – MALE RPAS (Eurodrone)

name: EUDAAS
description: The EUDAAS project will develop and validate a 100% European Detect And Avoid (DAA) solution for safe insertion of large military Remotely-Piloted Air Systems (RPAS) in the European air traffic so that RPAS can operate along with other manned and unmanned aircrafts. EUDAAS will also increase the maturity of non-cooperative sensors, to enable the use of RPAS in a much wider and flexible way than currently possible. The project addresses the current user needs by focusing on specific use cases such as the European MALE RPAS. Related PESCO project: European Medium Altitude Long Endurance Remotely Piloted Aircraft Systems – MALE RPAS (Eurodrone)

name: USSPS - Development of Unmanned Semi-fixed Sea Platforms for Maritime Surveillance
description: USSPS will develop a system to improve Maritime Surveillance by exploiting unmanned semi-fixed platforms at sea.  The project “Development of Unmanned Semi-fixed Sea Platforms for Maritime Surveillance” (USSPS) will develop the backbone of an advance Command, Control, Communication, Computers, Combat Systems, Intelligence, Surveillance, Target Acquisition, and Reconnaissance (C5ISTAR) federated system of systems. USSPS will integrate legacy assets and systems with innovative solutions, aiming to improve maritime surveillance capabilities, reduce high value asset utilization and mission related costs, and provide cross-domain persistent and permanent maritime situational awareness. The project will develop an unmanned highly autonomous, energy efficient and miniaturized oil rig technology-based platform capable to integrate a wide range of air, surface and underwater sensors. The platforms will enable deployment in any geographical region, including all types of sea-beds and deep-sea regions, and operation under adverse environmental conditions.

name: JEY-CUAS – Joint European sYstem for Countering Unmanned Aerial Systems
description: JEY-CUAS will pave the way for the development of a joint European Counter Unmanned Air Systems capability. The project “Joint European sYstem for Countering Unmanned Aerial Systems” (JEY-CUAS) will advance technologies at system and sub-system level to develop a new generation C-UAS system based on a modular and flexible plug'n'play architecture to address the emerging challenge of micro and mini drones increasingly used for defence purposes. The solution will contribute to an improvement of the situational awareness and reaction engagement to overcome the growing resilience of UASs to first generation C-UAS systems keep up with new LSS (Low, Small, Slow) aerial threats and reduce the minimum reaction time. Related PESCO project: Counter Unmanned Aerial System (C‐UAS)

name: CROWN
description: CROWN project includes two main and connected activities as first step towards an EU programme for a multifunction RF (radar, EW, communication) AESA-based system, using technology without end-user restrictions in TRL7, for a single aerial platform by 2027: 1. R&D assessment and recommendations on critical technologies key for the development of future European multifunction RF AESA systems, establishing roadmaps and priorities avoiding dependencies from non-EU suppliers. 2. R&T activities on system and component level. These activities will bebased on the requirements identified from the main stakeholders and on the architecture study fulfilled. Demonstrators for the different levels, system, and component, will be developed taking in consideration the inputs of the R&D assessment to avoid as much as possible non-European technologies for CROWN demonstrators. A broadband antenna, wideband digital beam former (DBF) (electronic scan with multibeam capability in transmission and reception in a HW platform) and an advanced SW resource manager (RSM) (key for the multifunction coordination of the system) will be produced for the system level. At component level research activities will be done for Transmit/Receive modules(TRMs). Highpower, bandwidth, frequency and tunability are key objectives for the TRMs. Two different open and trustable EU foundries, being one of them part of the consortium, will be used for TRM design,manufacturing and test. SwaP-C, packaging, cooling and ilities (reliability, manufacturability, etc) are also aspects that will be included at both levels. The objective for these activities is intended to target at least TRL 4. In addition, a small-scale prototype will be also designed, manufactured, and tested in a laboratory environment. Laboratory results will be conveniently scaled to the system level through modelling. System modelling will integrate models from the main building blocks studied (antenna, TRMs, DBF and RSM) to assess the performance of the defined system upon different scenarios.

Necessary actions/activities in preparation for the new National Visa Information System (CY-VIS)
description: This project co-finances the necessary preparatory actions for the implementation of the new National Visa Information System (CY-VIS) which will comply with the Schengen acquis. More specifically it co-finances the services of a Technical Consultant to implement studies and deliverables that precede the implementation of the new CY-VIS. The main deliverable of the project is the preparation, by the Consultantof of technical specifications and tender documents for the announcement of a public procurement procudure that will include all the services required for the implementation of the new CY-VIS.

name: Purchase of new computer equipment and purchase of licenses for SIS RECAST
description: The project is aimed at purchasing new computer equipment and licenses for the SIS RECAST. The replacement / upgrade of the computer equipment of the SIS II National System in the test and control environment, production and backup location (Disaster Recovery) aims to help implement all the changes provided by the regulations passed for RECAST. The main objective of the project is to upgrade the National SIS / SIRENE II System, in order to comply with the common standards, protocols and technical procedures resulting from SIS RECAST, to ensure compatibility between the relevant N.SIS and the central SIS RECAST for fast and efficient data transmission. The budget was amended and the implementation period was extended after FB's request.

name: Purchase of semi-rigid inflatable boats for the needs of JRCC
description: Purchase of 2 high-speed semi-inflatable boats & repair of 2 high-speed patrol boats. Target: Increase of the ability of response of the Search &Rescue System Units within Republic's Area of Responsibility in case of emergency due to migratory flow. The FB will be able to locate, identify & monitor targets &rescue TCNs in danger, day &night, under difficult weather conditions. Due to the effects of the pandemic, the Italian subcontractor was not able to issue &submit a guarantee deposit & an invoice. Therefore, the FB did not pay an advance to the subcontractor within 2020.It is noted that the increased number of COVID-19 positive cases led to the imposition of a lock-down in Italy in 12/2020.As a result, the advance payment of €360.000 given RA to the FB was not used. The examination of the issue by the RA confirmed that the non-submission of a guarantee deposit &an invoice is justified

name: Upgrade of Cyprus Police Central System to connect to Entry-Exit System, National European Travel Information and Authorization System (ETIAS), self-service systems, e-gates and automated border control systems
description: Upgrade of Cyprus Police Central System for the connection to Entry-Exit System and National European Travel Information and Authorization System (ETIAS) includes upgrade of the Central System's applications, function definitions acceptance, user acceptance testing, connectivity checks and provision of technical and advisory support to users when required. The aim of the project is to upgrade Cyprus Police Central System in order to strengthen the capacity of information exchange between Cyprus Police Central System, Entry-Exit System, ETIAS, self-service systems, e-gates and Automated Border Control Systems.

description: The project aims to develop a SAR operations training centre, so to provide training to all the involving crew

name: Development of an alternative SAR coordination centre for JRCC
description: The project aims to develop an alternative/stand by rescue centre, in case the existing centre is not able to operate, due to natural disasters or other factors.

name: Purchase of an Unmanned Aerial Vehicle for search and rescue purposes
description: Purchase of two UAVs and two motors, as well as purchase and installation of two transponders, a vehicle and a ground control station for the UAV control. The aim is to upgrade the operational capabilities of the Republic of Cyprus in the surveillance and control of migration flows within its area of responsibility, as well as to deal with possible search and rescue incidents that may arise because of the migration flows throughout the Nicosia FIR.

name: Strengthening operational capacity for the prevention and combating crime
description: Under the framework of the project are co-financed actions such as the purchase of specialized equipment, vehicles and mobile information units, actions for trafficking in Human Beings, combating domestic violence and child abuse, purchase of dogs for the needs of the Drug Law Enforcement Unit and purchase and installation of prefabricated building infrastructure, the provision of services of financial analysts for the needs of the Economic Crime Investigations Office and the conduction of activities for the information and awareness of the public especially in the areas of drug trafficking, the fight against cybercrime.

name: Information campaign against demand for sexual services from victims of trafficking in human beings
description: The purpose of the project is to run a public informational campaign, in order to make the public aware of the stricter sentences which are provided in the relevant law, against people who are willing to use sexual services from victims of trafficking in human beings, and therefore to reduce the demand for providing sexual services by the victims of trafficking. The implementation of the public informational campaign aims, as well, to stimulate, through the involvement of the media, the public’s sensitivity, in order to reduce and eventually discourage the intention of sexual exploitation and therefore the protection of the victims of trafficking.

name: Purchase and fitting of five anti-riot vehicles for the transportation of officers and purchase of three undercover vehicles
description: The purchase of 5 anti-riot vehicles and three undercover vehicles will benefit the Police in strengthening its operational duties and in ensuring quick response to incidents related to the safe transport of its members in case of emergency.

Specializované pracoviště národního centra pro kontrolu dokladů
description: Projekt byl zaměřený na modernizaci specializovaného pracoviště pro odhalování neregulérních dokladů a vybudování školicího střediska Národního centra pro kontrolu dokladů. Stávající technika již nesplňovala technické parametry pro efektivní odhalování a dokumentování nejmodernějších způsobů a trendů v napadání dokladů a absence nadstavbového školicího střediska způsobovalo, že nebylo možné kvalitně a v aktuálním čase předávat důležité informace policistům a dalším pracovníkům. Realizace projektu vedla k celkovému zlepšení situace v oblasti odhalování neregulérních cestovních dokladů zneužívaných k nelegální migraci zejména v souvislosti se současnou migrační krizí a hrozbou terorismu. Zároveň tento projekt navazoval na úkol stanovený v Schengenském plánu 2014, tj. vytvoření jednotného centra pro sběr a kontrolu dokladů. Realizace projektu byla základním předpokladem pro budoucí úspěšný chod Národního centra pro kontrolu dokladů.

name: Intenzifikace konzulárního školícího modulu
description: Projekt je zaměřen na průběžné vzdělávání konzulárních pracovníků vyslaných na konzulární oddělení zastupitelských úřadů ČR (dále ZÚ) v zahraničí. Cílem je podpora společné vízové politiky EU/Schengenu, zvýšení kvalifikace a odbornosti konzulárních pracovníků, a to formou kontinuálního vzdělávání zaměřeného na oblast právních předpisů EU/Schengenu a ČR, vztahujících se k problematice krátkodobých schengenských víz a jejich implementace v praxi. Tématem průběžných školení je problematika schengenských víz: vízové předpisy, vízové procesy a systémy. Cílená školení slouží k dalšímu  prohloubení znalostí s ohledem na regionální specifiku a aktuální problémy. Ověřování praktické aplikace uvedených unijních a navazujících národních vízových předpisů bude probíhat formou autoevaluačních cest na vybrané ZÚ.

name: Speciální výslechové místnosti
description: Vytvoření adekvátního výslechového prostředí pro zmírnění dopadu na osobnost obětí a umožnění orgánům činným v trestním řízení postupovat velmi citlivě a šetrně při jednání s oběťmi zvlášť závažných trestných činů mravnostního a násilného charakteru. Cílovou skupinou projektu byly zejména zvláště zranitelné oběti mravnostních a násilných trestných činů. Jde o děti, seniory, osoby postižené fyzickým a jiným hendikepem. V rámci získaných zkušeností z předchozích let bylo nezbytné dosáhnout maximální eliminace sekundární viktimizace obětí trestného činu,  a to zejména dětských obětí a svědků či obětí a svědků seniorského věku. Tyto oběti jsou negativní událostí značně traumatizovány a opakující se výslech působí značně negativně na jejich psychický stav. Bylo nezbytností, aby Policie ČR zajišťovala nejen kvalitní a efektivní výslech dané oběti, ale také omezení počtu výslechů.

name: Vybudování centrálního Biometrického Informačního Systému
description: V rámci projektu bude vybudován centrální Biometrický Informační Systém (dále jen „cBIS“) a pořízeny nové koncové stanice, které umožní modernizaci způsobu zpracování biometrických údajů Policií České republiky. Výrazným rozšířením funkcionalit cBISu oproti stávajícímu AFISu o bezpečnostní využití biometrie a modernizací stávajících funkcionalit dojde k rychlejšímu a komplexnějšímu zpracování biometrických údajů. Tím bude dosaženo obsloužení modernizovaných a nově tvořených evropských i národních informačních systémů, vyřízení většího množství dotazů a ostatních požadavků v oblasti identifikace osob, a tím zvýšení bezpečnosti, ochrany životů občanů ČR i EU, dodržení závazných směrnic a smluv, zlepšení mezinárodní spolupráce v boji s terorismem a organizovanou trestnou činností.

name: Národní projekt EES I - Implementace systému EES
description: V rámci projektu dojde k implementaci Nařízení Evropského parlamentu a Rady (EU) č. 2017/2226 (ES), kterým se zřizuje Systém vstupu/výstupu (EES) pro registraci údajů o vstupu a výstupu a údajů o odepření vstupu, pokud jde o státní příslušníky třetích zemí překračující vnější hranice členských států, kterým se stanoví podmínky přístupu do systému EES pro účely vymáhání práva a kterým se mění Úmluva k provedení Schengenské dohody a nařízení (ES) č. 767/2008 a (EU) č. 1077/2011 a Nařízení Evropského parlamentu a Rady (EU) č. 2017/2225, kterým se mění nařízení (EU) 2016/399, pokud jde o používání Systému vstupu/výstupu (EES). Hlavním cílem implementace výše uvedených nařízení a vybudování Systému vstupu/výstupu (EES) je zvýšit úroveň správy vnějších hranic, předcházet nedovolenému přistěhovalectví a usnadňovat řízení migračních toků.

name: Národní projekt EES II - Pořízení technologií
description: V rámci projektu dojde k dodávce centrálního a lokálního HW a koncových periferií pro Systém vstupu/výstupu (EES), včetně integrace se systémy stávající vnitrostátní pohraniční infrastruktury v souvislosti s implementací Nařízení Evropského parlamentu a Rady (EU) č. 2017/ 2226 (ES), kterým se zřizuje Systém vstupu/výstupu (EES) pro registraci údajů o vstupu a výstupu a údajů o odepření vstupu, pokud jde o státní příslušníky třetích zemí překračující vnější hranice členských států, kterým se stanoví podmínky přístupu do systému EES pro účely vymáhání práva a kterým se mění Úmluva k provedení Schengenské dohody a nařízení (ES) č. 767/2008 a (EU) č. 1077/2011 a Nařízení Evropského parlamentu a Rady (EU)č. 2017/2225, kterým se mění nařízení (EU) 2016/399, pokud jde o používání Systému vstupu/výstupu (EES).

name: Pořízení zařízení ke kontrole dokladů na druhé kontrolní linii
description: V rámci projektu bylo pořízeno nové vybavení specializovaných pracovišť na mezinárodních letištích provádějících kontrolu cestovních dokladů ve druhé kontrolní linii za účelem ověřování pravosti cestovních dokladů. Pořízením moderních videospektrálních komparátorů, stereomikroskopů a profesionálních scannerů bylo v souladu s plněním Národního schengenského plánu 2014 a s ohledem na výsledky hodnocení zranitelnosti členských států prováděného Agenturou FRONTEX bylo dosaženo zvýšení úrovně technického vybavení těchto specializovaných pracovišť a tím zefektivnění odhalování pozměněných a padělaných dokladů.

name: Obměna a nákup koncových stanic NS-VIS včetně SW, periferií a školících zařízení
description: Předmětem projektu byla obměna a nákup nového HW na kontrolní stanoviště na vnější hranice schengenského prostoru (v případě ČR se jednalo o mezinárodní letiště) i na území ČR v přímé souvislosti s národní součástí vízového informačního systému (NS-VIS) jehož aktiva byla zařazena do kritické informační infrastruktury ČR – koncové stanice pro zajištění řádného výkonu služby a vybavení pro zajištění vývojových a vzdělávacích aktivit v rámci NS-VIS a připravovaného propojení s Entry/Exit systémem (EES).

name: Financování implementace priorit Politického cyklu EU/EMPACT v letech 2019-2021
description: Z důvodu pandemie COVID 19 byla realizace projektu předčasně ukončena. Projekt byl koncipován na posílení účasti zástupců Policie ČR na aktivitách Politického cyklu EU pro boj proti organizované a závažné mezinárodní trestné činnosti pro období 2018-2021, který byl implementován prostřednictvím EMPACT. Měl probíhat ve třech základních typech aktivit: vysláním dalších expertů na jednání EMPACT, vysláním expertů na stáž v zahraničí a pořádáním studijně-pracovních aktivit v ČR s případným přijetím zahraničních expertů. Bylo  plánováno posílení prostřednictvím navýšení počtu expertů zapojených do této formy mezinárodní policejní spolupráce, zintenzivnění spolupráce s příslušnými policejními útvary členských států EU a vybraných zemí a následného sdílení získaných poznatků a nejlepší praxe na národní úrovni.

name: Operativně taktická vozidla
description: Předmětem projektu byla podpora boje Národní protidrogové centrály Služby kriminální policie a vyšetřování (dále jen „NPC SKPV“) proti nedovolené výrobě a obchodu s omamnými a psychotropními látkami a jedy, a to zejména v organizovaných a mezinárodních formách.Předmět projektu byl naplněn skrze zvýšení akceschopnosti a výkonnosti specialistů NPC SKPV při provádění operativně-pátracích činností. Klíčové pro naplnění předmětu projektu bylo pořízení 15 operativně-taktických vozidel se speciálním automatizovaným detekčním systémem a dále pořízení 17ti ICT sestav včetně specializovaných softwarů pro podporu a vyhodnocení informací získaných z operativně-taktických vozidel. Pořízené vybavení umožní organizovanou drogovou činnost komplexně dokumentovat a současně vyhodnocovat bezprostředně zjištěné informace a tyto dále analyzovat.

name: Posílení technických prostředků k odhalování nelegální přepravy nebezpečných látek
description: Realizací projektu došlo k posílení a rozšíření systémových a technických opatření v podmínkách Celní správy ČR při odhalování nelegální činnosti v oblasti přepravy nebezpečných, zejména omamných a psychotropních látek. Zároveň došlo i ke snížení bezpečnostního rizika při kontrole a manipulaci s těmito látkami. Realizace projektu v sobě zahrnovala zejména pořízení speciálního vozidla vybaveného pro detekci a kontrolu v oblasti nebezpečných látek, a dále detekčních prostředků a speciálních ochranných pomůcek. Projektem jsou podpořeny útvary mobilního dohledu, pátrání a pracoviště Celně technické laboratoře (CTL), jejichž pracovníci přicházejí v rámci svých kompetencí s nebezpečnými látkami do kontaktu. Součástí realizace projektu bylo specializované školení, které bude zaměřené na užívání pořízených prostředků.

name: Upgrade systému VIS a úpravy jeho rozhraní
description: Předmětem projektu byla úprava národní součásti Vízového informačního systému (VIS) za účelem zajištění jeho kompatibility s operačním systémem Windows 10 a implementace nové technické specifikace (ICD – interface control document) VIS, která reflektuje změny vůči nově budovanému Systému vstup-výstup (dále jen „EES“). Úpravy spojené se zajištěním kompatibility nového operačního systému (dále jen OS) a koncových zařízení zahrnovaly také integraci ovladačů a rozhraní všech periferií (koncových zařízení) pro plně automatické ovládání.

name: Národní projekt SIS - Implementace SIS Recast do prostředí N.SIS
description: Předmětem projektu jsou úpravy vnitrostátního systému tvořícího součást Schengenského informačního systému (dále jen „N.SIS“), úpravy rozhraní pro národní zdrojové informační systémy poskytující data záznamů do Schengenského informačního systému (dále jen „SIS“), úpravy rozhraní pro dotazovací nástroje provádějící lustrace v SIS a rovněž úpravy rozhraní workflow systému SIRENE CZ. Tyto úpravy vycházejí z ustanovení tří nařízení EU 2018/1860,1861 a 1862 (přímo aplikovatelných právních aktů EU), která budou tvořit nový právní základ pro SIS a jejichž plnění je pro členské státy EU připojené k SIS závazné.

name: Národní projekt SIS - Obnova a posílení hardwarové infrastruktury N.SIS
description: Předmětem projektu je zajištění bezproblémového provozu a vysoké dostupnosti Schengenského informačního systému (dále jen „N.SIS“)) a některých jeho zdrojových systémů na další období prostřednictvím kompletní obměny technologické infrastruktury a HW komponent, tvořících funkční jádro národní jednotky. Součástí obnovy je přechod z platformy Intel Itanium na platformu x86.

name: Národní projekt ETIAS
description: Národní projekt ETIAS zahrnuje implementaci Evropského systému pro cestovní informace a povolení ETIAS (EUROPEAN TRAVEL INFORMATION AND AUTHORISATION SYSTEM), tj. vytvoření informačního systému Národní součásti ETIAS včetně technického vybavení databázového centra, jeho integraci se systémy stávající vnitrostátní a pohraniční infrastruktury, připojení k národnímu jednotnému rozhraní a vybudování zázemí Národní jednotky ETIAS včetně dodávky výpočetní techniky a periferií pro pracoviště Národní jednotky ETIAS

name: Výcvik služebních psů
description: Cílem projektu bylo zefektivnit úroveň ochrany zejména vnějších hranic České republiky v oblasti nelegální přepravy finanční hotovosti a omamných a psychotropních látek. Prostředkem k dosažení cíle bylo zavedení systému výcviku služebních psů určených pro kontrolu nelegální přepravy finančních prostředků a zvýšení kvality výcviku pro oblast kontroly omamných a psychotropních látek. V projektu bylo vytvoření metodiky pro výcvik psů v oblasti finanční hotovosti, nákup psů, následný výcvik. Byly pořízeny výcvikové pomůcky, vybudovány podmínky (výstavba výcvikové haly) pro zlepšení výcviku psů. Také byly pořízeny kotce pro ustájení a pro přepravu speciálně upravené automobily pro kynologické účely.Vycvičení psi jsou nasazování zejména na vybrané mezinárodní letiště.

name: Národní situační centrum ochrany hranic
description: V rámci projektu bylo vybudováno Národní situační centrum ochrany vnějších hranic (NSC OH) jako společné komunikační centrum pro Ředitelství služby cizinecké policie a Celní správu za účelem efektivního plnění úkolů ochrany a správy hranic. Předmětem projektu bylo provedení zásadní rekonstrukce prostor, účelné zařízení těchto prostor pro operační řízení a vybavení příslušnou technologií. Dále došlo k vytvoření datového skladu s možnosti provádění pokročilých analýz a pořízení/vytvoření/úprava informačních systémů pro provoz centra a ochrany hranic. NSCOH je odpovědné za operační řízení ostrahy hranic, společné provádění operačních analýz, provozu systémů ochrany hranic jako je EUROSUR, systém dohledu nad vzdušným prostorem AGAS a dále pak systému hraniční kontroly KODOX, systému předávání údajů o cestujících a využívání a kontrola biometrických zařízení v procesu hraniční kontroly (NKA).

name: Vybudování informačního systému na shromažďování, uchovávání, zpracování a předávání údajů ze jmenné evidence cestujících
description: V rámci projektu byl vybudován informační systém na shromažďování, uchovávání, zpracování a předávání údajů ze jmenné evidence cestujících z rezervačních a odbavovacích systémů leteckých dopravců (dále jen „IS PNR“) pro prevenci, odhalování, vyšetřování a stíhání teroristických trestných činů a závažné trestné činnosti. Tyto údaje jsou využívány orgány vymáhající právo, a to jak před příjezdem cestujících za účelem předcházení a odhalování trestné činnosti, tak i k analýze a vytvoření hodnotících kritérií, které jsou poté použity pro posouzení cestujících před jejich příjezdem a odjezdem.Díky analýze údajů PNR je možné účinněji bojovat proti terorismu a závažné trestné činnosti a ve svém důsledku došlo k posílení vnitřní bezpečnost, zajištění ochrany lidských životů, zlepšení mezinárodní spolupráce v předmětné oblasti a v neposlední řadě dostát mezinárodním závazkům České republiky. Realizací projektu byla naplněna podmínka Směrnice Evropského parlamentu a Rady EU 2016/681 ze dne 27. dubna 2016.

name: Vzdělávání policejních pyrotechniků
description: Projekt byl zaměřen na speciální vzdělávání policejních pyrotechniků v oblasti identifikace, konstrukce a funkce munice a speciálních postupů její likvidace vhodných pro využití v civilním sektoru s cílem minimalizace nežádoucích účinků výbuchu. Vlivem času, fyzikálních a chemických vlastností může docházet k degradaci pojistných mechanizmů v závislosti na konkrétních typech munice, což přímo ohrožuje zasahující policejní pyrotechniky. Munice většinou pochází od zahraničních výrobců, a proto bylo nutné získávat informace o munici a o způsobech její bezpečné likvidace také ze zahraničních zdrojů.Realizací projektu byla zajištěna znalost těchto informací, a to díky muniční databázi a školením, která byla zaměřena na specifickou manipulaci s municí z válečných operací, z poválečného období municí vojsk Varšavské smlouvy a municí států NATO.Cílem tohoto projektu bylo zajištění procesního a kontextového vzdělávání policejních pyrotechniků, skrze absolvování několika specifických kurzů a aplikace získaných poznatků a dovedností nejen do přímého výkonu pyrotechnických činností, ale také prostřednictvím pomůcek (filmů, maket munice, skript) předávání této odborné znalosti nově příchozím pyrotechnikům – muničním specialistům.

name: SEA DEFENCE
description: SEA Defence project will conduct a feasibility study in order to prepare a roadmap of technologies to be included in next generation of naval platforms and pursued in further European development programs. The study will address de following issues: lower detectability; higher survivability against modern surface and subsurface threats including against high-speed threats and swarming threats; reduction of ship motions; improved electric power generation and storage; capability to operate in extreme climates; topside; and increased autonomy and automation. For each area, the state of the art will be mapped and the impact of ship integration on capabilities, budget and interfaces will be assessed. Recommendations will be provided to realize innovations ready for the next generation naval platforms from their design or during their lifetime. Related PESCO project: Not Applicable
callName: Future naval platforms and related technologies

name: SMOTANET
description: The objectives of the proposed action is to design a modular, adaptive and secure tactical network. To achieve this, the SMOTANET project will: - Design tactical devices that integrate three different technologies, namely, Software Defined Radio (SDR), Mobile Ad-hoc Networks (MANET) and Software Defined Networks (SDN); - Develop testbeds based on the aforementioned devices that will be used to test and evaluate operational scenarios and the corresponding technical solutions according to well defined metrics. The testbeds will realize representative tactical scenarios, they will implement controller-to-controller, controller-to-switch, and switch-to-switch links and will ultimately unite them in a holistic network-wide network control architecture managed by SDN controllers. The Studies will deliver operational scenarios and technical requirements in cooperation with the Greek and Cyprus MoDs. The Design Activities will deliver the design specifications of the controller and the switch as well as a testbed that can evaluate the performance of relative networks under realistic conditions. Related PESCO project: Not Applicable
indexText: {"tags":[],"topicName":"Modular and adaptive tactical network to control, change and manage network behaviour, including cyber security","callName":"Cyber situational awareness and defence capabilities, military networks and technologies for secure communication and information sharing"}
callName: Cyber situational awareness and defence capabilities, military networks and technologies for secure communication and information sharing
topicName: Modular and adaptive tactical network to control, change and manage network behaviour, including cyber security

name: CUIIS - Comprehensive Underwater Intervention Information System
description: CUIIS will develop underwater technologies for the physical support and the recovery of military divers. The project “Comprehensive Underwater Intervention Information System” (CUIIS) focuses on the area of underwater technologies for physical support and recovery of divers, by building a command, control, communications and information (C4I) mission system for underwater management, underwater monitoring, situational awareness, positioning, navigation and manned-unmanned teaming. It will provide solutions to avoid/mitigate Decompression Sickness (DCS) risk, create and use a real-time underwater common operational picture through the fusion of various types of information, and ensure interoperability, coordination and de-confliction of underwater intervention activities, including manned-unmanned teaming, involving the teaming of a large number of divers and underwater unmanned vehicles (UUV). Related PESCO project: 1. Deployable Modular Underwater Intervention Capability Package (DIVEPACK); 2. European Union Network of Diving Centres (EUNDC)

name: Acquisition of hardware/equipment for implementation of the regulation for a entry and exit system (ESS) in the police.
description: The project includes among other things purchase and installation of self-service kiosks at airports in Copenhagen, Billund, Aalborg and Aarhus and also mobile units for control of entry and exit for Denmark's 12 police districts.

name: EES connection preparation of data centers and reception of the EES National Uniform Interface (EES NUI)
description: The project concerns the establishment of the national connection to EES, which is a part of the Danish implementation of the upcoming EES. The project entails among other things preparation of data centers for the existing VIS, so they also can be used for the EES NUI.

name: Implementation of the European Travel Information and Authorization System (ETIAS).
description: Preparation of a preliminary analysis regarding the consequences of a number of Schengen initiatives for the Danish Immigration Service, including ensuring the best possible basis for implementing ETIAS in Denmark.

name: Pilot study of the consequences of the EU-Schengen Initiatives for the police.
description: The Danish National Police have completed a preliminary analysis of the implementation of a number of initiatives in the Schengen area. The purpose is to enable the Danish National Police to make a decision on how to work further with the initiatives, i.e. initiation and organization of specific projects in the Danish National Police.

name: Installation of ABC e-gates at Copenhagen Airport.
description: Setting up 9 ABC e-gates for controlling arrivals and departures in Copenhagen Airport.

name: Adjustments of the national visa system IVR-VIS in connection with the implementation of ESS.
description: Adjustment of the national visa system as a consequence of the changes that the implementation of EES brings. The work includes among other things preparation of a GAPanalysis and changes in the user interface.

name: Completion of the changes to the visa code of 13 July 2009.
description: The project will implement the changes to the Danish visa system that are necessary to ensure that the national interface with the EU's central VIS is in accordance with the changes, as a result of the latest revision of the Visa Code.

name: GOSSRA
description: GOSSRA carried out research in the development of a Soldier System Reference Architecture ready for standardization which covered electronics, voice and data communication, software, human interface devices, sensors, and effectors. The GOSSRA study on Generic Open Soldier Systems Reference Architecture researched in the development and validation of the desired Reference Architecture by identifying trends and potentials with respect to operations and technologies; reviewing, refining and integrating the STASS I+II architectures; validating and enhancing the integrated architecture with respect to operational issues, maintenance and logistics, and technical issues; formulating the architecture for standardization; and finally technically validating, demonstrating and refining the architecture.

name: CBRN-RSS – Chemical, Biological and Nuclear Reconnaissance and Surveillance System
description: CBRN RSS will enable the early detection and reconnaissance of threats for the increased safety of soldiers, first responders and the general population. The project “CBRN Reconnaissance and Surveillance System” (CBRN RSS) seeks to strengthen the EU Member States’ reconnaissance, surveillance and incident management capabilities against CBRN agents by delivering a whole CBRN Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) system demonstrating the operational capability for cooperative, integrative and transnational ISR missions. Related PESCO project: Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Nuclear (CBRN) Surveillance as a Service (CBRN SaaS)

name: DECISMAR
description: The objective of the DECISMAR project is to develop a decision support toolbox (DSTx), implemented as a cyber-secured and future-proofed integrated IT environment The DSTx will provide a dynamic and interactive approach for conducting feasibility studies which aim to support the upgrade of maritime surveillance under the scope of both current and future defined High-Level Operational Requirements (HLORs) of the PESCO Project Upgrade of Maritime Surveillance. Related PESCO project: UPGRADE OF MARITIME SURVEILLANCE

name: METAMASK
description: Development and demonstration of metamaterials for electromagnetic camouflage of military equipment. The METAMASK project aims to develop an experimental demonstrator of a new technology for radar camouflage and/or illusion, which is based on a new type of adaptive space-time modulated, active metasurface.

name: INTEGRAL - Innovative and iNteroperable Technologies for spacE Global Recognition and Alert
description: INTEGRAL will contribute to the development of a Recognized Space Picture and a space intelligence capability, based on functions and services deployed through a European military SSA Command and Control system. The project “Innovative and iNteroperable Technologies for spacE Global Recognition and Alert” (INTEGRAL) will study, design, prototype and test an advanced space Command and Control (C2) flexible and modular architecture to process and exploit Space Situational Awareness (SSA) data generated from sensors and enhanced catalogues in order to provide a complete military space picture. Services and functions will bring the highest technological value, relying on innovative algorithms based on Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning to overcome the limitations of the current SSA C2 systems, paving the way towards the achievement of a European independence on military SSA. Related PESCO project: European Military Space Surveillance Awareness Network (EU‐SSA‐N)

name: DRONEDGE E
description: The DRONEDGE E project proposes to transfer an existing 3D swarm simulator to the real world implemented on actual fixed wing drones. DRONEDGE E will study the feasibility of a novel architecture, which can be applied to unmanned air systems as well as hybrid systems. Related PESCO project: Not Applicable

name: Increasing Criminal Intelligence
Acquisition of Drug Analyzers
description: Modern reusable drug analyzers were purchased, the use of which increases the value of the evidence collected in criminal proceedings and reduces the costs of expertise.

name: Research and Development for the Development of Proof Drug Test Prototype II
Language training for security officials
Prevention of Crime through Prevention of Trafficking in Human Beings
description: Project framework for prevention activities to raise public awareness of the various forms of trafficking, to shape their attitudes and to direct them to services for victims through various channels (web environment, street advertising , commercials in public places, including public transport).

name: CBRN Capacity Building II
description: The project aims to develop the detection capacity of chemical and biological warfare agents and to increase the defense capacity of officials responding to CBRN events.
