description: The liaison officers will combat cross-border cross-sectoral crime, such as trafficking in human beings and illegal immigration, by participating in the processing of applications for entry permits and background checks of applicants, as well as by liaison officers sent by local authorities, airlines and other Member States. The liaison officers report current illegal immigration phenomena in their country of residence to the Finnish authorities. The project includes the costs of the Beijing and Moscow liaison officers of the Border Guard .

name: PEES - Poliisin muutokset EES-asetuksen toimeenpanemiseksi
description: The project’s goal is to plan and implement the changes necessitated by Regulation (EU) 2017/2226 of the European Parliament and of the Council (EES Regulation) to police information systems. The project has launched slightly behind schedule and has, to this point, involved mainly planning tasks. The delay is due to the changes in operating environment resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic. According to the beneficiary, the delay will not impact the project’s implementation or scheduled completion time.

name: EES integroinnit kansalliseen rajainfrastruktuuriin
description: The Finnish Border Guard co-ordinates the technical implementation of the Entry-Exit System on the national level and oversees integration of the border infrastructure required by the EES Regulation (EU) 2017/2226 with the National Unified Interface (NUI). The project’s goal is to investigate and describe features and possible implementation methods in official systems relevant to the adoption of the EES, as well as integrate the systems and border control equipment with the EES. The project began on 15 February 2020. The project’s launch has been delayed, and to date, work on the project has consisted of preparations, specification work and tendering for consultants, among other tasks. The project will be returned to schedule as it progresses.

name: EES:n käyttöönotto
description: The project implements upgrades required by the EES directive in IT systems used by the Finnish Immigration Service and related integrations as well as information exchange with the national interface. The project was not launched in practice until 13 May, when a project manager was assigned for the project. The project has been drafted an updated plan of action that takes into account the delay in launching the project. Most preliminary tasks related to project administration have been completed. Recruiting for the project is still underway and the project’s staff currently consists only of the project manager. After recruiting is completed, the project should proceed as planned over the course of the second reporting period.

name: RANKKA, Tekoälyn ja ohjelmistorobotiikan mahdolllisuuksien tutkiminen ja hyödyntäminen osana rahanpesun ja terrorismin rahoituksen estämistä, paljastamista ja selvittämistä KRP:n Rahanpesun selvittelykeskuksessa
description: The goal is to investigate the potential uses of artificial intelligence and software robotics in tasks related to anti-money laundering and the prevention, detection and investigation of terrorist financing. The goal is to gradually automate both routine tasks and the detection of so-called silent signals. The project is the first of its kind in the police organisation. The lessons, experiences and measurable results gained in the project will indicate whether similar projects could be implemented in other functions and by what means. Performing tasks that are based on clear, mechanical rules using human resources is not financially sound practice. When used optimally as part of expert tasks, artificial intelligence is a useful tool to aid in decision-making.

name: KEHUMEESI
description: The project’s goal is to implement the changes required by the EU Entry/Exit System (EES) to the visa information system. The project also creates, for other authorities, the prerequisites to use the EES by providing the necessary central database connection and data centre services. The project enforces the requirements of the EES Regulation (EU) 2017/2226 on the development and implementation of the EU Entry/Exit System.

name: Reach Out 3
description: The project’s goal is to support families and individuals affected by violent radicalisation and extremism by providing information to aid in support measures through investigative work and training, and by increasing social awareness of the phenomena. The project has created a direct connection with families in a vulnerable position to support the goal of developing support measures. In addition, through strategic communication, the project has built trust between stakeholders. These efforts have been important during the pandemic. The ability to respond to co-operation needs more broadly is building a foundation for stronger future collaboration. Due to a change in the grant decision, project functions that involved plenty of international travel have been adapted to the pandemic conditions to ensure that the project’s goal can be achieved despite the pandemic.

name: CYBER EXIT - Nuorten verkkorikollisten rikoskierteen katkaisu
description: The goal of this project is to develop an operating model for breaking the cycle of crime of young cybercriminals. The target demographic are offenders aged about 15 to 25 years. The goal is to identify potential young cybercriminals and direct them away from crime or, ideally, prevent the young person from committing their first offence.

name: Automaattisten rajatarkastuslaitteistojen ylläpito
description: Operative support for the maintenance of automatic border control equipment.

name: Älykkäät rajat rajatarkastuslaitteet
description: Entry and exit data of non-EU nationals will be compiled in the European Entry/Exit System (EES) as of 2022. The central database will also hold biometric data, and this project is designed to enable the collection of the required information. The project will see the Finnish Border Guard putting out to tender and awarding contracts for facial recognition cameras to complement the existing technology at border control stations. The current fingerprint scanners will be upgraded to models capable of capturing four fingerprints simultaneously. The new equipment and software will be integrated with the existing border control infrastructure and deployed by the end of 2021. These steps will make the technical infrastructure of Finland’s border control stations compatible with the EES and the associated legal requirements.

name: MRTV huoltokyky
description: ISF projects aimed at expanding the scope of border control technology and improving the interoperability of the various components of the system have been run throughout the programming period. This project is designed to ensure the capacity and performance of land border control technology. The project focuses on procuring back-up equipment for the land border control system and replacing broken and outdated equipment. Speedy access to technical maintenance is critical, as external border control relies increasingly on the technical performance of the border control system.

name: Sormenjälkilukijat EES-asetuksen toimeenpanemiseksi
description: The project involves equipping the Police with fingerprint scanners in order to implement the European EES Regulation. The aim of the project is to enable the Police to check the entry and exit records of non-EU nationals via the EES. The project will see the Police furnished with fingerprint scanners that can be used to monitor the movements of foreign nationals and control the borders with the help of EES data.

name: KATI 2 - SIS II jatkokehittäminen
description: The aim is to increase the effectiveness of controls on the external borders of the EU by improving the N.SIS interface so as to speed up the international exchange of information and to make the system easier to maintain and more flexible on the whole. This involves eliminating overlapping procedures and reducing the use of paper documents, which will lead to more efficient investigation of international criminal phenomena and better cooperation between the authorities as well as helping to increase the transparency and usability of information. Electronic document management and archiving saves time, simplifies procedures and allows officers to work faster.

name: Poliisin muutokset ETIAS-asetuksen toimeenpanemiseksi - PETIAS
description: The National Police Board’s PETIAS project is designed to upgrade the Police’s IT infrastructure to comply with the ETIAS Regulation. The changes are necessary to bring the Police’s current IT systems into line with the Regulation’s objectives. The National Police Board has identified the RENKI common consultation system as its highest priority in this respect. The goal of this project is to design and implement the changes that are necessary to make the RENKI common consultation system comply with the regulatory requirements.

name: Poliisin CBRNE-vasteen jatkokehittäminen (CBRNE2)
description: The project is designed to improve the Police’s operational performance in identifying and reacting to various kinds of chemical and radiological threats. The goal is to furnish the Police with new CBRNE equipment. In this context, CBRNE equipment refers to devices that are capable of identifying, for example, a range of chemical, radioactive and explosive substances in order for the Police to be able to respond to threats posed by these substances in as safe a manner as possible.

name: EXIT 2020 Rikollisjärjestöistä pois haluavien ja ulkomailta sotimasta palaavien väkivaltaisten henkilöiden tukeminen
description: The EXIT operating model is designed to prevent radicalisation through efficient cooperation between various arms of the government and the third sector. In addition to the authorities, the model will be made available to social services and mental health professionals. More efficient ways to interact with persons of concern can best be found by also studying lessons learned from experiments and models developed in other countries in order to build the best possible preventive and corrective system for dealing with these potentially highly dangerous individuals in a manner that promotes stability and peace in society. The benchmarked model will be documented and, if necessary, duplicated to create a single tool for preventing violent radicalisation. The project also involves designing and launching a national EXIT service to support the deradicalisation of radicalised individuals.

name: Pelastustoimen kansallisen CBRNE-tiedustelu- ja dekontaminaatiokyvyn kehittäminen
description: The project involves increasing fire and rescue services’ capacity to deal with CBRNE threats and improving the operational performance of the authorities. The project will see two fire and rescue departments (Pirkanmaa and Satakunta) joining forces and sharing equipment to effectively respond to CBRNE threats on a national level and support the authorities in charge of dealing with such incidents. The new unit will also be trained to respond to international threats through the EU Civil Protection Mechanism as of 2023.

name: Huumausainerikosten torjuntaan condensed phase FTIR -mittalaite yhdistettäväksi käytössä olevaan GC-MS-mittalaitteistoon
description: The Customs Laboratory provides analytics services that complement the crime prevention efforts of, for example, Customs and the Police. One of the laboratory’s most important tasks is to identify narcotic substances and designer drugs. The project is aimed at raising the technological capacity of the Customs Laboratory to a new level by incorporating a new measuring instrument into the existing metrics infrastructure in order to continue providing reliable, efficient, state-of-the-art analytics for the identification of narcotics and designer drugs.

name: ETIAS
description: The Finnish Immigration Service’s ETIAS project is aimed at upgrading Finland’s current IT infrastructure so as to make it compatible with the European Travel Information and Authorisation System (ETIAS) from the Finnish Immigration Service’s perspective. The implementation stage involves building a new database search function for the UMA case management system and linking the system to the national user interface (NUI) to enable searching. The Finnish Immigration Service’s provisional plan is to automate all or the majority of ETIAS searches. The project will give the Finnish Immigration Service the ability to use its case management system to perform the functions required under EU laws and to use the ETIAS system in a reliable, safe and convenient manner. The additional information produced by the ETIAS system will also facilitate decision-making at the Finnish Immigration Service.

name: SIS Recast -Poliisi
description: The project involves upgrading the Police’s information systems in order to ensure compliance with SIS recast requirements. Underlying the project are Regulations (EU) 2018/1862, (EU) 2018/1861 and (EU) 2018/1860. The project involves, among other things, incorporating SIS recast changes relating to alerts and queries into the Police’s information systems and ensuring compliance with availability requirements in so far as is possible with assistance from the Fund.

name: Schengen operatiivinen tuki
description: Operative support for the maintenance and support functions and operating services of the Schengen Information System (SISII).

name: MIAMI, kehityshanke ulkoministeriön viisumitietojärjestelmän uuden identiteetin- ja pääsynhallinnan ratkaisun kehittämiseen
description: The objective of the project is to reform the entire VISA user management system, including the user management application, server platform and SSO and federated identity management solutions. The project will begin with a preparatory study aimed at identifying alternative ways to replace the current solution and coming up with recommendations as to how user management and identification in the context of the VISA system should be provided for in the future. The implementation stage will be based on the recommendations set out in the preliminary report.

name: Poliisin suorituskyvyn kehittäminen (POSUKE)
description: The National Police Board will centrally acquire night vision equipment necessary in counter-terrorism and other demanding duties carried out by the special operations groups (VATI) of police departments. The equipment will be distributed to the different police units based on a separate needs analysis.

name: Pelastustoimen kansallisen CBRNE-tiedustelu- ja dekontaminaatio-osaamisen kehittäminen
description: The project aims to develop the CBRNE competence of rescue services and the operating capacity of the authorities. A joint unit of two rescue departments (Pirkanmaa and Satakunta) will be established and trained in the project. The unit will have the ability to operate nationwide in CBRNE situations and support the authorities in charge. As of 2023, the unit may also be deployed for international assignments through the EU Civil Protection Mechanism.

name: Kyberrikostorjunnan erikoistumisopinnot (Kyber-EOP)
description: The project focuses on developing cyber training to improve the authorities’ competence and ability to prevent cybercrime. The goal of the project is to develop and increase the cyber training offered by the Police University College, which will enable the College to launch a new specialisation module in cybercrime prevention in the autumn of 2022. Research findings from the cyber sector will be used to design the training provided. The range of training will be developed in cooperation with international stakeholders, the most important of which are the Nordic Computer Forensic Investigators (NCFI) and the non-profit European Cybercrime Training and Education Group (ECTEG). In addition, prior training content and materials will also be updated and maintained in the Kyber-EOP project.

name: Rajaturvallisuuskoulutuksen koulutusympäristön kehittäminen
description: The project involves the renovation of the pistol range of the Border and Coast Guard Academy and the Southeast Finland Border Guard and is part of the renovation of the entire shooting range environment. The renovation will result in improved functionality and safety of the shooting ranges, as well as in better protection against weather conditions and shooting noise.

name: Partioajoneuvokaluston uudistaminen III
description: Two heavy patrol vehicles will be acquired and assigned to the Lapland Border Guard and the Southeast Finland Border Guard on the EU’s external border. The goal of the acquisition is to improve border security. The good operational mobility of patrols as well as functioning data connections are an important part of the border patrols’ ability to carry out border security assignments.

name: Asiakirjatutkintalaitteiden hankinta
description: In a public procurement process, the Finnish Border Guard will renew the document inspection devices used for border control purposes. The current devices are nearing the end of their life cycle, and must therefore be replaced with new ones.

name: EES-laitteiston hankinta ja käyttöönotto Tullilla
description: The Customs project has been set up to implement the changes caused by the introduction of the EES border crossing information system. The Customs project enables Customs to operate in accordance with the EES regulations. The project will provide border inspection equipment that meets the requirements of the EES system. The equipment will be delivered to all border crossing points and will be installed for the use of persons performing customs border control tasks, all users will be trained and commissioned according to a common schedule in spring 2022.

name: MIAMI 2 ulkoministeriön viisumitietojärjestelmän uuden identiteetin- ja pääsynhallinnan ratkaisun käyttöönotto
description: The project aims to introduce a new VISA user management solution. All parties using the Finnish VISA visa system, diplomatic missions, the Ministry for Foreign Affairs and stakeholders will adopt the new solution. User management, user identification and the role of access rights are a critical part of issuing visas in Finland, and without effective user management, it will not be possible to process visa applications in Finland.

name: THAT2 - Toimiva hälytys- ja auttamisketju ja tilannejohtaminen
description: The THAT2 project will strengthen the functional alert and assistance chain created by the first THAT project between authorities by further developing the adapter between the KEJO field system and the ERICA emergency call information system, taking into account the further development of the KEJO system. The first THAT project of the Police Board identified critical areas for development in the integration of the above-mentioned information systems, which will be implemented during the THAT2 project. The implementation work in the THAT2 project will enable the implementation of a more comprehensive and better supportive integration between the systems. Closer integration between systems also enhances the user experience.

name: ETIAS kansallinen toimeenpano
description: The project will implement the technical measures to enable the implementation of the European Travel Information and Authorization System (ETIAS) at the national ETIAS unit and at the external borders. Project funding will also be used to equip and launch the national ETIAS unit.

name: Kauko-ohjatun ilma-aluksen käytön kokonaisjärjestelmät vartiolaivoille
description: The project will acquire at least two Remotely Piloted Aircraft Systems (RPAS) suitable for the marine operating environment for use by the Border Guard. The systems support the performance of operational tasks and provide a snapshot of the needs of the control center and the various units. The systems to be procured in this project are designed to be deployed on patrol vessels.

name: Valvontakalusto
description: Operative support for the fuel costs of the patrol vessel Turva, which arise from the daily external border control carried out on board.

name: Mobiili-RATAS 2022
description: The project includes a preliminary study related to the work and working conditions, the definition of the application, its implementation and commissioning with information security audits. The project will implement an application for mobile border controls that will meet today's technical and operational requirements and streamline border controls.

name: Automaattisten rajatarkastuslaitteistojen uudistaminen II
description: The automated border control equipment and its back-end system have reached the end of their life cycle, which means that they need to be upgraded to meet current and known future requirements. The overhaul will take into account the changes brought about by the EU's Smart Borders border controls, in particular the new processes and inspection requirements related to the introduction of the Entry-Exit system, which will expand the system with self-service kiosks and additional equipment to enhance service counter controls.

name: Extending the mattress life cycle
description: In the project, the police will ensure the technical quality of the information system , which is central to crime prevention , the availability of the information and the interoperability with the systems to be introduced later . Together with the system supplier, the National Board of Police will update the technology used in the Police Information System to a level that will ensure the continued use of the information system that is central to policing . With the upgrade, the life cycle of the system will be secured so that other ongoing information system projects of the police will be completed. This will ensure the high-quality and cost-effective production of crime prevention services in particular .

name: EES integrations into national border infrastructure
description: A solution description of the implementation of the Security Bus and Port connections and the technical implementation of the connections will be implemented. Obtain related to implementation of the EES the IT-consultancy to ensure the implementation of the project schedule. Implement the integration of document and fingerprint readers and face cameras into the border control application for EES use.

name: Operational Analysis and Knowledge-Based Resource Planning Development Project (OPASTIN)
description: The project will define the operating methods of the police's information -driven activities and create a readiness for the systematic use of information, implement knowledge-based allocation of resources and support preventive activities. Identify the needs for knowledge-based activities for technological solutions to support the fight against serious crime and create better conditions for effective resource allocation and operational analysis. In a new way, the police are able to map and anticipate criminal behavior in time and area, as well as identify new perpetrators, fight serious crime and prevent criminal behavior. The project creates the capacity to implement new IT solutions to support operations. The allocation of measures and the planning of the use of resources will in future be based effectively on operational analysis, strategic planning and the extensive use of existing knowledge and modern technology.

name: Visitor activity in court
description: The project will develop a model for volunteer on -call duty in the courts to support litigants who are to be heard for evidentiary purposes, in practice litigants and other witnesses in criminal proceedings. The project trains around 100 volunteers in five locations to get a basic understanding of what is going on at the court hearing, what is the role of the witness and the party involved, and what support they need to go to court. The project will also produce a plain language and practical guide for witnesses and litigants, which will be translated into Swedish and English. The model developed in the project will be disseminated to district and court courts throughout Finland through the Crime Victim Support Network . This improves the quality of the judicial process and also the position of the victim of the crime.

name: Ship camera systems II
description: Enhance vessel monitoring capabilities by acquiring one camera sensor (daylight and thermal camera and image stabilization mechanics) for the patrol boat.

name: Fight against organized crime through administrative methods
description: Research will be launched to identify the current state of administrative crime prevention and the legal framework for administrative control . On the basis of the study, a national operating model for the fight against administrative crime will be created . Launch operational activities based on knowledge -based management aimed at undermining the conditions for organized and other serious crime , which will be used to leverage the experience gained in scientific research.

name: CBRNE course for first responders
description: The aim is to increase CBRNE awareness, develop the operational readiness and occupational safety of operational actors, and develop cooperation with authorities. CBRNE courses are held in 4-6 regions for co-operation authorities. Where possible, the courses are implemented locally, at the Rescue Institute or in the rescue exercise area of ​​Western Finland , taking into account expediency and cost-effectiveness . The project will benefit police departments, rescue services and hospital districts that provide emergency care services. The number of employees to be trained is 88-132 .

name: Introduction of EES
description: In practice, the project implements the information system changes of the Finnish Immigration Service required by the EES Regulation in the parts required by the new functions , as well as the related integration and data transfer with the national interface.

name: Improving the control capability of helicopters
description: The aim of the project is to improve the control of the external border by increasing the ability of aircraft to detect and monitor targets in different conditions by acquiring an EOS system. The project will significantly increase the effectiveness of external border controls on aircraft . At the same time, flight safety is improved in various tasks by raising the flight altitude. The project includes the acquisition and installation of the system. At the same time, aircraft radios will be upgraded to new standards, thus ensuring the continuity of external border controls.

name: MobileVIS II
description: Customs needs to provide its mobile teams with location-independent, ie mobile, visa issuance equipment to issue visas to seafarers. The hardware includes a portable VIS workstation, a visa printer , a camera and flash system with stands, a chip passport reader and a fingerprint scanner with software licenses, a gray background and a carrying case for the equipment. A total of 4-6 pieces of mobile equipment will be purchased within the budget.

name: Background systems for technical information acquisition , TELEPA
description: The project will produce and develop harmonized and centralized systems and methods for intelligence and technical intelligence gathering for pre-trial investigation authorities .

name: BITCOIN-JIT
description: The use of virtual currencies , crime, money laundering and the conversion of criminal proceeds into virtual assets have increased and are increasing. The new phenomenon requires effective control measures by the police.

name: KYBOL
description: On April 15, 2015, a cybercrime prevention center was established in the Central Criminal Police , which housed a total of about 45 people. The key strategic direction of the police strategy is that the police are in an effective position to prevent, detect and investigate crimes against and exploiting the cyber environment . The project develops the operational capacity of the Cybercrime Center.

name: Border guard equipment
description: Acquisition of personal tactical protective equipment for border guards, which is necessary from the point of view of occupational safety when delivering in the event of a weapons threat. At present, the Border Guard does not have the necessary equipment suitable for situations of arms threats (excluding special operations units).

name: EES ABC
description: In connection with the acquisition of the automatic border control lines at Helsinki-Vantaa Airport, the Finnish Border Guard has taken into account the new border control procedures for automatic border controls made possible by the Schengen Borders Code in connection with the introduction of the EES system . The overall system utilization in connection with the EES system, incl. self-service kiosks and automatic border control lines require the integration of hardware software into the harmonized national interface of the EES system and the related border control infrastructure. In connection with the project, a software package enabling the functions required by the EES system will be defined, implemented and tested, and will be introduced . These include, in particular , the use of self-service facilities by third-country nationals , the related process and the exchange of information with the EES system.

name: RAMAN hardware purchases
description: Equip customs control units at border crossing points with new control technology. The acquisition of RAMAN material identifiers will facilitate and simplify the customs control and inspection process. Legal consignments continue their journey, small consignments can be immediately carried forward in criminal proceedings and only relevant consignments are delivered to the laboratory. The device must be suitable for the identification of explosives, toxic and other chemicals, as well as solid and liquid drugs, narcotics and modified drugs . RAMAN can also be used to identify legal but dangerous chemicals and ensure that the warning labels associated with their transport are in order. The project strengthens Finland's internal security. At the EU's external borders, equipment and surveillance contribute to the implementation of the EU 's internal security strategy.

name: Border Guard Training Ship
description: To transform the training vessel acquired for the use of the Border and Coast Guard School into a modern, cost-effective, work-safe training vessel suitable for various training situations in border safety training.

name: Reach Out 2
description: The Reach Out project supports the development and networking of cooperation between authorities, different religious communities and organizations . This will increase the involvement and capacity of different communities and organizations to work together multilaterally to prevent VE . The project aims to raise awareness of the impact of VE and radicalization on society and the role of different actors in preventing the phenomenon, and to strengthen the coordination of work at local and national level. By increasing knowledge, understanding and cooperation , we can strengthen the capacity of our society to support those affected by the phenomenon and to develop measures to eradicate the phenomenon . The project will focus on raising awareness and building networking among key actors , developing support measures for families affected primarily by the phenomenon , and piloting local cooperation models in cooperation with partners, key authorities and communities.

name: MRTV service capability
description: The extension of the scope of technical border control and the harmonization of parts of the system have been implemented as ISF projects throughout the funding period. The project will ensure the operational capability and performance of technical control of land borders. The focus of the project is on the replacement procurement of spare, broken and obsolete equipment for the technical control system of the land border. Prompt maintenance of technical equipment must be ensured, as external border control relies more and more on the performance of the technical control system.

name: Border control at the patrol level in optronic equipment
description: The acquired optocoupler will be used to maintain and develop the Border Guard's surveillance patrol- level performance in demanding lighting conditions and in the dark.

name: Step marks for dialogic identification
description: Steps for dialogical identification are a two-year project implemented by Protupipiste ry, which creates tools suitable for organizations to identify victims of human trafficking and a unified data collection model on the number of victims of human trafficking that come to the organizations' attention. The data collection model is based on the current situation of human trafficking that comes to the attention of the organizations . The tools being developed are practical tools for identifying victims and addressing trafficking. The project emphasizes dialogue between organizations, public authorities and vulnerable groups. The project will be implemented in co-operation with so-called direct customers working with victims of human trafficking . with the four-clover organizations - Monika-Naiset liitto ry, Refugee Counseling, Pro-tukipiste ry and Crime Victim Support . Em. In addition to the organizations, the project steering group includes a representative of the Trafficking in Human Beings Rapporteur, the Anti-Trafficking Coordinator and a representative of the Victims of Trafficking Assistance System .

name: Construction and equipment of the NCC center
description: The space security of the NCC center will be built to meet the set security requirements for personnel and facilities, and the presentation and management system of ICT systems will be integrated . The National Coordination Center (NCC) is able to effectively create a national situational picture of the situation in border areas through various situational awareness systems , to transmit situational awareness to other national authorities and to monitor and update the situation in the neighboring and European regions through Eurosur .

name: Smart cross- border control devices
description: From 2022, the European Entry Exit System (EES) will store border crossing information for third-country nationals . The central system also stores biometric data that the project will allow to be collected . During the project, the Border Guard will tender and procure facial cameras as a new technology for border checkpoints. Existing fingerprint readers will be upgraded to allow four fingers to be read and recorded simultaneously . The equipment to be procured and related software will be integrated into the existing border control infrastructure and put into operational use by the end of 2021. These measures will bring the technical set of border inspection posts into line with the requirements of the EES system and related legislation.

name: Anchor activity development raditoiminnassa
description: The project will develop guidelines for anchor activities to prevent violent radicalization and extremism. The guidelines will be developed based on information systematically collected from anchor actors. In addition, information from the Nordic comparison and literature is used in their preparation . The handbook will meet current requirements for evidence-based decision-making and work (evidence based policy, VNK 2013). The Code of Conduct is published as an electronic handbook, and training is provided on its use and content. The electronic manual is intended to support the start-up and implementation of anchor activities and contains information for the work of multi-authority employees, as well as for the management of operations and the monitoring and evaluation of results.

name: Further development of the police CBRNE response (CBRNE2)
description: The project will improve the operational performance of the police to identify and respond to various chemical and radiation situations. The project aims to provide the police with CBRNE equipment. CBRNE equipment refers to devices that can identify e.g. various chemical, radioactive and explosive substances and to react as safely as possible to the situations caused by them.

name: Exit 2
description: In early 2019, the Central Criminal Police will launch the Exit 2 project, in which the previously created Exit operating model will be implemented and established as a working model for the prevention of organized crime and violent radicalization throughout the police. The purpose of the policy is to help volunteers break free from the sphere of influence of organized crime or the sphere of influence of a violent radical group or ideology . The Exit 2 project will also deepen previously created operational know-how and increase the scope of relief work throughout the country.

name: HOPE
description: Ensuring the performance of the PTR authorities' shared analysis system , as well as increasing the capacity to meet the large amounts of data handled, especially in cybercrime . Beneficiaries of the project Customs Control Department , Police and Border Guard.

name: Development of cross-border radio communication models for public authorities
description: There is a growing need for Finnish security authorities to communicate in field missions with similar actors in neighboring countries , either across the border or when actors move across the border in the neighboring country's territory. The success of the cross-border mission depends to a large extent on the ability to communicate with the host country's units and its command centers . Increased communication needs have been driven by increased cooperation between neighboring authorities and international cooperation agreements such as Frontex or Schengen . The aim of the project is to develop cross-border co - operation between the Finnish safety authorities and the Norwegian and Swedish safety authorities by developing common operational and communications models for enhancing cross-border radio communications in field operations using combined TETRA authority radio networks.

name: Liaison activities in Beijing and Moscow
description: The project includes the activities of two Border Guard liaison officers in Beijing and Moscow. Contact persons e.g. participate in the processing of applications for entry permits and background checks of applicants , cooperate with local authorities, airlines and liaison officers sent by other Member States . The liaison officers will be involved in the fight against illegal immigration, trafficking in human beings and other cross-border crime.

name: Monitoring systems and equipment
description: The project includes annual fees for contracts for the maintenance and servicing of RVT and MOTVJ systems , as well as fuel costs for the patrol vessel Turva. The Border Guard Information System (RVT) is a key tool in the operational activities of the Border Guard . MOTVJ is an operational information system for maritime surveillance. Fuel costs for a patrol vessel arise from the daily external border surveillance carried out on board ships.

name: Document readers for portable border control devices
description: Acquisition of document readers for use, for example, with portable border inspection equipment for on-board inspections .

name: Development and enhancement of Russian language education II
description: The project will improve the Russian language skills of the staff of the Border Guard and other border authorities. The Russian language skills of border guards need to be improved so that more and more people can carry out a thorough entry check in full Russian and identify the problems that arise in this connection. This also reduces the need to use interpreters and speeds up things . An employee will be hired for the project to make modern teaching materials and provide instruction. In addition, the project develops teaching equipment and teachers' skills, both supporting and enabling the implementation of staff training . It is possible for other authorities to apply for contact teaching courses if not all places are available

name: BODY HONEY
description: With the KEHUMESES project, the Ministry for Foreign Affairs ensures that the information systems required by the European Commission and the IT Agency are implemented nationally. The development of information systems (Visa Information System and Border Crossing Information System ) takes place in accordance with EU requirements, guarantees participation in mandatory joint testing phases , and creates conditions for the use of the EES border crossing system for national authorities by providing data center services (VIS TAP and NUI). The project will use purchasing services for information systems, procuring infrastructure, services, development work, testing phase and deployment phase for eu-LISA shared systems.

name: TERHA / terrorism and the fight against money laundering more effective and new methods development
description: The project explores the means of terrorist financing and money laundering and develops new approaches to detecting, combating and investigating them.

name: SIS II operation and maintenance services
description: The funding received will provide maintenance and operation services for the national Schengen Information System (SIS II) . SIS II is used by the following authorities: police, border, customs, the Finnish Immigration Service and the Ministry for Foreign Affairs. The SIS II is owned by the National Board of Police.

name: Maintenance and operating costs of patrol vessels
description: Operational support is targeted at the patrol vessels Merikarhu and Turva, which carry out external border control in the Gulf of Finland . Docking involves major repairs and maintenance that cannot be performed during normal operation. Bug fixes are implemented as needed. Fuel costs are incurred as a result of daily external border controls.

name: Cyber ​​education
description: The project will increase the knowledge and skills of public authorities in the fight against cybercrime by developing cyber education. This will be achieved by developing cybercrime course offerings in cooperation with domestic and international authorities and stakeholders, and by obtaining training from key cyber security actors. The purpose of the project is to contribute to the development of the content of the courses included in the attached cybercrime training course provider and to the implementation of these courses. The results of the training needs survey and the objectives of the EUSA funds are taken into account in the selection of study courses to be implemented with the help of the project . The beneficiaries are officials from key cybercrime authorities .

name: Condensed phase GC-FTIR device for the fight against drug offenses
description: Condensed phase GC-FTIR - with the acquisition of measuring equipment, the conditions for the identification of drugs and modified drugs will be updated. The action will contribute to the fight against serious drug crime. Condensed phase GC-FTIR device technology is not currently available in any monitoring laboratory in Finland . The device technology is able to identify , among other things, drugs and modified drugs from samples that can be reliably analyzed.

name: Ship camera systems
description: Complement the vessel monitoring capability by ordering a camera sensor (daylight and thermal camera and image stabilization mechanics) for the patrol boat. In addition, a monitoring workstation will be acquired for patrol vessels and patrol boats to enhance and speed up the operator's monitoring work.

name: Passenger
description: On 21 April 2016, the Council adopted a Directive on the EU Passenger Name Record (PNR) and the use of Passenger Name Record data for the prevention, detection, investigation and prosecution of terrorist offenses and serious crime . The purpose of the Directive is to regulate the transfer of PNR data of international air passengers from airlines to Member States and the processing of such data by competent authorities. The Directive requires Member States to set up Passenger Information Units responsible for the collection, storage and processing of PNR data by air carriers . The Commission has provided additional funding to Member States' ISF-P fund for the development of the Passenger Information System (PNR). This project will further develop the Passenger Information Unit (PIU) and the PNR information system. The activities to be carried out relate to the development of the national PIU and the information system.

name: Reach Out
description: The Reach Out project supports the development and networking of cooperation between authorities, different religious communities and organizations . This will increase the involvement and capacity of different communities and organizations to work together multilaterally to prevent VE . The project aims to raise awareness of the effects of VE and radicalization on society and the role of different actors in preventing the phenomenon, and to strengthen the coordination of work at local and national level. By increasing knowledge and understanding and cooperation, we can strengthen the capacity of our society to support those affected by the phenomenon and to develop measures to eradicate the phenomenon. The main partners in the project are Foreign Aid, the Peace Mediation Network of Religious and Traditional Leaders and the Ministry of the Interior. Other partners include RadiNet project and Helsinki VE's local prevention network.

name: Transitional system and process changes for the new National Visa Information System .
description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs will gradually introduce a new national visa information system, VISA. The introduction will take place in such a way that the old visa information system SUVI will operate alongside the new VISA system. The intention is to use both systems in parallel to ensure a controlled shutdown of the old system as well as the successful implementation of the new system. At the same time, the new system and process will be piloted before large-scale implementation and utilization of the system and the replacement of the old system with a new one.

name: HIRED MAN
description: A national search service will be developed, through which a search would provide information on the various national and international systems to which the user has legal access. The operational settings of the search service would be determined depending on the purpose of the search and the access rights. The project takes into account the objectives of the Commission's Interoperability Regulation . The output of the project is information exchange environments that increase the exchange of information (centralized search service), which make it possible to make inquiries e.g. national, national or EU shared systems on a user-driven basis. The result of the project is a secure and as automated query system as possible for national and international information systems.

name: MIAMI, development project for the development of a new identity and access management solution for the Ministry for Foreign Affairs' visa information system
description: The project aims to modernize the entire VISA user management, including SSO and federation solutions related to the user management application, server platform and user identification. The first preliminary study of the project is to identify alternative solutions to replace the current implementation, maintained by KPMG and Tieto, and to make a recommendation on how user management and user identification in VISA can be implemented in the future. The actual implementation work will be carried out on the basis of the recommendations of the preliminary study.

name: Police changes to implement the ETIAS Regulation - PETIAS
description: The PETIAS project of the Police Board implements the changes to police information systems required by the ETIAS Regulation adopted by the European Parliament and the Council . At present, police information systems are unable to meet the objective of the regulation, so changes need to be made. The National Board of Police has identified that changes are primarily needed to the Slave Joint Inquiry System . The aim of this project is to plan and implement the changes needed to the slave survey system to implement the requirements of the regulation.

name: KEVAK 2020 - the Border Guard light fleet performance in 2020
description: A border fleet development project is underway at the Border Guard to ensure maritime capability . In this project, funding is being sought for one new series of boats. As a whole, the fleet project will replace the aged and variegated fleet with a new type of modern, reliable and high-performance and life-cycle economic boat concept. In Frontex operations, border control tasks often lead to maritime rescue missions . The characteristics of the boat emerge as rescue safety from the water and a very large evacuation capacity compared to the size class . The new Boat Type will not only replace the previous boats, but will be a clearly more cost-effective and high- utilization solution for operational tasks in Finland and Frontex operations, according to the annual operational need, to be agreed separately .

name: Modernization of automatic border control equipment
description: The devices and their back -end system have reached the end of their life cycle, which means that they need to be upgraded to meet current requirements and known future requirements. The reform will take into account the changes brought about by the EU's Smart Borders border controls, in particular the new processes and control requirements related to the introduction of the Entry- Exit system , which will expand the system with self-service kiosks and additional equipment to enhance service counter controls .

name: Renewal of patrol vehicles II
description: The project will procure 21 patrol cars, 41 snowmobiles and 21 ATVs for use by the border guards of Southeast Finland, North Karelia, Kainuu and Lapland at the EU's external border. The vehicles to be acquired will improve border security. Good operational mobility of patrols is an important part of their performance in border security missions . In addition, off-road vehicles can be used to quickly target patrols, for example to inspect objects detected by the technical control system .

name: Liaison activities in Abuja and New Delhi
description: The project is a co-operation project between the Border Guard and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs , consisting of the deployment of two liaison officers in Abuja, Nigeria and New Delhi, India. The liaison officers will be involved in the visa process by clarifying the backgrounds of visa applicants and examining the authenticity of the documents related to the process . In addition, liaison officers participate in the activities of other EU delegations as necessary and train the staff of the delegations.

name: Basic course for border guards
description: In recent years, the Border Guard has had to reduce its staff in the control of the eastern border due to austerity obligations. Thus, the ability to monitor and detect is impaired. The number of border guards at the eastern border can now be increased with the help of additional staff being trained . Helsinki-Vantaa Airport needs to be increased due to new EU obligations. Mandatory registry inquiries and fingerprinting mean that an individual inspection requires more time than before. Additional staff will reduce the queuing of border checks. Additional recruitment of border guards will be implemented during 2018 and 2019 by training higher-than- normal basic courses for border guards at the Border and Coast Guard School . The courses consist of contact teaching and getting to know working life . The project includes payroll and purchasing service costs for the 2019 large course.

name: Witness protection
description: The project ensures the fulfillment of the obligations imposed by the Act on Witness Protection, which entered into force on 1 March 2015 . It regulates the protection of all persons at serious risk of violence. The project will develop tactics, technology, administration, law and national and international stakeholder cooperation related to the implementation of the witness protection program . At the end of the project, Finland will have a function that can effectively and in accordance with international standards implement special personal safety functions in situations in accordance with the law and support the activities of other authorities in other special personal safety situations. At the end of 2016 , the experience of witness protection activities in accordance with the law will enable substantiated assessments of the need for police personnel, equipment and facilities required in 2017 and onwards . In addition, in cooperation with the authorities, operating models will be created to support the exit from criminal groups.

name: Cyber ​​Competence 2020
description: The Cyber ​​Competence 2020 project will develop cyber education to enhance the knowledge and skills of public authorities in the fight against cybercrime. The purpose of the project is to develop and increase the cyber education offer of the Police University of Applied Sciences, which will enable the launch of a specialization study unit in the field of cybercrime prevention . Cyber ​​research results are utilized in the design of educational provision. The training offer is developed in cooperation with domestic and foreign stakeholders as well as education and academy partners. The IT Institute of Jyväskylä University of Applied Sciences participates in the project by implementing some of the courses. The target group of the educational offer developed as a result of the project is officials working for key cybercrime authorities . In addition to the development of training provision, the project will provide specific training for key cyber security actors for experts in cybercrime authorities .

name: Setting up new testing and production environments in the new Visa Information System .
description: The aim of the project is to set up test and production environments for the new national visa information system VISA , which will operate in the renewed CVIS (Central Visa Information System) interface application.

name: Fingerprint readers
description: Acquisition of fingerprint readers for fingerprint comparisons required for the use of the VIS . The equipment to be procured during the project is primarily wired fingerprint readers, but due to portable border control equipment, the procurement of wireless equipment is also being investigated .

name: The Finnish Ministry for Foreign Affairs' visa system SUVI
description: The SUVI visa system consists of two parts: 1. The national part (SUVI in Finland), where member states process visa applications in their missions and national authorities. From the national system, the specified data are transferred to the common visa regime of the Member States (C-VIS). 2. A common visa register (VIS) of the Member States , the legal status of which has been established in the EU VIS Regulation and the technical solutions of which have been agreed between the Member States on the basis of proposals from the European Commission. The transfer of data between Member States concerning individual visa applicants takes place in this part of the system.

name: Technical control of the sea ​​border
description: Continue to modernize maritime surveillance radars and peripherals . The level of technical control of the sea area will be maintained. In addition, the project will develop maritime surveillance software to streamline and speed up operator surveillance work.

name: Development of the SALPA coercive case management system
description: The project will further develop centralized case management of clandestine coercive measures, which will ensure the consistent and lawful use of the methods. At the same time, information processes are streamlined and the conditions for legality control are created.

name: Creating maintenance capability for ship camera sensors
description: Acquired an estimated two-year spare parts inventory for camera sensors, as well as measuring equipment and maintenance manuals. Procurement of maintenance work from MILLOG Oy and / or the importer of the sensor . The selected supplier will be trained in a maintenance course by the manufacturer in Israel. The project does not include ISF-funded maintenance. The project procures spare parts and measuring equipment for the Border Guard warehouse and concludes a maintenance contract. In the future, the service provider will use RVL's spare parts warehouse and measuring equipment.

name: NCC staff costs
description: The analysis staff of the NCC Center produces Finland's national situation picture for the Eurosur system. The NCC maintains and analyzes the 24/7 national situation, the European situation and the common intelligence situation in the border area in the Eurosur information system. EUROSUR is needed to improve situational awareness and response at the external borders of the Member States of the Union, with a view to detecting, preventing and combating illegal immigration and cross- border crime.

name: RUM
description: The RUM project plans and implements the changes to the information systems of the administration of justice required by the Crime Victims' Fees Act . Crime victim charges are imposed through the Criminal Conviction Application (Ritu) and the collection of charges is managed through a fine system (Rajsa). In addition to changes to the information system, the RUM project will renew the fine forms.

name: Police CBRNE Response Development Project
description: The aim of the project is to map and acquire a number of portable measuring devices capable of detecting and identifying threats posed by CBRNE substances for nationwide use by police TEPO / CBRNE teams . The devices are designed for field operations by first responders . The equipment will enable the police to detect, identify and combat CBRNE substances

name: 24/7 helpline
description: The purpose of the project is to design, organize and provide information on a 24/7 helpline for victims of violence against women and intimate partner violence . The target group is vulnerable victims of violence against women and intimate partner violence. The helpful telephone service is free, can be called anonymously and acts as a low threshold service.

name: Further development of the RASTI border control and snapshot application
description: The operational capability of the RASTI application plays a key role in managing the operational activities of the Border Guard in a cost-effective manner. The RASTI application is an application that combines snapshot and risk analysis functions, tactical management and resource planning . The project develops the applications of the Border Guard's functional information system (RVT) as required by operational needs. In the development work of the RASTI system, e.g. the requirements of the Ministry of the Interior's common services, the EUROSUR system, the Police VITJA project, the Emergency Response Centre's TOTI project (ERICA), the authorities' field management system project ( KEJO), the administrative safety net project (TUVE) and the state administration's joint financial and personnel management processes and KIEKU information system. The development of the application and the construction of the RVT / RASTI - KEJO interface will improve the situation of various actors , promote the economic use of resources and speed up management activities.

name: Maintenance of automatic border control equipment
description: The contract for the maintenance of automatic border control equipment ensures the smooth operation of equipment critical to border control operations and a rapid response to possible fault situations. In addition to proactive weekly maintenance and fast response times, the current maintenance agreement with the contractor covers the daily presence of technical support at the airport. During 2020 , in addition to automatic gates , the first batch of self-service kiosks will be installed at the airport and some border checkpoints (manual booths ) will be equipped with facial cameras and fingerprint readers. The new equipment will be covered by a maintenance contract.

name: FRONT WHEELS
description: The project implements the changes required by the introduction of the EES system in the border control application. The border control application RATAS is used for handling passengers at border checks. The application has carried out the checks required by the Schengen Borders Code, taking into account the information and fluency requirements of border controls . The introduction of the EES system will lead to new functions and revisions for this processing , which will have to be implemented in the border control application and its functions will be made more efficient . The purpose of the project is to implement these functions and reforms as well as the interfaces to the harmonized national interface as required by the EES system and the related EES Regulation and the Schengen Borders Code.

name: Public Information Exchange Development Project (KEJO- VITIKE)
description: The project implements the KEJO- VITIKE (increment II) component of the KEJO system , which promotes in particular the integration of the KEJO system into other key authority information systems and develops functionalities that support information exchange, communication, situational awareness and management, and occupational safety. In addition, work on system integration will continue in Increment III . The part related to the project funding application does not include direct personnel costs, only the service of the successful consortium of suppliers and the service related to the implementation of Haltik and Valtor's safety waterways in Increment II and related services.

name: Implementation and development of a cross-border control and snapshot application
description: The aim of the project is to build and develop the RASTI border control and snapshot application, which supports cooperation between authorities and is secure . The RASTI application is a sub-application of the Border Guard's operational information system (RVT), which supports the maintenance of a real-time situation picture, risk analysis and the planning and management of operational field operations . The RASTI application combines information from several different applications and registers , processes it to perform and manage operational field operations, distributes it to users, and stores the information in different information systems for later use. The RASTI application is used to improve the situation of actors , promote the economic use of resources and speed up management activities.

name: Land border control technology
description: Develop the MRTV system (technical control of land borders ) as required by the RVT software, surveillance sensors and changes in operating methods. The coverage and quality of the existing control system will be expanded and technically obsolete parts of the control system will be renewed. Investigate the creation of opportunities for centralizing border control.

name: ETIAS
description: The aim of the Finnish Immigration Service's ETIAS project is to implement the information system changes for the Finnish Immigration Service following the EU Travel Information and Authorization System ETIAS .

name: Effective alert and assistance chain and situation management (THAT)
description: The THAT project is part of the KEJO project, a joint project of the Police, Customs, Social and Health Services, the Border Guard, the Rescue Service and the Finnish Defense Forces, which aims to develop a shared field system that supports the activities of security authorities . ERICA is a nationally networked joint emergency center information system for public authorities . The KEJO and ERICA systems have been implemented as separate systems and the development work of both has been promoted as separate projects in accordance with separate project plans. The aim of the THAT project is to create a functioning alarm and assistance chain between authorities by connecting the KEJO and ERICA systems with an adapter and enable up- to -date situation management. The merger of KEJO and ERICA will enable the transfer of alert information and the resources associated with it to the situation manager without delay and the two-way exchange of information between the actors .

name: Development of the Visa Information System SUVICVIS
description: The project will implement two application versions of the National Visa Information System, with a focus on supporting the functionalities and ensuring the interoperability of the EU -wide Schengen Central Visa Information System . The project progresses through the specification of requirements to the implementation and implementation of requirements. Development of the application version will start in the spring and production will be in the summer of 2017 mainly in VISMAIL functionality and production observations with the new ICD interface. The second application version is started as a parallel implementation in the specifications. The main emphasis is on the implementation of centralized official information, the deletion functionality of the visa application, the completion of the ICD interface change and the new visa sticker change. The project ends when the application versions are in production.

name: SUVICVIS6 project, further development of the SUVI visa measurement system
description: The largest single entity within the project is the changes to the VIS ICD interface specification document published by the EU IT Agency , which are included in the Visa Code Plus project. In addition, the project implements interface changes to improve communication between systems with an external service provider, support for two different biometric data encryption keys, External interface changes , visa sticker layout changes , application archiving functionality , and implementation of any security audit considerations. In addition to these, the requirements arising from the production of the visa system will be implemented ; application deletion functionality, improvement of fingerprint copying functionality, consideration of expiring fingerprints, and modification of SUVI's recorder user role.

name: RVT privacy
description: Define and implement changes to the Border Guard Information System and its applications required by EU data protection law and national data protection laws . The need for change is determined in co-operation between the Legal Department of the Border Guard Headquarters , the Operational Border and Maritime Department, the Technical Department and the system supplier . The changes will be implemented to bring the systems into line with legal requirements. Changes to the core systems of border control and inspection are mandatory and a prerequisite for maintaining border control performance .

name: Fingerprint readers for the implementation of the EES Regulation
description: The project procures fingerprint readers for the police to implement the EES regulation. The aim of the project is to enable the police to check the information in the EES border crossing information system concerning third-country nationals. The project procures fingerprint readers for the police, which, thanks to the information in the EES information system , make it possible to carry out alien surveillance and border control.

name: Register of vessels
description: The project will maintain the Border Guard's analytical capacity in maritime surveillance by continuing to use the proven ship register. Lloyd's list Intelligence is a comprehensive information package on cargo ships, ports or sea ​​areas. Lloyd's database includes about 154,000 vessels, 163,000 companies and 2,800 ports. With regard to ship history, Lloyd`s provides information on the date of construction of the ship to the present, including name changes, changes of ownership, etc. Lloyd`s strengths include a truly comprehensive route history when conducting cargo ship risk analysis . The system has collected the location obtained as AIS data as well as the data confirmed by Lloyd's partners' own observations . The database contains information about the ship's deviation from its normal operating environment or route. In the Vigilance section you can see the analyzes made by Lloyd's analysts. Three Lloyd's List Intelligence licenses are acquired for RVL.

name: Merivene
description: The project will procure three sea or coastal patrol boats for border control tasks. The starting points for the design have been offshore conditions, sea ​​rescue missions and the characteristics required for surveillance in different conditions . The boat can also be used on ice. The boat has a small support vessel. The boat can be equipped modularly depending on the task. The cockpit is designed for a basic crew of three and has a separate workstation to lead the operation as well as space for two stretchers. The boat's evacuation capacity is about 50 people. Maritime, control and communication systems are practical and modern.

name: EXIT 2020 Supporting violent people who want to leave criminal organizations and return from war abroad
description: The EXIT approach to radicalization brings together authorities from different sectors of government and the third sector. The project takes into account the specific issues of the national security threat through local pilots in Helsinki, Oulu and Turku . In addition to the authorities, social and mental health services will be connected to the model . In developing activities with those at risk themselves, it is also necessary to make use of experiments and models developed in other countries in order to obtain the best possible preventive and remedial measures to deal with people who pose this serious threat , promoting reconciliation and social peace. By means of comparative development, a model is created that is described and, if necessary, can be replicated as one tool to prevent violent radicalization . In addition , a nationwide EXIT service will be planned and launched in cooperation with the authorities to support the deradicalisation of radicalized people .

name: WONDER
description: The aim of the project is to strengthen anti- trafficking activities and expertise related to the identification, assistance and preliminary investigation of victims of human trafficking in Finland. The project supports the work of pre-trial investigation authorities by training them on the specific features of trafficking in human beings and the factors related to trafficking in human beings. The content of the trainings will be deepened by a study on trafficking in minors in Finland and comparison countries, on the basis of which two thematic seminars on victims of trafficking in minors will be organized . Work against human trafficking in Finland will be made more visible by revamping the humankauppa.fi website to meet the information needs of pre-trial investigation authorities and civil society about human trafficking and the work of the assistance system. The project will benefit anti- trafficking authorities and civil society actors, as well as victims of trafficking, who will be channeled through the pre-trial investigation authorities and the strengthening capacity of civil society .

name: Optical devices for special purpose units
description: The project develops the performance of the Border Guard in the fight against terrorist crimes. The project acquired in a sufficient amount in accordance with the task need optronic instruments for the Border Guard's special intervention units käyttöön.Tarkkaa the quantity and the quality is not informed JulkL 23.1 § 5 k on the basis of (authority tactical and technical methods).

name: KATI 2 - Further development of SIS II
description: The aim is to strengthen the control of the EU's external borders by developing the N.SIS system so that the overall duration of the international police information exchange can be shortened and the system can be easily maintained and flexibly adapted to changes in operations . Duplication of work and the use of paper documents will be eliminated, as a result of which the investigation of international criminal phenomena will become more efficient, co-operation between authorities and the transparency and usability of information will improve. Electronic document management and archiving saves working time, which also speeds up and simplifies staff work .

name: Improving MRTV II
description: The project will develop the technical capabilities and performance of border control . The project aims to improve the technical control of land borders in several target areas on the eastern border. The focus of the project is to increase the number of cameras and the density of cameras and detectors in the surveillance system. This also requires increased electrical and fiber cabling. The revamped technology improves detection and identification security as well as night vision.

name: Travel Document Certificate Management and Distribution System (PKDIS)
description: To achieve this, the project includes the implementation of a certificate management environment , which includes the establishment of a web-based certificate management system (National PKD, N- PKD), the connection of national chip counting points (approx. 500) to the management system, and the opening of ICAO PKD connections. The management system maintains the list of trusted certificates in Finland, evaluates the reliability of new certificates cryptographically and compiles a list of trusted certificates, the so-called Finnish Master List, which can be distributed to chip reading points or to the international community via ICAO PKD . Software is implemented in the chip reading points , which retrieves the Master List from the management system and opens it for use in the chip reading software. ICAO PKD connections include both upload connections (Finnish certificates to other countries) and Download connections ( certificates from other countries to Finland).

name: Developing the capacity to identify and analyze substances used in CBRNE criminal situations at national level
description: The project aims to develop a national rescue capability and capability to rapidly identify substances used in CBRNE criminal situations (chemical, biological, radiological, nuclear and explosive) in accordance with the EU CBRNE Action Plans and the National CBRNE Strategy. The project will improve first response in CBRNE situations. Developing rescue capability is important because rescue is often the first actor on the ground. Rapid substance identification guides the safe and efficient operation of the entire authority field. To achieve this , equipment for the identification and analysis of CBRNE substances will be procured and deployed in key rescue areas to improve national preparedness. The project has taken into account the operational capacity and role of other authorities in CBRNE criminal situations, so that the overall preparedness and operational capacity develops nationwide in accordance with national and international threats.

name: Realities and stories - anti-trafficking education and information project
description: systematically for almost ten years. However , the assistance system will only be able to support the victim when the victim is brought to the attention of the assistance system or the victim is presented to the assistance system. Not all victims are targeted for assistance, and awareness of the crime and referral to the assistance system still needs to be raised. The project organizes events to increase awareness of the identification of human trafficking and the operation of the victim assistance system in cooperation with the Tampere Film Festival. The aim is to raise the issue on two fronts at the same time. Among the authorities with an expert seminar focus and

name: Outsourcing the reception of visa applications in missions
description: Outsourcing the reception of visa applications to an outsourcing partner in Thailand, China, India and Turkey in 2014-2015 and in 2-3 other countries in 2016. Outsourcing has gained good experience and will be continued to improve the service and efficiency of visa applicants .

name: Heavy - Artificial Intelligence and Software robotics opportunities for exploration and exploitation as part of money laundering and terrorist financing prevention, detection and investigation of the NBI's Money Laundering Clearing House
description: The number of money laundering reports has increased sharply in recent years. During 2016-2018 alone, the number of money laundering notifications and related transactions has doubled and the growth trend is continuous. In practice, manual processing of money laundering reports is no longer possible due to the sharp increase in the number of reports. Deployment of new technologies The potential has been identified in the prevention, detection and detection of money laundering and terrorist financing, and the deployment has the potential to achieve significant effectiveness and widespread impact in both national and international fora. An important part of the project is seen as contributing to the creation of police technological capacity by sharing the knowledge and experience gained in the project in the police organization and by utilizing the results of other police digitization projects .

name: The patrol vehicle fleet renewal
description: The project will procure 16-20 patrol cars, 30-40 snowmobiles and 10-15 ATVs for use by the border guards of Southeast Finland, North Karelia, Kainuu and Lapland at the EU's external border. The vehicles to be acquired will improve border security. Good operational mobility of patrols is an important part of their performance in border security missions . In addition, off-road vehicles can be used to quickly target patrols, for example to inspect objects detected by the technical control system .

name: Common CBRNE I - National CBRNE training for operational actors
description: The Common CBRNE I project prepares for a broad preparedness for future threats by developing current skills in chemical, biological, radiological , nuclear and explosive materials . The Common CBRNE project prepares key public authorities not only for cooperation but also for the development of common and uniform competencies of different actors . The project utilizes the previous development work of the actors and concretizes the studies made in the DECOVY project . The project will produce a future expansion model, in which key players in society will be trained in corresponding security preparedness in CBRNE matters, including the evolving threat of terrorism.

name: Inquiry into open sources of information
description: The project will create an information system that combines the data collection and analysis of information networks open to Customs and the operational information of Customs . The project takes into account the possibility of exchanging information between all PTR actors.

name: Regional training events for civic services
