Rezultaty: Usystematyzowanie w Policji wiedzy nt. handlu ludźmi, przeszkolenie koordynatorów w sposób jednolity, przekazanie grupie docelowej 16-45 lat impulsu służącego obudzeniu świadomości zagrożeń współczesnym niewolnictwem.

name: Fałszywy telefon - zagrożone oszczędności
description: Projekt „Fałszywy telefon – zagrożone oszczędności” podejmuje problematykę związaną ze zorganizowaną przestępczością o charakterze międzynarodowym przeciwko mieniu na tzw. legendę przez 5 jednostek Komend Wojewódzkich Policji (Rzeszów, Białystok, Lublin, Olsztyn i Gorzów Wlp). Celem, głównym, projektu jest upowszechnianie wiedzy na temat specyfiki zorganizowanych oszustw metodą na tzw. „wnuczka” pod różną legenda (na wnuczka, na policjanta, na wypadek) w tym kampanie edukacyjno-informacyjne oraz spotkania bezpośrednie z seniorami na terenie 5 województw. Realizacja projektu zwiększy poziom wiedzy osób starszych o metodach działalności grup przestępczych w zakresie przestępstw, których dotyczy wniosek.

name: Inicjatywa na rzecz cudzoziemców potencjalnych ofiar przestępstw i prewencji transgranicznej
description: Brakuje wypracowanych praktyk międzyinstytucjonalnych w zakresie zapobiegania  i zwalczania przestępczości oraz wspierania ofiar – cudzoziemców. Celem projektu jest zwiększenia skuteczności organów przy współpracy z Wojewodą w zapobieganiu i zwalczaniu przestępczości zorganizowanej o wymiarze transgranicznym. Stworzenie Zespołu poprawi współpracę międzyinstytucjonalną, przyczyni się do wypracowania procedur oraz najlepszych praktyk na poziomie krajowym, jak również współpracy na rzecz zapobiegania przestępczości wobec cudzoziemców. Kolejnym celem projektu jest modernizacja istniejących krajowych systemów technologii informacji i komunikacji, sprzętu i wyposażenia wykorzystywanego do zapobiegania i zwalczania przestępczości. Procedura wsparcia dla ofiar przestępstw oraz rozwoju środków prewencyjnych poprzez utworzenie Punktu Pomocy oraz wydanie poradnika dla beneficjentów projektu.

name: POWER-ON - podniesienie kompetencji Policji w zakresie wsparcia ofiar przestępstw
description: Problem: niedoskonałe formy wsparcia ofiar, niewystarczające kompetencje służb z zakresu wsparcia ofiar przestępstw, Cel projektu: wsparcie działań pomocowych dla ofiar przestępstw oraz zwiększenie kompetencji funkcjonariuszy Policji w zakresie udzielania osobom będącym ofiarami przestępstw. Działania: 1) Blok konferencyjny – 3 konferencje naukowo-szkoleniowe 2) Blok szkoleniowy – 7 sesji specjalistycznych 3) Webinaria – 4 sesje 4) Punkt wsparcia dla ofiar przestępstw 5) Mobilne Centrum Pomocy Ofiarom Przestępstw (MCPOP) 6) Promocja projektu 7) Ocena skuteczności i realizacji szkoleń Rezultaty: wzrost kompetencji służb udzielających wsparcia ofiarom przestępstw, wzrost świadomości i upowszechnienie wiedzy wśród ofiar przestępstw nt. zagrożeń, a także prowadzenie działań wspierających ofiary.

name: FSI - OE5 - Preventing and combating crime - OE5.ON4 C - Support for Victims
description: PT / 2020 / FSI / 508 - SIAD - Integrated Distance Support System

name: FSI - OE6 - Risks and crises - OE6.ON5 R infrastructure
description: PT/2016/FSI/093 ‐ CyberThreat Response

name: FSI - OE1 - Support for a common visa policy - OE1.ON2 Collection of the Union
description: PT / 2018 / FSI / 369 - Training of human resources at consular posts in the field

name: Capacitação Recuperação de Ativos
description: Descrição do projeto - wokshops de cariz prático, através de sessões práticas e de especialização, optando por formação em grupos reduzidos, com prevalência pela abordagem orientada ao caso concreto onde todos os formandos tenham oportunidade de intervir e apresentar as suas perspetivas. Definição de um modelo formativo judiciário e profissional, com especial incidência na forma mais correta de executar nos processos os despachos relativos à definição da dimensão patrimonial do crime, com incidência nos meios de cooperação judiciária internacional.  - Conjugação de saberes, através de colaboração com as entidades que coadjuvam o Ministério Público, em especial o Gabinete de Recuperação de Ativos e órgãos de policia criminal.

name: Cenários NRBQ
description: 1. Realização de ações de cooperação e partilha de conhecimento com quatro forças policiais europeias (França, Bélgica, Espanha e Reino Unido), Europol e a Interpol para avaliação e definição das melhores práticas de Investigação Criminal e obtenção de meios de prova em cenários de incidentes NRBQ. A primeira em Portugal, antecedida por uma reunião com todos os participantes para articulação e preparação. 2. Elaboração um Guia de Procedimentos para intervenção em cenários de incidentes NRBQ que plasmará as melhores práticas de Investigação Criminal e obtenção de meios de prova em cenários de incidentes NRBQ, retiradas das ações de cooperação e de partilha de conhecimentos com outras forças policiais de três estados-membros da União Europeia e um país Europeu, a Europol e a Interpol; 3. Realização de um seminário dirigido aos elementos da Investigação Criminal, da Estrutura Nacional de Criminalística do LPC/PJ, aos países envolvidos nas Ações de Cooperação e Partilha, a países membros da União Europeia e internacionais bem como a Países de Língua Oficial Portuguesa.

name: Sala de Operações de Alerta Rápido e Crises
description: O presente projeto visa disponibilizar uma infraestrutura com as caraterísticas de uma sala de situação a crises e riscos, disponibilizando esta infraestrutura a todas as unidades e organismos que investigam o crime altamente organizado ao nível nacional. Esta infraestrutura terá capacidade para assegurar a coordenação, organização e o controlo das operações policiais em tempo real, garantindo a interoperabilidade com os sistemas nacionais e internacionais relevantes para tomada de decisão na resposta a alertas e crises de grande mobilidade territorial. o projeto prevê a aquisição de equipamento TIC e equipamento operacional.

name: SIAD
description: O projeto Sistema Integrado de Apoio à Distância - proteção e apoio a vítimas de crime está metodologicamente estruturado em três componentes interdependentes, que visam garantir um acompanhamento mais próximo, qualificado e individualizado das vítimas de crime, suas famílias e amigos(as), acionando respostas de emergência, proteção ou de apoio especializado, quer da APAV quer dos profissionais do sistema de justiça, de emergência médica ou outros profissionais com intervenção no chamado sistema de apoio à vítima. Componente 1: Apoio Integrado a vítimas e testemunhas de crime, suas famílias e amigos(as) Componente 2: Formação, Divulgação e Aumento de Conhecimento Componente 3: Software diverso: de gestão de casos / call centre / apoio ao SIAD, etc.

name: Capacitação de Interceção de Comunicações
description: Aquisição do “Hardware” necessário ao aumento da capacidade de armazenamento e processamento, adaptação à tecnologia VoLTE ; - Instalação do “Software” de intercessões customização, adaptando a ferramenta às necessidades técnicas e legais especificas do nosso Pais;  - Desenvolvimento de solução aplicacional de gestão, analise e correlação, de grandes volumes de informação para cruzamento informação, no âmbito da recuperação e gestão dos produtos do crime.

name: Recuperação e disponibilização de informação criminal
description: Aquisição do “Hardware” necessário para garantir a guarda e a recuperação de informação de suporte à Investigação Criminal, após garantir a referida interligação, culminará com os testes de aceitação da solução internos e com os testes de aceitação a efetuar entre a PJ e os diversos OPC.

name: ETIAS
description: Desenvolvimento e implementação do Sistema Europeu de Informação e Autorização de Viagem (ETIAS), em conformidade com o estabelecido no programa nacional de Portugal com vista a receber apoio financeiro do FSI_2014-2020 e definido no Regulamento (UE) 2018/1240 do Parlamento Europeu e do Conselho, de 12 de setembro de 2018, que criou um Sistema Europeu de Informação e Autorização de Viagem (ETIAS). O projeto engloba as seguintes componentes: • Infraestrutura tecnológica  • Infraestrutura e equipamento  • Recursos Humanos para operacionalização  • Serviços de Tradução • Formação

name: Modernização da Infraestrutura da Rede de Pedidos de Visto do MNE
description: O projeto tem 5 componentes: Componente 1- Serviços de consultadoria especializada para levantamento de necessidades e elaboração de Caderno de Encargos da modernização da RPV e posterior acompanhamento da execução do procedimento aquisitivo e desenvolvimento e execução do projeto. Componente 2 - Serviços técnicos especializados de informática para a modernização funcional e tecnológica do sistema de informação da RPV e apoio à produção da RPV e dos seus sistemas conexos. Desenho e implementação da solução adotada, incluindo a manutenção corretiva durante o projeto. Componente 3- Aquisição de equipamento (hardware) de suporte da modernização da RPV. Componente 4- Aquisição de licenciamento e manutenção de software de suporte (ex. base de dados) ao projeto de modernização da RPV. Componente 5- Elaboração e Tradução de conteúdos para o WebSite dos Vistos

name: NSIS_Recast
description: o projeto consiste nas alterações necessárias aos sistemas nacionais, quer o NSIS (Parte Nacional do Sistema de Informação Schengen) e WSIR (WorkflowSIRENE), bem como nos contextos do SIISEF e PASSE, atenta a interoperabilidade dos sistemas e funcionalidades.O projeto desenvolve-se em duas fases, (1) levantamento e análise de requisitos técnicos de implementação, (2) desenvolvimento e integração, compreendendo o desenvolvimento das componentes e customização dos sistemas ás novas exigências.

name: Guarda Digital Plus
description: O projeto está centrado na prossecução de equipamentos terminais para recolha automática de dados e consulta de informação, tendo os seguintes objetivos: •Contribuição para a alimentação de sistemas que podem dar apoio à implementação de sistemas de inteligência artificial •Desenvolvimento de soluções TIC de forma a aumentar a troca de informação institucional e melhorar a capacidade de interoperabilidade entre sistemas internos e externos •Desenvolvimento de SI eficazes para o apoio à atividade da polícia científica •Maior rigor e eficácia no planeamento e execução das operações, valorizando o papel das informações •Prevenir e reduzir a criminalidade e a insegurança, e minimizar os riscos associados, através do incremento dos meios materiais e tecnológicos •Reforçar a ligação à sociedade civil e incrementar a presença e a visibilidade da GNR junto das comunidades locais

name: Aquisição de Equipamentos Operacionais NRBQ para a FEPC
description: Aquisição de equipamentos operacionais para as Equipas de Reconhecimento e Avaliação da Situação (ERAS) da Força Especial de Proteção Civil (FEPC) da ANEPC, para utilização no âmbito da prevenção, preparação e resposta a incidentes nucleares, radiológicos, biológicos e químicos (NRBQ).

name: Laboratórios
description: Projeto pretende obter como resultado: 1. A melhoria da resposta pericial em termos qualitativos e quantitativos;  2. O aumento da eficácia e eficiência da atividade operacional;  3. Proporcionar a informação útil para efeitos operacionais;  4. Proporcionar informação que promova a boa articulação/cooperação entre os vários organismos nacionais e internacionais. Enquanto requisitos para atingir estes objetivos, o projeto prevê a aquisição de equipamentos

name: Modernização da sala de situação e operações
description: A atividade de investigação criminal, em todas as suas vertentes, requer um planeamento rigoroso das operações, bem como uma boa gestão e organização dos recursos, nomeadamente no controlo operacional a partir dos centros de comando e das salas de situação/operação. Este projeto é composto por várias componentes, que compreendem a implementação de uma solução de gestão operacional integrada, e equipamentos tecnológicos de suporte. A implementação de um sistema de gestão operacional, integrando os sistemas internos da Policia Judiciária, permite dotar os centros operacionais e a sala de situação central, de mecanismos de controlo e acompanhamento da atividade operacional, bem como nas situações de emergência e/ou risco que as unidades e os investigadores enfrentam.

name: Capacitação dos recursos humanos dos postos consulares em matéria de vistos
description: O projeto abrange deslocações e a estadia a um total de 13 países com postos consulares portugueses relevantes em matéria de vistos, estimando-se que cada ação de capacitação integre a deslocação de 2 técnicos superiores especialistas em vistos do Mapa de Pessoal dos serviços centrais do MNE, prevendo-se para cada ação uma duração média estimada igual ou superior a 7 dias.

name: AOF
description: Aquisição de instrumentos tecnológicos para agilização dos procedimentos, prevenção e combate ao tráfico de seres humanos e auxílio à imigração ilegal, bem como equipamentos de perícia em termos de documentação de segurança.

name: Substituição e Modernização do equipamento informático da Rede de Pedidos de Visto do MNE
description: O projeto tem 2 componentes: Componente 1- Aquisição de equipamento informático de apoio ao funcionamento da Rede de Pedidos de Visto, designadamente a aquisição de 109 PC's e seus periféricos ( teclado, rato e monitor) e 37 quiosques fixos e serviços complementares de instalação, configuração e formação. Componente 2- Recursos Humanos Mapa de Pessoal do MNE especialista em informática que asseguram a configuração dos 109 computadores e seus periféricos a enviar aos postos consulares.

name: Redimensionamento do Centro Comum de Vistos da Praia
description: O projeto visa a realização de obras de adaptação do imóvel selecionado para instalação do CCV da Praia, já arrendado, assentes num Projeto de arquitetura que observe os requisitos técnicos e normativos Schengen, incluindo os constantes no manual das melhores práticas em matéria de Vistos, assim como as recomendações do Gabinete Nacional de Segurança.  A conceção do projeto teve em consideração as questões de segurança, que incluem a instalação de sistemas de segurança dos espaços e infraestruturas técnicas, nomeadamente sistemas de CCTV, alarme contra intrusão, controle de acessos, sistema de deteção e extinção de incêndios, infraestrutura dos sistemas informáticos e de comunicações, assim como organização interior dos espaços de acolhimento, espera e atendimento dos utentes e o funcionamento dos serviços, incluindo guarda documentos e das vinhetas de visto.

name: Aviso 116
description: O projeto está centrado na aquisição de meios para aumentar a capacidade operacional da GNR na sua missão de vigilância e controlo costeiro, tendo como objetivos: - Reforçar o controlo da navegação marítima; - Reduzir a informação disponível para os grupos de atividade criminosa, através da proteção da cifra do sinal AIS; - Aumentar os níveis de segurança interna nacional e da EU através da aquisição de câmaras de vigilância para uso ao longo da costa; - Ampliar as potencialidades do SIVICC pela partilha dos resultados das observações das câmaras com o Centro de Comando e Controlo Operacional do SIVICC, bem como pela transmissão AIS para as torres SIVICC.

name: Aviso 119
description: A presente candidatura visa na sua génese a supressão de necessidades prementes no âmbito do apoio operacional, nomeadamente através de ações de melhoramento, atualização e substituição de equipamento, tendo em vista os seguintes objetivos: -Reforçar a capacidade nacional na vigilância, gestão e controlo das fronteiras; -Assegurar custos de manutenção de embarcações, de forma a reforçar a capacidade de intervenção em meio marítimo; -Assegurar equipamento operacional utilizado nas abordagens (fatos de abordagem / fatos impermeáveis/ fatos de navegação e controlo).

name: Fronteiras Inteligentes
description: O projeto visa dotar os Postos de Fronteira (PF’s) aéreos e marítimos com material tecnológico diverso como "gates", quiosques, dispositivos móveis, material informático de apoio (PC’s) e a conversão das atuais "boxes" em "boxes" eletrónicas (mini quiosques), potenciando, assim, a sua eficiência, eficácia e fiabilidade em conformidade com as normas comuns da União e a nova estratégia comunitária patente no novo Pacto para as Migrações e Asilo. O projeto implica um conjunto de investimentos diversos, categorizados em numa primeira fase duas áreas principais: •	Aquisição de material tecnológico diverso, como sejam "gates", quiosques, leitores de impressões digitais compatíveis, dispositivos móveis e computadores; •	Conversão de "boxes" "em boxes" eletrónicas;

name: Apetrechamento Tecnológico Operacional

name: SIS Further development
description: The Swedish Migration Agency develops the operational processes and IT systems that are affected by the new requirements in the SIS regulations. The regulations are directly applicable as Swedish legislation and it is the Police Authority that is responsible for the introduction in Sweden. A large part of the information to be stored in the SIS system is created and handled by the Swedish Migration Board.

name: Streamlined IT support for the process of dealing with crime
description: The criminal investigation work within the Swedish Customs shall be made more efficient through the development and implementation of a comprehensive functional and modern IT support. With the new investigative support, integration and automation of vital parts of the Swedish Customs' criminal case process will be achieved. This strengthens legal certainty and administrative capacity, while saving time. A uniform and efficient handling of cases enables more crimes to be solved, preventive work can be focused better and communication, coordination and information exchange with other authorities and countries are improved. The main purpose of the ISF project is to deliver parts of the new IT support in the form of reporting and seizure reporting parts for crime reporting and reporting of suspected crimes (so-called reporting module), and to reach a compatible level with RIF stage one.

name: PNR 2018-2020
description: The project continues the business building of PIU (Passenger Information Unit), designs the basis for related business changes and develops and further develops the IT support required to implement the PNR directive. The work of the project takes place in collaboration with the authorities designated by the government as authorized to use PNR and also with other Member States. Method development continues to streamline PIU's work, Work on testing and connecting more airlines continues and currently 35 airlines are in production. The PNR ordering function has been put into operation and has been further developed based on the business and the customers' needs.

name: EUROSUR II, enhanced operational capability
description: The project intends to increase the capacity of authorities responsible for border control by increasing the ability to base operational activities on intelligence and risk assessments. A generic concept for operational planning will be developed to facilitate national coordination. Contingency plans must be designed to be able to better handle extraordinary incidents with contact with the border administration. The project builds on the organizational structure created in the ongoing ISF-funded project EUROSUR and secures contact routes for information exchange and operational cooperation at national and regional level between the Coast Guard, the Swedish Customs and the Police Authority.

name: Skåne's Quatro Helix - To meet anti-democratic actions and values together
description: The project aimed to increase awareness and knowledge of the underlying causal mechanisms of radicalization and violent extremism. The project's ambition was to create a regional competence, activity and research node in Scania to counter violent extremism, political as well as religious. The project has conducted research meetings, knowledge seminars and published research articles. In the final phase, it was clear that the project could not carry out intended educational activities in schools and it was significantly weakened by one of three municipalities dropping out. But thanks to anchoring and networking regionally and nationally, the project has attracted great interest both in and outside the region. Regional cooperation has been strengthened in the area, as has cooperation with the police and the Crime Prevention Council.

name: Joint learning for common perspectives in social security
description: As risks and crises become increasingly complex and cross-border, the demands for appropriate training in the area of risk and prevention increase. The project has, together with other Swedish authorities and European educational actors, developed a pedagogical platform to meet requirements for interactivity and innovation in educations in the area of risk and prevention. The project has developed new training methods that prepare for and already during the training implement cross-sectoral collaboration. The idea is that increased coordination and appropriate and validated content and methodology in the field of education will strengthen the conditions for individual European actors to develop their ability and thus strengthen internal security nationally and in EU. A research overview has been produced as well as five teaching modules. The latter have been tested in external exercises.

name: SIS II - Development of SIS II in accordance with the new SIS regulations
description: The project implements parts of the IT development required within the Police Authority to meet the new requirements in the SIS regulations. The project is carried out in collaboration with the Police Authority's ongoing ISF project, which handles the development of the authority's operational processes. The police authority is the authority responsible for SIS in Sweden.

name: National educational effort against crime exchange and money laundering
description: The project aimed to raise the level of competence in the judiciary regarding crime exchange issues and the new money laundering crime. The goal was that this would lead to increased efficiency in the work of returning criminal proceeds from criminals and make it more difficult for criminals to retain property arising from crime. Through the ISF, the Public Prosecutor's Office has strengthened prosecutors' knowledge of criminal exchange issues and money laundering. Training for more than 70% of all prosecutors in the country has been completed, a study visit to the Metropolitan Police in London for prosecutors and investigators has been arranged as well as a national Money Laundering Conference. Evaluations show that the participants are satisfied with materials, skills development and education and that the increased knowledge about crime exchange issues and money laundering has already had an effect in the form that more property has been secured and that the number of claims of crime exchanges has increased.

name: 100% EES 2019-2021 - Implementation of Entry Exit System (EES)
description: The purpose of the project is to fully introduce the use of the EEA in all applicable activities. The assignment includes developing the IT support required and introducing and integrating with the central EEA as well as further developing the national EEA. The assignment's work takes place in collaboration with the authorities concerned and with eu-LISA. Purchasing planning has begun and safety analysis and business analysis have been produced. Visits to border crossing points have been carried out and cooperation with other relevant authorities is carried out regularly to ensure that all necessary input is received. Technical development of national systems has begun. On 21 April 2020, the project was granted an additional EUR 1,957,895 in support of further development. A new element in the project is the installation of biometrics stations and self-service kiosks.

name: Distributed management training
description: Through the project, the conditions for management training at MSB's locations Revinge and Sandö have been improved with regard to technical and ICT-based functionality for distributed and hybrid management training, both within the authority and in collaboration with external parties. Distributed training means that the implementation takes place simultaneously in several different geographical locations. Hybrid training refers to a combination of role-playing ("live") and virtual simulation. The project has prepared and tested a technical platform for distributed and hybrid management training, developed scenarios that can be run in existing software and method support for planning, implementing and evaluating scenarios within management training / technical descriptions.

name: Coherent national critical infrastructures
description: The overall goal of the project is to, based on previous knowledge and experience at Lund University, use both research findings and results from previous projects to practically develop, investigate and apply research-based methods in building a national capacity for modeling and simulation of co-dependent critical infrastructures . The project 1) Identifies dependencies and vulnerabilities for interdependent critical infrastructure and societal functions. 2) Involves private and public infrastructure operators in data collection 3) Builds a national knowledge base and increases the understanding of dependencies and consequences of disruptions in critical infrastructures with a high level of complexity and impact on societal functions.

name: and Pilot 2017
description: Through the project, a practice-generated cyber attack on simulated IT and control systems has been implemented. The environment was similar to that found at Swedish nuclear power plants. Relevant authorities and industry participated in the planning, implementation of the exercises and associated evaluations. An exercise in seminar form was conducted in parallel with the simulated cyber attack. During the seminar exercise, responsibilities and roles in management and control functions were discussed and evaluated. The IAEA, the International Atomic Energy Agency, had about 30 observers from different countries on site during the technical exercise. There is interest in conducting similar exercises in other countries. Several of the participating actors have begun an internal work to deal with the development areas identified during the exercises.

name: Implementation and commissioning of ETIAS national unit
description: The project creates an organization and commissioning of the national ETIAS unit and develops other necessary operational processes at the Police Authority in order to be able to handle the new ETIAS regulation. The police authority has been appointed by the government as the main responsible for the introduction of ETIAS.

name: Introduction of new generation biometrics stations
description: Extensive work is underway to develop new working methods and systems for biometric search and matching in both Sweden and Europe. Through the project, the Swedish Migration Agency, which is the authority in Sweden responsible for the national part of the VIS (common EU visa system), has developed Sweden's technical ability to ensure the quality of the information collected and stored in the central VIS system. The project has purchased and installed 159 copies of the new generation of biometric equipment and thus created better conditions for Sweden and other countries in the Schengen area to obtain data of the highest possible quality. The project has thus clearly contributed to strengthening Schengen cooperation, the EU's internal security and thus fulfills the objectives of the national ISF program.

name: VIS-EES
description: The project covers the development of the processes and IT systems that are affected by the requirements of the new EEA regulation. The ordinance is directly applicable as Swedish legislation and it is the Police Authority that is responsible for its introduction in Sweden. The Swedish Migration Agency is responsible for introducing the changes required in the VIS due to the EEA.

name: 75% EEA 2019-2021 - Implementation of Entry Exit System (EES)
description: The project will contribute to improved management of the external borders, prevent irregular immigration and facilitate the management of migration flows. The purpose of the project is to fully introduce the use of the EEA in all applicable activities. The assignment includes developing the IT support required and introducing and integrating with the central EEA as well as further developing the national EEA. The assignment's work takes place in collaboration with the authorities concerned and with eu-LISA. Purchasing planning has begun and safety analysis and business analysis have been produced. Visits to border crossing points have been carried out and cooperation with other relevant authorities is carried out regularly to ensure that all necessary input is received. Technical development of national systems has begun.

name: Radiation measurement
description: The project aims to increase the ability to detect and identify radioactive substances and thereby increase the ability to provide support to the police in the event of terrorist attacks and in other security-related incidents involving radioactive substances. The project's goal is to purchase new hand-held high-resolution instruments for the detection and identification of gamma- and neutron-emitting substances and to put these instruments into operation at SSM's emergency preparedness laboratories. During the spring, preparations for and procurement of the equipment were carried out.

name: Implementation of new SIS regulations at the Police Authority
description: The project is being implemented so that the Police Authority can live up to the new requirements in the SIS regulations. The goal is for the project to develop new working methods and routines internally within the authority and between authorities such as the Swedish Migration Board, the Swedish Customs, the Coast Guard and the judiciary. This includes creating routines for registrations in the SIS with associated biometric data in order to obtain more secure identification of persons who are the subject of registrations in the SIS. The project includes an impact assessment of the regulations' impact on prevailing working methods and structure, the development of new routines and working methods, relevant IT requirements in order to design new functionalities in the IT systems and the development of training programs for border control personnel, among others.

name: Pilot project for Group Violence Intervention in Sweden
description: The project is a pilot where the method Group Violence Intervention (GVI) in 2018 and 2019 was tested in the Malmö police area. The purpose of the method is to reduce incidents of violence, often in the form of shootings, between networks of younger men operating in criminal settings. The method is based on the police, social authorities and representatives of the local community working together. The GVI method has been developed at the National Network for Safe Communities (NNSC), an organization affiliated with John Jay College in New York and has been tested with promising results in the United States. In the present pilot project, NNSC has acted as advisor and support in the analysis and implementation of GVI in Malmö. The project has successfully tested large parts of the method support. In 2020, the implementation process will be evaluated. If the project turns out well, the method will be spread via Brå to other regions in Sweden.

name: IDUM - Proven identity. A pilot for developed ID skills
description: The project develops and tests a method for strengthening the Swedish Migration Board's ID checks at Swedish foreign authorities. The project is a pilot carried out by four foreign authorities. The intention is to introduce results in the form of a method for competence transfer, working methods and routines at other foreign authorities after completion. A competency survey has been carried out and shortcomings that emerged in this have been remedied. The project's ID expert has visited the foreign authorities in Amman, Beirut, Cairo and Khartoum to map the activities and to train the staff. Follow-up shows that the staff's competence has increased.

name: National collaboration - CBRN event
description: The project's goal was to develop and secure Swedish society's ability to handle large-scale incidents with hazardous substances. The project mapped, analyzed and assessed the current national ability to intervene in and handle incidents with hazardous substances. Deficiencies were documented in a report shared with stakeholders. The project results formed the basis for a report with proposals for improved routines and methods for handling CBRN incidents.

name: Preliminary study to develop the Swedish Migration Agency's work with EU visa policy
description: The project was conducted as a feasibility study and covered the following areas; - interoperability - the establishment of an entry and exit system - SIS II AFIS - VIS recast The project analyzed how future ordinance changes will affect the Swedish Migration Board's current and future processes and IT systems. The feasibility study's recommendations then formed the basis for continued strategic development work at the authority. Concrete results of the feasibility study are the applications; VIS-EES, Further development of SIS and Development and introduction of amended VIS regulation. The authority has also designed a new program structure to better address the requirements for process and IT development that these new regulations generate.

name: REINFORCE
description: Protective activities in Sweden today face an increased threat with regard to developments in the business environment. The aim of the project is to document delay times for security doors and protective glass and to dimension and test reinforcement measures and to develop a government-wide standard for the design of physical security. During the spring, the project carried out a first trial round. Safety instruction, safety analysis and training materials have been produced.

name: Anti-UAS - handling threats from unmanned aerial vehicles
description: The project increases Sweden's ability to handle threats and incidents from unmanned aerial vehicles / UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System).

name: Strategic coordination Interoperability regulations
description: The project includes preparations and planning for the introduction of the interoperability regulations. The project aims to hold together the strategic planning to ensure an effective impact of the interoperability packages' law enforcement aspects within the Police Authority. The anchoring internally and externally was initiated on a broad front during the spring, and already in April an impact assessment was prepared for the implementation of the regulations. The project has worked to get all relevant authorities involved and for operational units in the police to be aware of their role in implementation. Extension of the project was decided on 2019-12-06

name: ETIAS IT-utveckling 2020-2022
description: Projektet utvecklar det IT-stöd som krävs för att nationellt genomföra ETIAS (European Travel Information and Authorisation System) i enlighet med ETIAS förordning 2018/1240. Polismyndigheten är utsedd av regeringen som huvudansvarig för införandet av ETIAS. 2021-05-21 beviljades projektet ytterligare 858 692 euro i stöd. Den utökade budgeten ska gå till ytterligare anpassning av nationella system och infrastruktur samt förstärkt IT-utveckling.

name: Upphandling av mobil fingeravtrycksläsare för gränskontroll
description: Projektet ska upphandla fingeravtrycksläsare avsedda att användas med en mobiltelefon och tillhörande applikation för gränskontroll. Projektet genomförs i syfte att uppfylla de krav som ställs i den nya EES-förordningen. Genom projektet möjliggörs på sikt att gränskontroller vid yttre gräns kan genomföras med hjälp av mobiltelefoner, vilket avsevärt ökar flexibiliteten och effektiviteten i gränskontrollarbetet. Polismyndigheten är ansvarig för införandet av EES i Sverige.

name: SIS II - Utveckling av SIS II i enlighet med de nya SIS-förordningarna
description: Projektet genomför delar av den IT-utveckling som krävs inom Polismyndigheten för att uppfylla de nya kraven i SIS-förordningarna. Projektet genomförs i samverkan med Polismyndighetens pågående ISF-projekt, som hanterar utveckling av myndighetens verksamhetsprocesser. Polismyndigheten är ansvarig myndighet för SIS i Sverige.

name: Utveckling och införande av förändrad VIS-förordning
description: Projektet genomför nödvändiga förändringar i Migrationsverkets system och processer för att stödja införandet av den förändrade VIS förordningen och de därmed betingade förändringarna i det nationella VIS-systemet, med undantag för hantering av uppehållstillstånd. Ansvaret för VIS nationellt vilar på Migrationsverket.

name: SIS Vidareutveckling
description: Migrationsverket utvecklar de verksamhetsprocesser och IT-system som berörs av de nya kraven i SIS-förordningarna. Förordningarna är direkt tillämpliga som svensk lagstiftning och det är Polismyndigheten som ansvarar för införandet i Sverige. En stor del av informationen som ska lagras i SIS-systemet skapas och hanteras av Migrationsverket.

name: Genomförande och driftsättning av ETIAS nationella enhet
description: Projektet skapar en organisation och driftsättning av den nationella ETIAS-enheten samt utvecklar andra nödvändiga verksamhetsprocesser på Polismyndigheten för att kunna omhänderta den nya ETIAS-förordningen. Polismyndigheten är utsedd av regeringen som huvudansvarig för införandet av ETIAS.

name: Frontexprojektet
description: Projektet genomför delar av den verksamhetsutveckling som krävs för att uppfylla de nya kraven i Frontex-förordningen. Det är Polismyndigheten, som huvudansvarig myndighet för gränskontroll och kontaktpunkt för Frontex i Sverige, som ansvarar för införandet i Sverige. Projektet genomförs i nära samverkan med andra berörda myndigheter i Sverige. Projektet har tagit fram bemanningsmetod med fördelningsnycklar, bemanningsrutiner, informationsstrategi för bemanning, nödvändiga underlag och villkor för bemanning, konsekvensanalys för implementering av förordningen, etc. Samtliga mål förväntas vara uppnådda vid projektslut.

name: EUPHORIA - Myndighetsgemensam samverkan mot den gränsöverskridande brottsligheten med fokus på EU:s policycykel och EMPACT
description: Projektet stödjer utvecklingen av Ekobrottsmyndighetens, Kustbevakningens, Polismyndighetens, Tullverkets, Skatteverkets och Åklagarmyndighetens arbete med EU:s policycykel i kampen mot organiserad och grov internationell brottslighet. Avsikten är att stärka samverkan och samarbetet inom och mellan dessa myndigheter med särskild betoning på EU:s multidisciplinära plattform mot kriminella hot (European Multidisciplinary Platform Against Criminal Threats, EMPACT). En kartläggning av myndigheternas arbete med EMPACT har tagits fram liksom utkast på myndighetsspecifika och myndighetsgemensamma rekommendationer. Kunskapen om EMPACT i myndigheterna har ökat avsevärt sedan projektstart och projektet ser redan en förbättrad samverkan kring frågorna nationellt

name: EUPHORIA - Joint government cooperation on cross-border crime with a focus on the EU police cycle and EMPACT
description: The project supports the development of the Swedish Environmental Protection Agency's, the Coast Guard's, the Police Authority's, the Swedish Customs, Tax Agency's and the Public Prosecutor's Office's work with the EU police cycle in the fight against organized and serious international crime. The intention is to strengthen collaboration and cooperation within and between these authorities, with special emphasis on the EU's Multidisciplinary Platform Against Criminal Threats (EMPACT).

name: Frontexprojektet
description: The project implements parts of the business development required to meet the new requirements of the Frontex Regulation. The Police Authority, as the main authority responsible for border control and contact point for Frontex in Sweden, is responsible for the introduction in Sweden. The project is carried out in close collaboration with other relevant authorities in Sweden.

name: Påbörja implementering av GVI på fler orter i Sverige
description: Projektet ska påbörja implementeringar av metoden Group Violence Intervention på ett antal orter i Sverige, samt förvalta och utveckla den kompetens som byggts upp inom det tidigare ISF-projektet Sluta Skjut. Tillsammans för ett tryggt Malmö. Målet är att skapa förutsättningar för att testa strategin på flera platser i landet och därmed bygga upp ytterligare kunskap om hur grovt våld kan förebyggas i Sverige. Projektets långsiktiga mål är att få ner antalet skjutningar och sprängningar nationellt.

name: EES, förstärkning av vidareutvecklingen, samt för uppbyggnad av datahallar och integrationer
description: Projektets syfte är att fullt ut införa användning av EES i all tillämplig verksamhet. I uppdraget ingår att utveckla det IT-stöd som krävs och att införa och integrera mot centrala EES samt vidareutveckla det nationella EES. Projektet startade 2019. 2020-04-21 beviljades projektet ytterligare 1 957 895 euro i stöd för fortsatt utveckling samt avtalsförlängning. Nytt inslag i projektet är installation av biometristationer och självbetjäningskiosker. 2021-05-21 beviljades projektet ytterligare 1 038 392 euro i stöd.

name: Automatisk bildanalys
description: Projektet inför metoden automatisk bildanalys inom den operativa utredande polisverksamheten och gör den tillgänglig regionalt. Projektet undersöker även om metoden kan användas inom andra polisiära verksamhetsområden. Avsikten är att effektivisera arbetet och bidra till ett enhetligt arbetssätt. Projektet bygger på resultat från ett pågående ISFprojekt. Projektet har arbetat med att fastställa styrdokument, kravställa uppdatering av it-verktyg, samt påbörjat handläggning av ärenden med metoden automatisk bildanalys (inom området förundersökning). Arbetet med att implementera automatisk bildanalys som regional förmåga har även påbörjats. Utöver detta har utredning av juridiska och tekniska förutsättningar för nya tillämpningsområden påbörjats samt en teknisk studie i syfte att integrera automatisk bildanalys i polisens kameraplattform.

name: Projekt för kontrollanalys
description: Projektet ska stärka Migrationsverkets kunskap om hot, brott och missbruk inom myndighetens processer. Målen ska nås genom etablering av nya arbetssätt och metoder samt utbildning av personal. Projektet har tagit fram dokumentation för ny arbetsprocess, nya rutiner och genomfört utbildningspaket 1.

name: Anti-UAS – implementering och utbildning
description: Projektet vidareutvecklar Polismyndighetens förmåga att hantera hot och incidenter från obemannade flygfarkoster/UAS (Unmanned Aircraft System) och integrerar genom kompetenshöjande insatser och stöd förmågan i Polismyndighetens linjeverksamhet. Projektet bygger på resultat från ett avslutat ISF-projekt. Fokus har varit att skapa förutsättningar för en effektiv överlämning av Anti-UAS förmågan till ny verksamhetsansvarig enhet. Utöver detta har projektet genomfört utbildning för framtida operativ personal, samt genomfört funktions- och leveranskontroller av utrustning och fordon.

name: Förstudie Passenger Name Record (PNR)
description: Projektet har utrett vilket analysverktyg som krävs för att kunna infria PNR-direktivets mål. Projektet är en förstudie, genom vilken Polismyndigheten identifierar och kartlägger de behov som finns hos de behöriga svenska beställarmyndigheterna, inhämtar erfarenheter från andra medlemsstater och går igenom olika analysverktygs tekniska prestanda. Projektet bygger på resultat från ett ISF-projekt.

name: Procurement of mobile fingerprint reader for border control
description: The project will procure fingerprint readers intended for use with a mobile phone and associated application for border control. The project is being implemented in order to meet the requirements set out in the new EEA Regulation. The project will eventually make it possible for border controls at the external border to be carried out with the help of mobile phones, which will significantly increase the flexibility and efficiency of border control work. The police authority is responsible for the introduction of the EEA in Sweden.

name: New ability
description: The police authority has purchased equipment to increase the ability to operate in different environments. The equipment is tested in practice and sharp assignments and reaches expected quality requirements.

name: API-PNR etapp 3a
description: The project has contributed to the work of being able to fully use PNR (Passenger Name Record) in all applicable activities within the Police Authority. The purpose of the project was to deliver the IT support and new activities or business changes required to fully implement the EU directive regarding PNR in the next stage. PNR is an important tool in the work of detecting, preventing and prosecuting terrorist crimes and serious crimes. The operations at PIU (Passenger Information Unit) have been further developed as well as the IT systems used for PNR to meet the requirements and frameworks set out in the PNR Directive. The work has taken place in collaboration with other relevant authorities in Sweden and with other Member States.

name: Purchase of document equipment
description: The project will enable the border police to, if necessary, bring in document technicians at a distance for review of the questioned documents. The project intends to purchase equipment to be placed with the border police in the various regions. The project is expected to fulfill an important purpose in the fight against organized cross-border crime and to contribute to improved and more law-abiding control at the Schengen external border. Prior to the procurement, four analyzes have been carried out; business analysis, legal analysis, impact assessment / information management analysis and security analysis. All of them concern the problem of handling and storing images. During the spring, preparations for procurement were made.

name: Eurosur
description: The Schengen evaluation of the external border in May 2017 reported shortcomings in the activities of the NCC function, the national coordination center set up by each Member State in accordance with the Eurosur Regulation, and the lack of a risk analysis system to support both maritime and maritime border control. air limit. Through the project, the police authority builds up capacity around the NCC function and around the activities related to risk analysis. In addition, the project has developed regional coordination centers that were permanently placed on the authority during the project, and continued the implementation of Sjöbasis.

name: Exposed areas
description: The project develops methods and tools that will contribute to increased ability to deal with the problems that exist in vulnerable areas, with special focus on organized crime. The overall goal of the project is to reduce the criminal normative impact in vulnerable areas and to create sustainable social development that can also counteract criminalizing processes in living environments. During the project, the establishment of permanent camera surveillance has begun, as well as the introduction of drones as tools in vulnerable areas. Development and testing of video analysis is ongoing, as well as methodological support for supervisory work. The latter method package has been extensively tested during the program period.

name: NI Rib
description: The Coast Guard purchases rib boats.

name: The development of a new data center site to strengthen Sweden's internal security, protection of socially important activities and critical infrastructure
description: In the latest Schengen evaluation in 2017, the Swedish Migration Agency was criticized for placing the agency's servers too close to each other. The geographical location of the servers constitutes a vulnerability in the event of disruptions, e.g. sabotage, which could lead to stored information not being accessible and that parts of the business risk being at a standstill for a longer period. Through the project, the Swedish Migration Agency is developing a new data center site at a significant distance from the current site in order to increase the ability to protect socially important activities and critical infrastructure and contribute to strengthening the EU's internal and external security.

name: Handheld sonar
description: The project will improve the authorities' capacity to detect deviations, threats and objects underwater. The goal is to improve safety on and in the sea through new equipment, training and collaboration between authorities. DNC - diving and naval medical center at the Swedish Armed Forces coordinates the project. The project has produced a technical specification between the authorities and to carry out the procurement.

name: Needs-adapted web information for crime victims
description: The Crime Victims Authority has developed a website for crime victims. The guide's most important function is that it helps crime victims to tailor information based on the crimes they have been subjected to, age and where in the legal process they are. The guide shall at all times during the legal process offer victims of crime relevant and clear information. In a previous government assignment, the Crime Victim Compensation Authority investigated how crime victims perceived the information they received during the criminal proceedings. One conclusion of the study was that crime victims often receive a lot of but unsorted information. The most important function of the crime victim guide is to help crime victims to effectively sift through a large amount of information. When the website was developed, a survey was conducted which showed that a majority of users find what they are looking for and understand and trust what is conveyed.

name: Threat modeling and resilience management for critical infrastructures
description: The project focused on electricity networks and developed a prototype that creates an in-depth understanding of risks and dependencies between components in power plants. The prototype facilitates assessment of vulnerability and consequences and can in the long run be used to identify causes of accidents and vulnerabilities that have occurred, as well as identify which scenarios can potentially lead to accidents with a domino effect. The project developed methods for monitoring systems. Due to difficulties in accessing information from private infrastructure owners, the project has used open data. A simulation tool has been developed for validation of methods and algorithms developed in the project.

name: Development and implementation of amended VIS regulation
description: The project implements necessary changes in the Swedish Migration Agency's systems and processes to support the introduction of the amended VIS regulation and the associated changes in the national VIS system, with the exception of the management of residence permits. The responsibility for VIS nationally rests with the Swedish Migration Board.

name: ETIAS IT development 2020-2022
description: The project develops the IT support required to nationally implement ETIAS (European Travel Information and Authorization System) in accordance with ETIAS Regulation 2018/1240. The police authority has been appointed by the government as the main responsible for the introduction of ETIAS.

name: Disposal of identified deficiencies in connection with the Schengen evaluation of Sweden 2017
description: The purpose of the project is to create a change staff that will address and remedy shortcomings identified in the latest Schengen evaluation. The project also intends to develop a new concept for national border police training for staff at the Police Authority and other relevant authorities and develop processes for ongoing follow-up and quality assurance of border control work. During the period, a training forum was formed to develop a national training concept . Action plans for how the authority will remedy identified shortcomings have been submitted to the Commission and a number of the recommendations have been taken into account.

name: Video surveillance of border points with migrant issues
description: 2019-01-01 - 2020-12-31:  With the daily detection of a larger number of illegal border crossings on the entire border with the Republic of Croatia and the consequent greater burden on regional police stations that control the state border, the Police wants to monitor some exposed points with a video surveillance system. Based on the proposed guidelines, initiatives for the establishment of a video surveillance system at certain places (points) were prepared on the basis of the proposed guidelines. Based on these initiatives, a tour of the proposed 38 locations was carried out at the end of 2017. Surveillance at individual border points will be carried out with thermal imaging cameras, high-resolution cameras and moving cameras. Construction of HV systems at certain points on the border, which includes the supply of equipment, installation, installation of towers, installation of equipment, programming, testing and commissioning of the system, the introduction of professional staff to work with equipment.  1. The aim of the project is to install appropriate equipment at all planned locations by transmitting a video signal to the control centers of individual police units. With the installed equipment, state border control, faster response, real-time return, greater coverage of the terrain and constant control of problem points.  2019-01-01 - 2020-12-31:

The aim is to equip police stations for border controls with new police cars and maintain the level of mobility. (2) Replacement of state border control equipment (purchase of explosives and drug detectors (126), vehicle data verification devices (15), magnifying glasses with different light sources (400), spare parts for border control stamps (4000), smuggling detectors (15), procurement of endoscopes, procurement of CO2 detectors and other equipment). The aim is to improve border controls. (3) Procurement of protective equipment for maritime police officers (80) and protective equipment for border police officers. The aim is to bring the equipment in line with the legal provisions on safe work in port and on ships.  1. Equipping police stations with new police vehicles 2. name: Strengthening the fight against terrorism
description: 2016-01-01 - 2018-12-31:  In order to prevent, detect and investigate the crimes of terrorism and violent radicalization in a timely manner, police officers need appropriate tools, knowledge and examples of good practice from abroad. As part of the project, several professional meetings, workshops and trainings will be held with the participation of domestic and foreign experts in the Republic of Slovenia and abroad on the topic of counter-terrorism measures, including the RAN (Radicalization Awareness Network) platform. This will allow police officers to (a) identify in a timely manner the forms of terrorism and radicalization, (b) respond appropriately, and (c) appropriate international police cooperation in this area. Foreign materials will be translated for the needs of police measures.  1. Trained counter-terrorism officers. 2. Ensure adequate international exchange of data and information, good practices in the fight against terrorism. 3. Preparation of materials for the work of police officers in the prevention, detection and investigation of terrorist offenses.

Due to the lack or wear and tear of specific technical equipment, it is necessary to purchase and replace the existing one. To this end, the project will procure equipment (laptops and printers, external disks, software, readers, transaction scanners, telephones, equipment for performing demonstration activities) that meets the conditions, needs and circumstances of the work of units whose primary task is to fight against serious and organized forms of crime.  1. name: EES - Police
description: 2019-02-01 - 2019-12-31:    2018-01-02 - 2020-12-31:    2021-01-01 - 2021-12-31:  The project of establishing a national entry and exit system (SVI or EES) is a European project whose basic purpose is to establish a single European biometric register of third-country nationals (DTDs) entering and leaving and a register of denied entry DTDs at the external borders of EU Member States. These records will make it possible to abandon the stamping of travel documents at border crossings, and to detect persons who exceed the permitted time of stay in the territory of the EU, which will consequently mean a better quality of border control. As part of the establishment of the power system, the Republic of Slovenia or the police carried out: development and integration of the national application solution, development of the mobile solution and other necessary activities for the purpose of integration with the central power system.  1. Establishment of a stationary power system solution and integration with the central power system. 2. Establishment of a mobile power system solution and integration with the central power system.

name: Costs of maintaining video surveillance systems at the state border
description: 2015-07-01 - 2018-06-30:  The police use a variety of technical equipment (high-definition cameras, high-resolution camera management systems, monitors, HDDs, analog cameras, DVRs, ...) in their implementation of state border control. Due to constant use, many defects occur on this specific-purpose equipment. As these are very purposeful and technically demanding equipment, it is necessary to carry out repairs of these equipment with external contractors. The extent and complexity of failures is highly variable. It is also not possible to predict these failures in advance. In the vast majority, these defects are unexpected and are remedied when they occur. In addition to repairs of this equipment, certain types of equipment occasionally require replenishment or. upgrades. In these cases, it is usually a matter of restoring-upgrading "software" equipment or adding additional equipment. All this allows the equipment as a whole to be flawless and up to date.  1. name: Renovation of SIS II - NOV
AFIS
description: 2019-05-06 - 2020-12-31:  The AFIS system is obsolete, the age of the system is 10 years, the recommended replacements of such systems are from 5 to 7 years. Due to the age of the system, maintenance is problematic and the introduction of new required functionalities is not feasible. Therefore, procurement is required: servers, data field, network equipment, software and hardware, and deployment and integration into the existing IT environment. The LIMS system is necessary due to the compliance of the operations of the NFL (Departments of Criminal Techniques at Police Administrations - OKT PU) with the new solution of operations with seized objects and traces. Bar code readers and printers and laptops are required for the purpose of user business with LIMS. The equipment will be procured as part of a public tender, the bidder is unknown. The purchase is therefore necessary due to the dilapidation of the equipment and the introduction of modern business models of the NFL and the Police.  Objective: smooth operation of the system with new technology and standards requirements - compatibility with new protocols for international data exchange, - support for newer standards, - better reliability and availability of the system, - better efficiency, better application results.  2016-01-01 - 2018-12-31:    2019-02-01 - 2020-12-31:  The AFIS system is obsolete, the age of the system is 10 years, the recommended replacements of such systems are from 5 to 7 years. description: 2015-01-01 - 2017-12-31:  The project includes the sending of a police attaché to the Republic of Serbia, to Belgrade, and directing and monitoring the implementation of his activities. The police attaché will perform tasks in the field of police work, which also includes the field of migration and the fight against illegal migration. The Police Attaché will represent the interests of the Ministry of the Interior of the Republic of Slovenia and the Police in the host country and represent the Minister and Director General of Police, promote, promote and strengthen international police cooperation, identify, collect, evaluate, analyze and provide information relevant to the Ministry's work. and the police, monitor the state of public security in the host country and region, and perform other tasks at the discretion of the Deputy GDP Officer or the Chief. The project is partially (50%) financed from the Internal Security Fund.  1. Faster exchange of information and greater responsiveness of law enforcement agencies. 2. Obtaining up-to-date information that is important for the work of the Ministry and the police and is relevant for Slovenia as well as for the entire region of the Western Balkans.  2018-01-01 - 2019-12-31:  Same as above.  Same as above.

name: Maintenance of the SIS II communication interface (SIB)
description: 2015-07-15 - 2018-07-14:  The subject of the project is software maintenance (SIB), for which we have obtained a license in accordance with the contract C1714-06-460467 and consists of the following elements: - Standard treatment of problems using an electronic error reporting tool. - User help desk: this is a telephone connection with the technical staff of the contractor. - Troubleshooting: telephone intervention (tips), interventions via remote access, interventions at our location. The bidder must provide: - maintenance during working hours, Monday to Friday, from 9 am to 5 pm CET; - response time 2 hours; - debugging time 48 hours. - Updating the SIB: the provider must provide a new version each time the SIS II ICD is changed, at the same time as installing the new version on the SIS II Central System and on the test environments.  1. Smooth operation of NS.SIS II  2018-07-15 - 2020-12-31:  The Communication Interface (SIB), which we installed on ITSP in 2007, enables the connection of our national system with Central SIS II (the system is still under development). After one year of maintenance, which was included in the procurement and covered the debugging and delivery of new versions of the communication interface, in accordance with changes to the Interface Control Document (ICD) of the SIS II project, we concluded maintenance contracts to ensure the operation of SIB with maximum availability in operational use.  1. Smooth operation of NS.SIS II. This allows end-users to access SIS data when carrying out border control.  2015-10-01 - 2017-12-31:  The subject of the project is software maintenance (SIB), for which we have obtained a license in accordance with the contract C1714-06-460467 and consists of the following elements: - Standard treatment of problems using an electronic error reporting tool. - User help desk: this is a telephone connection with the technical staff of the contractor. - Troubleshooting: telephone intervention (tips), interventions via remote access, interventions at our location. The bidder must provide: - maintenance during working hours, Monday to Friday, from 9 am to 5 pm CET; - response time 2 hours; - debugging time 48 hours. - Updating the SIB: the provider must provide a new version each time the SIS II ICD is changed, at the same time as installing the new version on the SIS II Central System and on the test environments.  1. Smooth operation of NS.SIS II

Management and maintenance of border crossing infrastructure

name: Special and special equipment for the operation of mobile criminal departments
Purchase of vehicles for cross - border covert surveillance
description: 2018-01-01 - 2019-07-31:    2015-04-01 - 2017-12-15:  Covert surveillance is a covert investigative measure that represents an important and effective form of operational operation of police units for the detection and investigation of serious and organized forms of cross-border crime. A key role in the implementation of this measure in terms of obtaining appropriate evidence in pre-trial proceedings is played by the Secret Surveillance Department in the Special Tasks Division of the UKP GPU and the mobile criminal divisions of the Criminal Police Sectors, which use various vehicles for secret surveillance. Due to the lack, exhaustion and frequent and long-term use of the same vehicles, the renewal and modernization of the vehicle fleet is urgently needed, so the project will procure new vehicles that meet the conditions, needs and working conditions of the Secret Surveillance Department and Mobile Crime Departments.  1. Improve the detection and investigation of serious and organized forms of cross-border crime. 2. Increase the operational capacity of police units to conduct covert surveillance. 3. Upgrade methods and tactics of conducting covert surveillance. 4. Increase the number of cross-border clandestine observations. 5. Strengthen cross-border police cooperation with EU Member States and the Western Balkans.

name: Improving security standards, functions, processes at representative offices in third countries
description: 2018-08-24 - 2020-12-31:  The purpose of the project is to purchase transport vehicles and security and technical equipment that would enable the consular offices of the Republic of Slovenia in third countries to improve security standards and processes in the field of consular and visa matters. With the purchase of vehicles (for the transport of consular equipment, visa stickers, Schengen archives, security and information security staff) and efficient information and communication, audio-video and mechanical protection equipment, security standards can be significantly improved. The project will be implemented gradually and in several phases.  1. Purchase of: - transport vehicles - information and communication equipment, - mechanical protection equipment, and - other equipment that would improve security standards, functions and processes at consular posts in third countries.  2018-01-01 - 2019-03-31:  The purpose of the project is to purchase transport vehicles and security and technical equipment that would enable the consular offices of the Republic of Slovenia in third countries to improve security standards and processes in the field of consular and visa matters. name: Standard consular training
description: 2015-09-01 - 2018-08-31:  As part of the national target, we will strive for fully qualified staff at embassies and consulates dealing with visa applications and a training system in place, which will significantly improve the prevention of illegal migration and the determination of the level of risk in each visa procedure. The conference is intended for the training of consular staff, is held once a year at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Ljubljana for all consular staff and at the listed DKP, the conference is conducted in the form of lectures, simulations, exchange of experiences and practical work.  1. Professional qualifications in the field of the common visa policy 2. Implementation of Schengen standards and exchange of experience 3. Use of new technologies. 4. Qualification of staff to detect forged and falsified documents for the purpose of preventing abuse in visa procedures  2018-09-01 - 2020-12-31:  Within the national target, we will strive for fully qualified staff at embassies and consulates dealing with visa applications and a training system in place, which will significantly improve the prevention of illegal migration and the determination of the level of risk in each visa procedure. name: Preparation and implementation of measures to prevent radicalization
description: 2018-01-03 - 2020-01-15:  Seminars, workshops and expert meetings will be held for the coordinated action of all stakeholders in limiting radicalization. Dissemination of good practices, exchange of data and mutual assistance between different departments for more effective detection of radicalization.  1. Preparation and implementation of measures to prevent radicalization at national and local level in cooperation with competent authorities, including non-governmental organizations and the private sector. 2. Detection of early radicalization. 3. Prevention and elimination of the consequences of radicalization.

name: Establishment of power system - equipment - additional
Procurement of equipment for basic document verification
description: 2017-01-01 - 2019-12-31:  The project refers to the investment in equipment and development of the mobile application "e-police officer - border control". The purchase of equipment includes powerful devices for authenticating documents and devices for machine reading of travel documents. For the purpose of performing border control, we will develop an application for performing border control, which will work on smartphones with the Android operating system. The application will allow the user to log in by selecting the location of the verification and verification tailored to the needs of the border control. An essential part of the mobile verification set are Grabba devices, which are intended for machine reading of travel documents. The device contains the following readers: MRZ (OCRB) reader, RFID reader, fingerprint reader and Smart Card reader. The new application and devices will enable more efficient and faster implementation of systematic border control of passengers.  1. Improved border control and identification of forged documents.  2016-01-01 - 2018-12-31:    2019-01-01 - 2021-06-30:  The project refers to the investment in equipment and development of the mobile application "e-police officer - border control". The purchase of equipment includes powerful devices for authenticating documents and devices for machine reading of travel documents. For the purpose of performing border control, we will develop an application for performing border control, which will work on smartphones with the Android operating system. The application will allow the user to log in by selecting the location of the verification and verification tailored to the needs of the border control. An essential part of the mobile verification set are Grabba devices, which are intended for machine reading of travel documents. The device contains the following readers: MRZ (OCRB) reader, RFID reader, fingerprint reader and Smart Card reader. The new application and devices will enable more efficient and faster implementation of systematic border control of passengers.  1. Improved border control and identification of forged documents.
