Kibernetska varnost omrežja NCKU
PYRODETEC
description: Project is aimed to modernization of the protective and technical equipment for pyrotechnics experts of Institute of Forensic Science. New equipment will contribute to streamline threat and risk assessments, speeding up the actions against threats while minimizing threats to life and health of the experts during the intervention. Furthermore, the project will allow the training for experts and creation of a methodology for working with new technologies. As project is in its early implementation phase, steps necessary to start procurement process have already been taken.

name: Reconstruction of the PCCC Trstená – Chyžne facility
description: Main objective of the project is to reconstruct the Police and Customs Cooperation Centre Trstená – Chyžne, to contribute to effective cross-border cooperation between the Slovak and Polish police forces and other security units of both contracting parties.

name: Modernization and exchange of HW for SIS II national part
description: The aim of the project is to improve the external border protection by modernization and modification of HW infrastructure for SIS II national part. The project implementation will ensure the modernization and exchange of the HW infrastructure in the Data Centre of the Ministry of the Interior of the Slovak Republic where the national part of SIS II is running. Once achieving the required functionality and reliability of the national part of SIS II, the conditions for effective and fast information exchange among the SIS II contracting countries will be improved.

name: Fight against trafficking in human beings and application of preventing tools
description: Project is focused on interviewing victims of trafficking in human beings in adequate environment; modernized interrogation rooms, set up in Eastern and Western part of the country. The other aim of the project is to improve the ability to monitor organized groups operating in the field of trafficking in human beings via modernization of adequate monitoring tools, as well as to improve cross border cooperation through relevant workshops and know-how exchange. Part of the project is dedicated to language courses aimed to LEA to facilitate the cross-border police cooperation in the field of THB. The last component is to upgrade technical tools to investigate and clarify committed crimes.

name: Fight against illegal arms possession and arms trafficking
description: The project shall increase professional capacities to fight illegal arms trafficking as well as to enhance the effectiveness of the fight against serious and organized crime in this area. The project will introduce new tools, methods and procedures in the field of detection and documentation of organized crime regarding arms illegal trafficking by upgrading the national IT system on illegal arms possession and arms trafficking.

name: Methods for prediction of DNA phenotypic properties for criminal proceedings
description: The project is focused on introducing methodology for predicting phenotypic properties of DNA for the purposes of criminal proceedings and the extension of the automatic processes to all divisions of the Institute. New instruments will allow further development of DNA detection tools and methods, will increase the efficiency and effectiveness of DNA analysis at all stages. The project will further enable the development of a methodology for working procedures with new technologies and equipment in line with the requirements of ISO 17015 for the area of criminal proceedings. The project is a follow up of the project with reference SK/2016/PR/0004.

name: Completion and replacement of technical equipment for the exercise of border surveillance
description: The project is aimed at completion and replacement of currently unsuitable and worn special technic equipment – devices for night vision and thermocameras. The equipment is used by the organizational units within the competence of the Bureau of Border and Foreign Police fulfilling assignments in the field of control and surveillance of the external borders of the Schengen area including control of illegal migration and other cross-border crime. Implementation of the project will contribute to creating conditions for more effective performance of tasks in the field of border control, fight against illegal migration, smuggling, criminal investigations related to illegal migration and human trafficking.

name: CHEMIBAL
description: Project is focused on introducing new detection tools and methods in the field of drug and arms trafficking via modernization of specialized equipment aimed to Forensic Science Institute in order to perform expert forensic activities more efficiently. Furthermore, the project will focus on methodology for working with new technologies and equipment in accordance with the international standard EN ISO/IEC 17025, thus contributing to enforce professional capacities of the Institute.

name: MIKRODAK
description: Project is focused on modernization of technologies for genetic analysis using laser microdissection, digital fingerprint comparison and modernization of equipment of the biology & genetic analysis that will enable development of detection tools and methods in the fields of biology, genetic analysis and dactyloscopy, thereby increasing the efficiency and effectiveness of biometric identification performance of the Institute. Furthermore, the project will allow development of methodology with the requirements of STN EN ISO / IEC 17025, thus contributing to enforce professional capacities of the Institute.

name: Replacement of technical equipment for second-line and third-line control of documents
description: The aim of the project is effective education of target groups, especially officers of Bureau of Border and Alien Police and consular staff of the Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs of the Slovak Republic in the area of document examination. The training of target groups will improve their abilities and skills to detect false, forgery and unlawfully personalized documents. The project is focused on upgrade of training room and modernisation of technical equipment for the second-line and third-line control of documents needed for proper training of police officers and consular staff, which will be performed by qualified forensic experts of Institute of Forensic Science.

name: Hardware equipment for consular offices in relation to functioning of national VIS and its connection to Central VIS
description: The main objective is to ensure the functionality of national visa information system (NVIS), replacing hardware components of the central part of NVIS and the national interface and replacing hardware components of NVIS on the Slovak diplomatic missions abroad. Implementation of this project will ensure the modernisation of information technology, N-VIS high availability and reliability, increase the effectivity of the centralised information system concerning the issuance of visas, strengthening of the consular and visa duties in foreign countries of MoFEA SR capacity to supervise N-VIS in the SR.

name: Extension and update of Europol communication tool to dedicated units of the Police
description: The Europol National Unit of the Bureau of International Police Cooperation of the Presidium of the Police Force is acting as a liaison body between Europol and the Police Force of the Slovak Republic and other Slovak law enforcement authorities. The aim of the project is to extend communication channel to dedicated police units.

name: Create professional capacities to fight cybercrime
description: Project is aimed to establish fully functional and standardized Cybercrime Unit, in compliance with the European centre for fight against cybercrime operating within Europol. Established unit, including the trained experts will contribute to an increased level of prevention and fight against cybercrime more efficiently.

name: Education of border and foreign police officers in English, Russian, Ukrainian language
description: The aim of the project is to achieve the enhancement of language skills in English, Russian, Ukrainian language of the officers of the Bureau of Border and Foreign Police of the Presidium of the Police Force. Educational process is focused on the specific needs/vocabulary/terminology of the Police Force (Schengen acquis).

name: Modernization of IT system BDC
description: Aim of the project is to ensure a higher level of readiness of LEA and better cooperation of security and crisis units via modernization of existing national IT system Bomb Data Centre (BDC). The system will serve for data collection and identification of incidents and used explosives. Procurement process on HW and SW was successfully completed. The testing of upgraded system, including the respective training activities were finished in July 2019. The project is expected to be completed by the end of 2020.

name: Building the process of collecting PNR data
description: Aim of the project is to provide material and technical equipment to the PIU for effective cross-border cooperation in the field of collecting and analysing PNR data and information exchange with the relevant PIUs of other EU Member States, and to enforce professional capacities of the PIU staff for efficient information search and processing of acquired data.

name: Modernisation of IT system EVIDENCE
description: The project is focused on strengthening the capacity of the Institute of Forensic Science for information exchange at national and international level via modernization of the current technology in order to increase the information security of the IT system. Aim is also to establish a training room for forensic experts and crime-scene technicians.

name: Enhancing the institutional capacities of the DNA laboratory
description: The project was focused on strengthening the capacities and increase the efficiency of the international exchange of DNA profiles, via modernization of equipment for automated DNA laboratory analysis as well as via introduction of ISO standards and accreditation in the sense of standards ISO 17025. All set objectives were fulfilled; standards in line with the ISO 17025 were introduced and the process of DNA analysis is automated. The project finished in November 2018.

name: Secondary Vocational School of the Police Forces Bratislava
description: Aim of the project is to adopt a methodology on identifying crime in the area of trafficking in human beings into the professional police education and training. In order to increase the qualification of police officers concerning trafficking inhuman beings, the accredited police training has been provided, using the training manual. 13 professional courses were organized with participation of 299 police officers. Training for trainers has also been provided; with 25 trainers trained within the set module. The international symposia was organised in October 2019 in Bratislava, with participation of 50 experts from the field of THB from different EU countries. During the symposia, the project main outcomes were presented, including Exchange of best practices and know-how in the field of prevention and fight against trafficking in human beings.

name: Replacement of technical equipment for document examination
description: The project is aimed at replacement of special technical equipment used in the performance of border control. Implementation of the project will contribute to creating conditions for more effective performance of tasks in the implementation of second-line border control and of tasks in the area of expert examination and elaboration of expert opinions within the process of detection and documentation of detected cases of counterfeiting and forgery of travel and other documents.

name: Purchase of vehicles for specialized units of Financial Administration
description: This project is focused on supporting and expanding the existing capacity in the management of external borders as well as on supporting the extension of the measures in the area of the free movement of persons related to the management of external borders. Three types of the vehicles are planned to be purchased – off-road vehicles, pick- up vehicles and passenger cars.

name: Modernization of IT systems AFIS/EURODAC and CODIS
description: The project is focused on strengthening capacity and information exchange by modernization and upgrade of IT systems and networks to ensure their compatibility with other IT systems. Main objective is to upgrade the system to process and exchange fingerprint and DNA data to prevent and combat serious and organized crime and to increase cross-border exchange of fingerprint and DNA data. The project is in its closing phase.

name: Enhancing of expertise staff of Institute of Forensic Science of Police Force
description: Project is focused on increasing the professional competence of the Forensic Institute staff via International Symposium and workshops focused on exchange of experience and know-how in the field of forensic science. During the project implementation, two Symposia were held in Bratislava, attended by forensic experts from 20 different European forensic institutions; with focus on practical examples of forensic science. Also eight TRIADA workshops were held (during the period April 2018 until June 2019), attended by forensic professionals from Poland, Czech Republic and Slovakia in order to discuss issues linked to DNA analysis (from bones), forensic chemistry (drugs analysis), ballistics and trasology and other forensic related aspects.

name: Implementation of tools/methods for the fight against drug related/pharmaceutical crime
description: Project contributes to prevention and fight against drug production, drug trafficking and illegal production and trafficking in medical and pharmaceutical products. Aim is to increase the professional capacities of the Police Force units and members of the Financial Administration of the Slovak Republic in the field of fight against drug – related and pharmaceutical criminality. Other aspect of the project is to set up and implement unified procedures and methods for detection of pharmaceutical criminality as well as modernisation of technical equipment for detection, transportation and storage of drug evidence.

name: Introduction of new technologies for the pyrotechnic activities within the Ministry of Interior SR
description: Project is aimed to modernization of the material and technical equipment for the members of Bomb Disposal Unit (BDU) of Police Forces. New technologies and devices will contribute to streamline threat and risk assessments. Furthermore it will help to increase effective threat assessment and decrease the response time and minimize potential threats to the life and health of interfering police officers. The project contributes to the increase of competence of BDU police officers by creation of new methodology for working with new technologies and equipment.

name: ABC Gates - Automated Border Control System
description: The project is aimed at procurement of an automated border control system - ABC Gates, which will enable the automated performance of border control of European Union citizens when crossing the external border of the Slovak Republic at the international airport of M. R. Štefánik in Bratislava. The implementation of the project will also provide an autonomous information system for management of these ABC gates with user authorization, logging, management with integration to the information systems of the MoI SR and application software.

name: Modernization of HW and technical equipment for National SIRENE, INTERPOL and PPCs/PCCCs
description: The project is focused on upgrade HW and technical equipment for the units of international police cooperation operating in the Slovak Republic, in order to ensure the required functionality and reliability with other respective units, as well as the continuous information dataflow with foreign partners and the relevant state administration authorities in the area of crime detection and prevention.

name: Strengthening the capacity to fight against illegal handling with CBRN materials in SR
description: The aim of the project is to streamline the detection, documentation and investigation of illicit handling with hazardous CBRN materials. The objective is also to extend the current information system - ENVIRO for collecting, storing and analysing data related to cases of illegal handling with nuclear and radioactive materials. The system will be extended by data on cases of illegal handling with hazardous chemical and biological substances. The other project component will contribute to capacity building by providing training for police officers, prosecutors and judges in the field of detection, documentation and investigation of criminal cases related to illegal handling with CBRN materials. Within the project, a portable training laboratory designed for the production of hazardous CBRN materials will be created, to conduct trainings in a more effective way, especially by focusing on practical aspects of documenting CBRN illegal activities directly at the crime scene.

name: Modernization of technical support for effective fight against crime
description: Aim of the project is to modernize the aviation support of the Unit for the Special Police Activities; to increase the overall level of prevention, detection and documentation and enhance the investigation and prosecution of criminal offences, in particular in the field of cross-border, serious and organized crime.

name: Special interviewing rooms for child victims and other particularly vulnerable victims of
description: The aim of the project is to set up 15 special interviewing rooms for child victims and other particularly vulnerable victims of crime, including a training room, in order to reduce the risk of secondary victimization of crime victims in the criminal proceedings. Project also includes training activities aimed to investigators. These activities are focused on practical aspects of the investigation process led/ conducted by LEA, e.g. how to deal with child victims, how to approach them during the investigation process, etc. The trainings are led also by experts-psychologists, in cooperation with the experts from the Academy of Police Forces.
